loans.name: Gloria David

texts.pt:
Gloria is a single mother of 2. She lives with her children and a few nephews. She is now entering the loan program. She would like to use the loan money to strengthen her business selling wrap skirts and children’s clothing. Gloria’s children attend school. She would like to save money to invest in their education. The father of one of her children built her a small house, and she would like to expand it a bit with her future earnings. However, her children’s schooling is a priority.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria e solteira e tem 2 filhos. Ela vive com os seus filhos e alguns sobrinhos. Ela esta a entrar agora para o Programa de credito.Ela quer aplicar o dinheiro do emprestimo para reforcar o seu negocio de venda de capulanas e roupa para criancas. Os filhos de Gloria estao a estudar. Ela quer juntar dinheiro para investir na educacao dos filhos. Uma vez que o pai de um dos filhos lhe construiu uma casinha ela ira amplia-la aos poucos com os futuros rendimentos . Mas a prioridade e a escola dos filhos.

loans.use: Gloria would like to use the money to buy more clothing for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more merchandise for this high sales season.

loans.name: Shah Agha

texts.en: Shah Agha lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is uneducated and has 4 children. He has a retail shop and has been in the retail business for the past 5 years. He has attracted a good numbers of customers and now he would like to expand his business so he is requesting an individual loan to complete his stock and make a good income for his family and enroll his children in a better education center. He is happy with all members of his family.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Magin

texts.es:
Magin is a 45 year odl master mason and also is dedicated to his business of renting land. He works in construction in the city and also rents out some rooms of his house for secondary income. He lives alone with his 16 year old daughter. She is totally dependent on him. He has more than 10 years of experience in his field and does not depend on hiring workers because of the high migration of workers to the exterior part of the country. This is Magin's third operation [loan] from his time with the Institution. In this time, he has demonstrated himself as a very punctual and responsible person.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

Magin es un maestro albañil de 45 años de edad, paralelamente se dedica al negocio de los alquileres. Trabaja en diferentes tipos de obras de construcción en la ciudad y también alquila cuartos en su domicilio como segundo medio de ingreso. Vive sólo con su hija de 16 años que depende totalmente de él. Tiene mas de 10 años de experiencia en su actividad como albañil y no cuenta con mucha competencia ya que debido a la migración de mano de obra a paises del exterior, la que queda en el país es bastante cotizada. Actualmente esta operación es la tercera de Magin con la Institución tiempo en que demostró ser una persona muy responsable y puntual.

loans.use: To expand the hosue.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
It has been years since Mr. José is a driver. He is the owner of a taxi. Mr. José is a hard working man since he has four children. He desires to offer them a proper education, therefore, he is requesting a loan to acquire a similar taxi, in order to lease it and in that way increase his income and his family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor José, se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace mucho tiempo, ya que es propietario de un mototaxi, él se esfuerza mucho porque es padre de 04 hijos, su deseo de brindarles una adecuada educación lo conducen a solicitar un préstamo para adquirir una herramienta de trabajo similar a fin de otorgarla en alquiler e incrementar la economía y calidad de vida de su hogar.

loans.use: To buy a taxi

loans.name: Istiqomah

texts.id:
For the sake of her food kiosk business, Istikomah lives in her kiosk in Dermaga Pangembangan area, West Bali. Her regular customers are fishermen who just come back from the sea. Her kiosk opens 24 hours because there are always customers who come to the kiosk. The most crowded time is around 2pm to 8pm when fishermen just arrive in the shore and they directly go to her kiosk for having breakfast or buying take-away food. When DINARI entered the area, Istikomah was fortunate to get a loan from DINARI. She uses the loan for buying the raw materials for her food kiosk. She usually buys the food materials in the market. Her net profit can reach Rp. 100,000 per day when many customers come to the kiosk and during the fish season. Istikomah uses the profit for helping her husband and for adding her family's income.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Demi menjalankan usaha warung nasinya, Istikomah rela menginap diwarungnya yang ada disekitar Dermaga Pengambengan, Bali barat. Pelanggan warung nasinya adalah para nelayan yang baru tiba dari laut setelah mencari ikan di laut lepas.Warung dibuka selama 24 jam karena ada saja pelanggan yang datang berbelanja di sekitar dermaga. Saat- saat paling ramai adalah pukul 14.00 s/d 20.00 wita setelah nelayan sampai di darat dan langsung ke warungnya untuk makan pagi setelah semalaman melaut maupun untuk bekal makanan dalam bekerja ditengah laut untuk mencari ikan. Pelayanan Yayasan DINARI sampai di daerah tersebut dan akhirnya Istikomah mendapat kepercayaan dan memperoleh dana pinjaman. Dengan dana pinjaman tersebut Istikomah pergunakan untuk menambah modal usahanya yaitu untuk berbelanja segala keperluan usaha warung makannya.untuk berbelanja lauk pauk yang dilakukannya hari dipasar. Keuntungan bersih dalam sehari mencapai Rp.100.000.- jika situasi sedang ramai dan musim ikan. Dari keuntungan inilah Istikomah dapat meringankan beban suaminya untuk menambah pendapatan keluarganya.

loans.use: To add more capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth is a young woman with many overcoming wishes. She is an entrepreneur and this quality has allowed her to live comfortably and support herself. She has opted to devote herself to rearing of animals. At the same time, she is preparing to become a successful professional. She wishes to improve the rearing conditions in her small stable and for this reason, she is requesting a loan. .

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Elizabeth, es una joven con muchos deseos D. superación, es emprendedora y esa cualidad le permite vivir cómodamente y auto sostenerse, ha optado por dedicarse a L. ganadería y a L. vez se está preparando para convertirse en una profesional D. éxito. Desea mejorar las condiciones D. crianza en su pequeño establo y a esa razón atienD. su petición.

loans.use: Improve the conditions in her small stable.

loans.name: Yhasmira

texts.es:
Yhasmira is a very intelligent and exemplary young woman. Not long ago she has finished her advanced studies and is already practicing as a teacher with great responsibility and professionalism. She feels very happy and proud, because with the unconditional support that her loving parents gave her, she was finally able to realize one of her greatest dreams. At this time, Yhasmira stands before you with the attempt to touch your generous hearts and request a loan with which she plans to help her parents in their business of selling logs and firewood. Thanks to this investment they can improve the quality of their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Yhasmira, es una joven muy inteligente y ejemplar, hace poco tiempo concluyó sus estudios superiores de educación y ya viene ejerciendo con gran responsabilidad y profesionalismo su labor de maestra, ella se siente muy contenta y orgullosa porque gracias al apoyo incondicional que le brindaron sus queridos padres pudo finalmente concretar uno de sus grandes sueños.En esta oportunidad Yhasmira se presenta ante vosotros para tocar vuestros corazones generosos y solicitarte un préstamo con el que tiene planeado apoyar a sus padres en su negocio de venta de troncos y leña, gracias a dicha inversión mejorarán su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Investment of money in the family business

loans.name: Talaleomalie

texts.en: Talaleomalie F., 35, is married with 2 children. She has 4 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and public 4 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 800 Tala (~333 USD). SPBD loans are Talaleomalie’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used to renovate her house. Her husband does all the farming.

loans.use: Purchase equipment needed for the business.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is married with a five year old child. She sells chickens. Every day she works from 6am to 6pm and earns a monthly profit of about $300 from her sales.

Magdalena now hopes for a loan to buy more chickens for her business to increase sales.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for her business to increase sales.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María is 63, is divorced, and lives with her daughter Lourdes, who is 23. Her other children, Nancy, AyD., Hedí, and Berta have their own families and jobs.

She sells food in the small store that she has in her home. With 2 years of much effort, she managed to strengthen her business to generate income and to support her extended family. Since she separated from her husband, she has worked all day in her store, an activity that she likes a lot and that alieves some of the pain of the separation. On the other hand, it is difficult to work alone. With the help of her daughter Lourdes and the unconditional support of her other children, María moves forward day after day.

With the money from the loan, she wants to expand her store by purchasing more products and with time convert her store into a bazaar.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

María tiene 63 años, está divorciada, vive con su hija Lourdes D. 23 años, ya que sus demás hijos Nancy, AyD., Hedí y Berta ya tienen sus respectivas familias y trabajos.

Se dedica a la venta D. comestibles en la pequeña tienda que tiene en su casa, con 2 años D. mucho esfuerzo logré consolidar su negocio para generar ingresos y poder mantener a su extensa familia.DesD. que se separó D. su esposo se ha dedicado durante todo el día a su tienda, actividad que le gusta mucho, ya que en cierta medida aliviana la pena D. su separación, por otro lado, lo más difícil es sentirse trabajando sola. Con la ayuda D. su hija Lourdes, y el apoyo incondicional D. sus otros hijos María sale adelante día a día.

Con el dinero del préstamo quiere expandir su tienda comprando más productos, con el tiempo implementar su tienda y así llegar a ser pronto un bazar.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of products in her store

loans.name: Alasa

texts.en: Alasa Logai, 40, is married with 5 children. She has many years of experience in the plantation business of farming taro, yams, and bananas. She sells to the village and general public 3 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD). SPBD loans are Alasa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her earnings will be use to improve business and help out with the family. Her husband and children do the plantation too.

loans.use: For business improvement and to help pay her childrens' school fees

loans.name: Tha

texts.en: Mrs. Tha S., 34, earns about $1.25 per day as a grocery seller in her village in the Prasat Commune of the Kampong Thom province. She is married, with two children living at home. Her husband, Mr. Phoeurn Chhem, 29, is a motorcycle taxi driver in the Siem Reap province, which is a tourist area. He has been driving a taxi since 2004, and normally earns about $10 per day.  Because he has an old motorcycle, her husband's business does not attract as many customers, so his income is less and he often must pay for repairs. Tha needs a loan of $375 to purchase a new motorcycle to attract more customers to her husband's business.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle to attract customers to her husband's taxi business

loans.name: Nathalie

texts.en:
Nathalie G. was born in Abomey on June 6, 1978 and is married to Joseph Lima, a Civil Administrator. She has two children in school. She has sold fabric and basins for the past six years, and she grew her client base with the first two loans. To further develop her business, she will be purchasing more fabric and basins.

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

Translated from French:

Née le 21/06/1978 à Abomey. Elle est mariée à Lima Joseph (Administrateur civile) et est mère de 02 enfants dont un scolarisé. Elle est dans la vente de tissus et de bassines depuis 06ans.Avec son premier crédit, elle a su fidéliser sa clientèle ce qui a fait accroître la demande de cette dernière. Voulant satisfaire à la demande de sa clientèle, elle sollicite un crédit de 150000 f CFA.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and basins.

loans.name: Juliet Kanakulya’S Group

texts.en: Juliet is a leader of 5 members of a group.  She is 37 years old and married with 4 children aged between 17 and 10 years. All of her children go to school. Juliet takes care of five additional family members and her old parents. She resides and owns a four-room house where she is staying with ten people. They have electricity and no piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day. She works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She doesn’t incur any transport costs since she buys from delivery vans .Juliet operates from her home and doesn’t rent her business premises in Kasubi, one of the city suburbs, and works seven days a week.  Juliet has been with MCDT for four years working all this long time with the same group members and servicing her eighth loan. She wants to invest this loan in a firewood business in order to supplement her income.  Juliet is aspiring of going to the villages to get charcoal directly from producers.

loans.use: To invest it in firewood

loans.name: Claudia Mercedes

texts.es:
Esta Empresaria de Nombre Claudia Mercedes Q. V. tiene la edad de 39 años, su estado civil es soltera, Claudia tiene 1 hijo de 12 años y cursa recientemente el 2 año de secundaria, los propósitos son seguir manteniendo la fuente de ingresos para su hogar y mantener su clientela  ya que ella es madre soltera y es la única que aporta para su familia ya que ha tenido que trabajar fuerte para sacar adelante a su hijo por lo que la situación no le permite trabajar en un lugar donde obtenga mas ingresos los deseos son expandir su negocio para dejar de vender de forma ambulante y establecer una tienda en su propia casa de habitación sus sueños son de formar integralmente a su hijo y que logre coronar una  profesión con la cual se pueda valer y que el día de mañana responda ante las necesidades que se le presenten también quiere dejar de ser subordinada para dedicarse en tiempo completo a su negocio.


La actividad económica a la que Claudia se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general como: cosméticos, bolsos, zapatos, perfumes, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 7 años, ella inicia este negocio al encontrarse sola, abandonada y sin contar con alguna ayuda por lo que el dinero no le abastecía para su hijo y para los gastos del hogar así que ella tuvo que buscar la manera de subsistir, desde entonces a sobresalido ante ciertos obstáculos de la vida y espera seguirlo haciendo a través del financiamiento pues este será un respaldo para su inversión por lo que el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por que debe comprar un sin numero de productos como son: reloj, pulseras, pendientes, ropa entre otros ya que tiene que viajar hasta Managua, Chinandega y León en busca de estos para satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This entrepreneur is called Claudia Mercedes Q. V.. She is 39, single, and has a 12-year-old son in his second year of high school. She aims to keep making money and maintain her customer base as she is a single mother and the only person working in her family. She has had to work hard to raise her son as her situation does not allow her to work where she would make a higher income. She wants to expand her business, to stop working as a street vendor and to open a store in her own home. She dreams of educating her son, that he will have a career to fall back on so that he will be able to take care of himself. She also wants to stop working for others; she wants to dedicate herself full-time to her business. Claudia sells a variety of goods such as cosmetics, purses, shoes, perfumes in the street. She has been a street vendor for seven years. She started this business when she found herself alone, abandoned and unable to count on anyone else's help. There was not enough money to care for her son and her household expenses: she had to find a way to survive. Since then, she has overcome a number of obstacles and she hopes to make progress with the help of this loan, which will be working capital to buy a number of products such as watches, bracelets, earrings, clothing among others for which she will have to travel to Managua, Chinandega and León to satisfy her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Na Yul Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eleven people living in Phnom Touch village in Kampong Cham province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Na Y., the 34-year-old village bank president, is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and re-sell later at a better price. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more rice to re-sell to earn more profit. She is a widow with two children who are enrolled in the local school. 

Ten members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy rice to keep in stock and re-sell later at a better price.

loans.name: Muzayam

texts.en:
S. Muzayam is the humble mother of a family with two children and she works hard to educate them. She has worked in agriculture, along with her husband, for 5 years, to generate the family’s income. They work hard at growing vegetables, which they sell in the market. Last season was very productive, and after much effort, they had achieved a big harvest. Her husband went the market to the sell the crop of their labor. Currently Muzayam’s family has a financial problem and she needs help. The family wishes to continue planting vegetables and increase their capital to purchase more seed and fertilizer. For this purpose, Muzayam and her family is requesting a loan with which they would be able to improve their quality of life. Let’s help this family to remain strong and united. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua F. is 40 years old. She is a married with seven children, five boys and two girls. All her children are in school--from the primary level to senior high school. Her husband is a steel bender and Akosua works to help supplement her family's income. The family lives in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Akosua's business is in second-hand textiles. She buys bales of second-hand clothes from Kumasi and sells them in her community. She has been in business for 5 years. Akosua would like a loan to procure more clothing and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is a sixty-two-year-old widow with five children. She says all her children are grown ups and living independently. She lives with some grandchildren in a family house in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Mary is a trader. She trades in plastic products such bowls, cups, buckets, etc. She buys the goods from wholesalers in the nearby towns. Mary treks to other towns to sell her products on their market days. She says she also sells at the market square in her community. Mary also trades in other products such as scrubbing brushes, calendars, etc. She has been in this business for 40 years and wants a loan to buy the goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy plastic products for sale.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a hog raiser while his wife works as an employee in a non-governmental organization in Solano. Through his wife, he was able to learn about ASKI—the MFI providing the loan. Thus, he was motivated to borrow a loan of PHP 15,000 that he needs for his piggery business. He plans to use the loan to buy additional piglets and feed supply. He believes that he can increase his income with the financial support of lenders and improve his business.

Julius and his wife Anna Leah have two children and live a happy life in the village of Manamtam Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. The couple strives hard for the future of their children and also to save enough to achieve their dream of having a progressive life.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets and feed supply

loans.name: Qaranfil

texts.en:
Qaranfil Q. is a 30-year-old woman who keeps cows for milk and calves for meat production. She has six years of experience in this field. She is a school teacher in the local school and is married with two children.

Qaranfil started her business when her and her husband’s salary wasn’t enough to cover their children’s basic needs. Now she would like to expand her business and for this purpose she applied for a $1,500 loan to purchase three more calves for breeding. As summer is a high season for wedding parties she counts on selling fattened calves for higher prices. Qaranfil and her family are  counting on you for help.

loans.use: To purchase three calves

loans.name: Charito

texts.en: Charito L. is from the village of Biasong. She is 42 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. Charito owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling clay products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month. In 2004, Charito joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Charito is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be her 9th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Đặng Thị

texts.en:
Thúy Đặng Thị (228080724) is a 50-year-old female living in the town of Gia Lộc. She is married and has three school-aged children.

Thúy owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over twelve years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month.

In 2008, Thúy joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Thúy is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 2nd from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Egamkul

texts.en:
A. Egamkul is a very loving father, devoted to the needs of his children, whom he adores. He works raising livestock and every morning leaves home to take his animals to pasture in the surrounding area. His desire is to improve the quality of his animals but in order to do this, he would need to purchase livestock of better breeds, and these animals are very costly. He needs a capital of 1000 USD, and at the moment he does not have that much money so he is requesting this loan. Egamkul hopes that you trust in his hard work and honesty.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Exaltacion

texts.en:
Exaltacion D. is a 58-year-old widow and the mother of three children. She has a small rice farm which is 1 hectare (2.5 acres) in size. She dreams of making it more productive in honor of her parents who gave her the farm.

Now, Exaltacion needs a little help to keep going with her business. She would like to apply for a loan of Php 5,000 to purchase two bags complete fertilizer and chemicals.

Exaltacion chose CEVI because of its services. CEVI provides not just loans but education as well to enable entrepreneurs to manage their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase two bags complete fertilizer and chemicals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk for her grocery

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: EL SEÑOR ALBERTO O.  A.,TIENE COMO ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL LA VENTA DE MOTORES Y REPUESTOS DE AUTOMOVILES; EL CREDITO LE SERVIRA PARA  INCREMENTAR SU CAPITAL DE TRABAJO, YA QUE PIENSA AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO CON LA COMPRA DE ACCESORIOS PARA MOVILIDADES, ES CASADO TIENE 4 HIJOS, A LOS CUALES LOS HACE ESTUDIAR, AL MAYOR EN LA UNIVERSIDAD Y LOS TRES MENORES AUN EN COLEGIO.
texts.en:
Alberto O. A. sells motors and spare parts for automobiles. The loan is for working capital. He will expand his business by purchasing auto accessories. He is married and has four children. The oldest child goes to the university, and the three younger children go to school.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase operating capital

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando N. is from the village of Saray, Iligan City. He is 44 years old and single. To make a living, Rolando owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling rice in the local community. Rolando has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Rolando joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rolando is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product offering. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
La señora Delfina socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” del centro poblado de Pusuyo del Distrito de Ilave, Provincia de el Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 36 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene 03 hijos, vive en  la comunidad de Pichincuta, estudio educación secundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 2 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado menor.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1200.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino, aves de corral y cuyes, para comercializarlos en las ferias semanales.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando y darles una profesión a sus hijos

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros, la puntualidad y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Delfina is a member of the Gregoria Apaza Communal Bank in the Pusuyo community center in the Ilave district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 36, married, and has three children. She lives in the Pichincuta community. She has a high school education. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramso for almost two years. She started with a loan for 300 PEN, which allowed her to increase the capital in her business of buying and selling livestock. She currently needs a new loan for 1,200 PEN, which will allow her to buy sheep, poultry, and guinea pigs to sell at the weekly fairs. Her biggest wish is to keep working and to give her children a profession. She likes the savings, the punctuality, and the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep, poultry, and guinea pigs

loans.name: Dioso

texts.en:
Dioso B. is from the village of Danao. He is 48 years old. Dioso is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Dioso owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Dioso has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Dioso joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dioso has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Dioso is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Dioso from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es una mujer perseverante y activa, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, distrito D. Manantay, tiene 58 años, es madre D. siete hijos, D. los cuales todos son mayores D. edad. Ella cría patos y cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo, además ambos se dedican a la preparación D. tamales, juanes, humitas (comida D. la zona), que luego venden en un mercadillo ubicado en el mismo distrito que viven. Elena forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Caseritas” desD. hace un año y cuatro meses, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue 300 soles, dinero que utilizó para elaborar juanes y comprar refrescos. En la actualidad, ella necesita un crédito D. 1300 soles, que será utilizado para comprar productos para preparar comida y refrescos, los mismos que venderá frente a un colegio.
El sueño D. Elena es tener un restaurante bien implementado.
texts.en:
Elena is a persistent and active woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, in the district of Manantay. She is 58 years old and the mother of seven children, all of whom are adults. She raises ducks and counts on the support of her husband. Furthermore, both of them work in the preparation of tamales, juanes, and humitas (food of the region), which they later sell in a market located in the same district in which they live. Elena has been a part of the communal bank "Las Caseritas" for one year and four months. The first credit that she obtained was 300 soles, which she used to make juanes and purchase soft drinks. Currently, she needs a loan of 1,300 soles, which will be used to purchase products to prepare food and soft drinks, which she will then sell in front of a school. Elena's dream is to have a well established restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products for preparing food and drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a large stock of fish for her business

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
El señor Feliciano es un señor de 34 años está casado y tiene 3 hermosos  hijos de (6,3 y 1) años, don Feliciano estuvo en España 3 años trabajado y logro reunir lo suficiente para comprarse un vehículo (trufi) y de esta manera ingresar a un sindicato de transporte y ahora trabaja en el servicio de transporte público y de esta manera por lo menos tiene un trabajo estable. Son una familia de escasos recursos económicos, no tienen una casa propia viven en una casa en alquiler con solo un cuarto, donde vive toda la familia y tienen que darse modos para que estén cómodos todos.

El préstamo será destinado para la compra de un terreno para la construcción de su casa propia  y de esta manera puedan dejar de vivir tan incómodos en un solo cuarto.

El sueño primordial es construir su propia casa, ponerle un buen negocio a su esposa y que sus hijos estudien para que en un futuro puedan tener una carrera profesional y de esta manera tengan un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Feliciano is a 34-year-old man who is married with three beautiful children who are 1, 3, and 6 years old. While working in Spain for three years, he was able to save enough to buy himself a vehicle (a trufi, or minibus) that enabled him to become part of a transportation union. Now he works in the public transportation sector, which at least provides him with steady work. His family has few economic resources; they have no home of their own and live in a rented house with only one room. The whole family lives together and must take pains to be polite to ensure everyone's comfort. The loan is intended for the purchase of a plot of land for the construction of their own home; this way they will no longer have to live in such an uncomfortable situation in a single room. Feliciano's dearest wish is to build his own home, establish a good business for his wife's benefit, and to help his children study so that they can have professional careers that will improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase land to build a home

loans.name: Brenda Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Brenda Elizabeth es casada y tiene 2 hijos una en edad escolar y otro  pequeñito de apenas 2 meses, ellos son una familia joven pero muy trabajadora, ella labora para un banco prestamista y el para una empresa como supervisor, y están tramitando este crédito para la construcción de un cuarto en el frente de su vivienda para mayor comodidad de la familia.
texts.en:
Brenda Elizabeth is married and has two children who are of school age, and a baby who is barely two months old. They are a young, but hardworking family. She works for a lending bank, and her husband works as a supervisor. They are requesting this loan to build a new room in their home so that their family would be more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building an additional room in their home

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa is 40 years old. She is married and the mother of four children. All her children are currently in school. She is very humble and committed to her work and the family's needs, because she believes the children are her only asset. Yaa sells smoked fish in bulk at the community market where she lives, and has years of experience in the fish-selling trade. She takes stock of goods from Yeji, in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana, and then retails the goods to her customers. Yaa travels very far to buy the dried fish, and she says this prevents her from traveling frequently. She requests the loan to buy increased stock to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of smoked fish.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther O. is 42 years old and married to Joshua Ochieng. They have six children. They live within Kisumu town. Their first-born son has just graduated from high school, while the youngest has entered kindergarten.

Esther sells maize. Her clients mainly consist of nearby businesspeople, who own maize grinding machines (posho mill), and the local hotels. She hopes to get a lender through Kadet Ltd to enable her to buy five more sacks of maize to add to her stock. 

Her main desire is to expand the business so as to make good profits, which will enable her help her husband to pay school fees for their children.

loans.use: To buy five sacks of maize to add to her stock

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 28 years old, married to Agnes Njoki, and they have a two-month-old baby. Samuel has been operating a motorcycle transport business for the last three years within Naivasha town.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He will use the cash to buy a new helmet and tires for his motorcycle.

He plans to buy a car which he will use as a taxi. This will increase his future income.

loans.use: Buy new tires and a new helmet

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina sells women's clothing at an open market in Melitopol city. She started this business 17 years ago. Although Valentina was not able to significantly develop her business, it has served as a stable source of income for her family throughout those years. 

Valentina has used microloans many times and found them very instrumental. She used them to purchase stock she needed when she did not have enough cash. This time Valentina would like to borrow 13,000 UAH to increase her stock of spring clothing. Her financial goal is to finish fixing the house where she lives with her husband and daughter.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothes for sale

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial tiene 35 años de edad, es soltero vive en unión libre, tiene dos hijos menores de 10 y 8 años, viven en casa de alquiler hace bastante tiempo en el mismo lugar y tiene un inmueble en la una localidad cercana. Hace más de diez años que Marcial trabaja como chofer de camión y hace unos cuatro años que tiene su vehículo del cual recibe la renta y prácticamente el mismo tiempo tiene  su esposa su negocio de venta de comidas en la casa en que viven. En el sector transporte de carga pesada existe bastante competencia pero Marcial debido a los años de experiencia que tiene es bastante solicitado, en cuanto al trasporte de taxi es un medio bastante competitivo pero de gran demanda también por ser el medio de transporte mas rápido, en el sector de comidas la competencia es dura pero ella tiene su clientela ganada gracias al sabor de sus comidas y la buena atención.
El destino del crédito es para la reparación del vehículo y mantenimiento del mismo que por el tiempo que lo tiene ya necesita un mantenimiento a fondo. Marcial solo ha tenido créditos en Agrocapital y su comportamiento de pago ha sido de bueno a excelente. Se hace notar que Marcial no quiso mirar a la foto y es la persona sentada que está jugando poker.
texts.en:
Marcial is 35 years old. He lives with his common-law wife. He has two young children, aged ten and eight. They have lived in the same rental house for a long time and own a property in a nearby locality. Marcial has worked as a truck driver for over ten years. For about four years, he has driven his own vehicle as a taxi to supplement his income. Meanwhile, his wife has her own business selling food from their home. There is a lot of competition in heavy cargo transport, but due to his years of experience, Marcial is a highly solicited driver. As for his taxi service, it is also very competitive, but there is high demand for taxis because they offer a faster means of transport. In the food business, the competition is tough, but Marcial's wife has an established customer base due to her food's flavor and her good customer service. This loan is going to be used for vehicle repair and maintenance. Because of the car's age, the parts it has need to be checked. Marcial has only had loans with AgroCapital, and his payment history has been good to excellent. It should be noted that Marcial did not want to look at the camera in the photo shown; he is the man seated playing poker.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair and maintenance

loans.name: A. Aminetou

texts.en:
Aminetou M. is 39 years old. She is married and has five children.

Mrs. M. has been selling charcoal since 2003. This will be her second loan from WAGES, which she will use to resupply her stock. Specifically, she will purchase fourteen large sacks, twenty medium-sized sacks, and ten small sacks of charcoal. She will then divide the charcoal in these sacks into individually-sized portions and sell them out of recycled tomato tins. This new supply will ensure that she has enough charcoal to satisfy her neighbors’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Chuyen

texts.en: Chuyen, 28, lives in Phu Man village, Cho Town, Yen Phong, Bac Ninh. She is married with three children and has a store that sells beef in the market. Her husband is a carpenter who makes wooden furniture — chairs, beds, etc. Together they have a monthly income of about 3.700.000 VND. She joined SEDA in 2008 with a loan of 2.000.000 VND and repaid punctually. This time, she wants to borrow 7.840.000 VND (or 400 USD) to buy wood and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wood and expand her business.

loans.name: Abla Azimédo

texts.fr: Cette dame est une femme au foyer avec 2 enfants, son mari est un comptable, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de détail de jus, d’eau minérale pure water et des glaçons, avec les bénéfices qu’elle gagne elle contribue financière aux charges de sa famille. Le congélateur dont elle se sert pour exercer son commerce est en panne, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour s’acheter un nouveau congélateur.
texts.en:
This lady is a housewife with two children. Her husband is an accountant. She has an income-generating activity selling juice, pure mineral water and ice-cubes on a retail basis. With the profits she makes, she contributes financially to the household expenses. The freezer which she uses for her business has broken down, and she is requesting a loan from WAGES in order to buy a new one.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of  a freezer

loans.name: Germán David

texts.es: Germán David M. D. de 37 años de edad reside en la ciudad de Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposa quien le ayuda en el negocio y así mismo se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y también junto a su pequeño hijo de 6 años de edad. Germán posee una panadería la cual se encuentra ubicada en su casa de habitación, en donde se encarga de elaborar pan dulce como pastelitos de leche, galletas, reposterías y otros más. El pan lo comercializa en la unidad de salud de Huizucar ubicado siempre en el departamento de La Libertad, en donde lo vende con los pacientes y doctores del lugar, así mismo su esposa se encarga de venderlo en su casa, de esta manera ellos pueden sacarle el mayor provecho a su trabajo y así obtener mayores ganancias, lo cual les beneficiaria mucho ya que tanto Germán como su esposa quieren mejorar su economía familiar para poder tener la capacidad de brindarle un mejor futuro mejor a su hijo y así mismo un lugar seguro para vivir en donde se le puedan suplir todas sus necesidades primordiales lo cual es lo que más incentiva a Germán, el amor de su hijo. Germán solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar harina, manteca, azúcar y otros elementos más para poder elaborar mayor cantidad de pan.
texts.en:
Germán David M. D. is 37, and lives in the city of Santa Tecla, located in La Libertad province. He lives together with his wife who helps him in the business and together they do the household chores and take care of their 6 year old son. Germán owns a bakery that is located in his house. There he makes sweet bread such as rich cakes, cookies, baked goods, and much more. The baked goods are sold in the Health Department of Huizucar located in the La Libertad Department where he sells to the patients and to the doctors. His wife sells from the house and thus they get the most out of their work and earn more income. This is important since both Germán and his wife want to improve their family finances to offer their son a better future. They also want to have a safe place to live where they can fill their basic needs and that is Germán’s biggest incentive, the love of his child. He is requesting a loan that he will use to buy flour, shortening, sugar and other ingredients to be able to make even more bread.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, shortening, and sugar to make bread

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Jean

texts.fr: D. Jean est né le 02 Août 1977 à Dangbo, dans le département de l’Ouémé. Marié à VODOUNON Ange, Jean est père de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge. Il y a près de vingt six ans que Jean s’est installé au quartier Agbalilamè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, où il vit avec sa famille. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Jean a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire, puis a appris le métier d’électricien bâtiment. Parallèlement à son activité, Jean vend des matériaux électroniques dans sa boutique située à Agbalilamè. Jean achète ses produits à Cotonou. C’est la première fois que Jean sollicite de ALIDé, un crédit, en vue de renforcer son activité et d’augmenter son stock de produits, pour mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Jean D. was born on 2 August 1977 in Dangbo, in the district of Ouémé. Married to Ange VODOUNON, Jean is the father of five children, all of whom are educated. The couple also takes care of another child. For nearly 26 years, Jean has been living with his family in the Agbalilamè neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. The couple both contribute to taking care of their family. Jean attended school until the secondary level, after which he learned the trade of an electrician. In addition to this activity, Jean sells materials related to electricity in his shop located in Agbalilamè. Jean purchases his supplies in Cotonou. This is the first time that Jean is asking for a loan from ALIDé to supplement his activity and increase the stock of his products, in order to better satisfy the requests of his clients.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing electrical supplies (wires, bulbs, hoses, etc)

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
32-year-old T. Patrick is a hardworker, as evidenced by the organised way his banana-selling business is operated. Unlike some of the other banana-selling business people in Karambi, Ibanda, who buy and later resell to customers in not so hygienic conditions, he plants and sells his own bananas in a clean environment. He has done this for the last fifteen years and as a result of his good persuasive skills and good organization, he has got himself a good ready market for his bananas at his stall in Karambi.

With this experience behind him, Patrick knows nothing can hinder him in his endeavor to expand. Among the challenges that have caused a threat to him in the course of operating this business, has been the ever-fluctuating local market price of bananas. He has relied on his resilience to get him through this, however.

At present, Patrick makes profits amounting to 120,000 shillings a week. This married father of four is hoping this loan will get him far, in terms of buying mulches and pesticides for his banana plantations.

loans.use: To buy mulches and pesticides for his banana plantations

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en:
Mr. Sarun S. and his wife, Mrs. Mony S. (pictured together), were married in 1995 and have two daughters. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sarun is a mason. When he is free, he also catches fish from the river and lake near his house and sells them in his village. He is applying for a loan in the amount of 150 USD in order to buy fishing net for his fishing business.

loans.use: To buy fishing net for his fishing business

loans.name: Twezimbe Womens Group-Kayunga

texts.en:
38-year-old N. Aisha has been in the fish mongering and supplies business for almost 10 years in Kyabakadda- Kayunga. She has mostly been supplying and selling smoked fish to local vendors in her locality. She is a stickler for hard work and this she says has overwhelmingly contributed to her longevity in an always competitive business genre. It is a business that requires constant attending to, and fortunately for her, it has not affected her marriage in any way. She and her 6 children have basked in the glow of a business that generates her 70,000 shillings on a weekly basis. 

She is a long-term planner, and she says she envisions a bright future of being able to supply her fish to bigger markets in and around Kayunga and the surrounding environs. With this loan, she wants to purchase more fish so that she can widen her market in terms of sales.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Benkadi 6 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI 6  est constitué de 10 femmes mariées  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 32ans, ont en moyenne 3  enfants et qui vivent majoritairement  dans des  familles polygames à SEREKENI un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les trois prêts passés se sont  bien dénoués.
FANTA B.., la présidente du groupe cultive  le riz comme spéculation. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et les petits matériels pour entretenir : 0,5 hectare . 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché de LOULOUNI après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 30 000 FCFA en fin de campagne.
Son bénéfice lui servira à payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The Benkadi 6 group is composed of 10 married women who are, on average, 32 years old with 3 children and live primarily in polygamous households in Serekeni, one of the villages in the town of Loulouni, in the Loulouni sub-prefecture, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners) to manage their agricultural businesses properly during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution, and the three previous loans were repaid properly. Fanta B., the president of the group, grows rice as a crop. With her portion of the loan, she intends to buy agricultural inputs and small equipment to manage 0.5 hectares of farmland. After the harvest, the products are sold in the village and at the Loulouni market to a clientele composed of men and women. She intends to realize a profit of 30,000 FCFA at the end of the planting season. Her profits will serve to repay her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses. She hopes to maintain this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso in order to benefit from a larger cultural and social space, and thereby acquire better gains.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy agricultural inputs and small equipment

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy L. is from the village of Santa Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, She provides mechanical services in her "repair shop" to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $790 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Joy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. 

Joy is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which again will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be her 4th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Joilyn

texts.en:
Joilyn A. is from the village of Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 32 years old and is married with 3 school-aged children.

Joilyn owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling shellfish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Joilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell.

Joilyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur

loans.name: Rosa Claudina

texts.es:
Rosa de 53 años, confecciona y cose ropa, es madres soltera y vive en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo, caracterizada por la cantidad de habitantes informales comerciantes. 

Por la falta de oportunidades ella empezó cociendo a mano las ropas, después pudo comprar con esfuerzo una maquina de cocer. Desde ese tiempo hasta ahora ella trabaja en su casa con su taller de confección de ropa. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 22h30pm. 

Para seguir produciendo y confeccionando ropa ella quiere comprar con el préstamo telas, hilos y botones. En el futuro quiere tener un taller de costura mas grande.
texts.en:
Rosa, 53, makes and sews clothes. She is a single mother and lives in an urban area called Guasmo, where many of the inhabitants work in informal trading. Due to a lack of opportunities she began by sewing clothes by hand. Later, with effort, she was able to buy a sewing machine. Since then she has been running her own sewing workshop from home. She works from 8am to 10.30pm. In order to continue making clothes she intends to use the loan to buy fabric, thread and buttons. In future she would like to own a larger sewing workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabric, buttons, thread.

loans.name: Santa Catalina De Sillacancha Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA CATALINA DE SILLACANCHA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la  provincia de Urubamba,  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Margarita;  La socia tiene 36 años de edad;  es conviviente ella tiene 4 hijos; Ella se dedica a la venta de chicha y de M. en su casa, La socia tiene sus terrenos de siembra de M., ella vende al por mayor y menor M. en su casa, también elabora la bebida típica de los inkas llamada Chicha. La socia vende todas las tardes la chicha en su propia casa, ella acomodo un espacio para poner sillas y mesas para atender a sus clinetes. La socia requiere el dinero para invertir en sus terrenos ahora que comenzo la epoca de siembra de M.. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas, tractor y abono para sembrar M..

Los  otros socios tienen como actividad principal la agricultura, ellos se dedican a la siembra y cosecha del M. y de la papa.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “SANTA CATALINA DE SILLACANCHA” communal bank. This bank is located in the Calca district, which belongs to Urubamba province in the department of Cusco.

Her name is Margarita; she is 36 years old and has a live-in partner and 4 children. Her work is selling chicha (a corn-based beverage) and corn from her home. The borrower has her own land for growing corn; she sells the corn both wholesale and retail from her home. She also prepares the traditional beverage of the Incas, called chicha. Every evening, she sells chicha in her own home. She has set up a space with chairs and tables in order to serve her customers. She needs the money to invest in her fields, now that the season for planting corn is starting. The borrower is requesting the loan to invest in buying seeds, tractor service and fertilizer to plant corn. 

The other members also have agriculture as their main activities; they work planting and harvesting corn and potatoes. 

The borrower appreciates and values the loan provided to her in this way, and accordingly she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: Investing in buying seeds, tractor service and fertilizer to plant corn

loans.name: Masasi Group

texts.en:
Zaina I. is twenty years old and married with one daughter.  She has been running a charcoal selling business for one year.  The business is open daily between 8 am and 8 pm and earns her about $6 each day. 

This will be Zaina's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She aims to use this loan to increase her charcoal inventory. Her dream is to open a shop for food in the Mbagala district of Dar es Salaam.

Zaina will share this loan with her loan group, Masasi, which totals fifteen members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Zaina can be seen in the front, wearing orange.

loans.use: To increase charcoal inventory

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a young man from Jabalia refugee camp in Gaza Strip. He lives with his parents. Mahmoud wanted to help his father take care of the family as well as saving money for future plans. He got a driving license and started working as a taxi driver. Mahmoud is contracting with families to transport them on a daily basis, such as for work or school and back.

Mahmoud is doing a very good job since a lot of families know him now and ask for his services more frequently. Mahmoud came to FATEN to take a loan and renew the car's engine so that the car serves a longer time with a better performance.

Mahmoud appears here next to his car.

Important information about this loan:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit our FAQs.

loans.use: To renew his car's engine

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta Alicia D. D. M. D. 49 años D. edad, resiD. en Coatepeque, ubicado en la cabecera departamental D. Santa Ana, en donD. vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos D. los cuales el mayor le ayuda con el negocio. Marta posee un negocio en el cual se dedica a brindar el servicio D. fotocopiadoras, y debido a su ubicación, la cual es frente al Instituto Nacional D. Coatepeque, posee muchos clientes. Ella es una mujer muy responsable quien solicita un préstamo a Integral con el fin D. poder comprar una maquina para fotocopias, esto debido a que durante el año escolar la demanda incrementa en gran medida, por lo que en muchas ocasiones se ve obligada a hacer esperar largo tiempo a sus clientes, situación la cual desea cambiar gracias a una maquina nueva y D. esta forma brindar un mejor servicio el cual le permita contar con mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Marta Alicia D. D. M., 49, lives in Coatepeque, located in Santa Ana department’s main municipality, with her husband and three children, the oldest of whom helps her with the business. She provides photocopying services and, thanks to her location across from the National Institute of Coatepeque, she has many customers.  

She is a very responsible woman who is asking Integral for a loan to buy a photocopying machine because during the school year demand increases quite a bit and she has her customers wait a long time, a situation she wishes to change with a new machine thus providing better service which will lead to higher profits.

loans.use: To buy a photocopying machine.

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina lives in Vehari, which is located in Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in the area named 63-EB with her family in a 3-room brick house. She moved here after her marriage. 

She is 34 years old, married to A. G., who is 38 years old and runs a grocery store in the market. He sells daily use items like cooking oil, sugar, spices, etc. from his shop. He has a good number of customers due to his good customer dealings and cheap rates on each grocery item. 
Zarina supports her family by selling clothes. She purchases clothes, wholesale, from a city called Multan and sells them to her local area clients for profit. She has 6 children. Three of them are studying, while the others remain illiterate due to limited financial resources. 

Zarina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk quantity, which will help him sell more to his customers and make more money. She is hopeful that by investing loan money in her husband’s business he will be able to provide better financial support to his family by increasing his profits. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes it will be a good experience for her. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Zarina.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona B. is from the village of Poblacion, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old. Ramona is widowed and has ten adult children. To make a living, Ramona owns and operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling nipa to the local community members. Ramona has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ramona joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ramona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Ramona is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be Ramona's third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is an applied chemistry student at Hebron University. Khalil is 19 years old and he works to cover his school expenses.

He is working hard to achieve a degree in applied chemistry. He took a loan from FATEN to pay for tuition fees, as he couldn't make enough money in time to pay for his school.

Khalil appears in the picture here.

loans.use: To pay for school tuition fees

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena R. is from the village of Opol, Misamis Oriental. She is 38 years old. Rowena is married and has one school-aged children. To make a living, Rowena owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling snacks and other delicacies like rice and cheese cakes in the local community. Rowena has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Rowena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rowena is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Rowena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Esterlina

texts.en:
Esterlina is a 38-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a business selling fish and fruits. She lives in Bago City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. Esterlina now earns an average monthly income of PHP 15,000. Esterlina is borrowing PHP 15,000 in order to purchase more inventory to sell. This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Esterlina hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix J. is from the village of Jampason, Initao, Misamis Oriental. He is 59 years old. Felix is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Felix owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling bananas & coconuts in the local community. Felix has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Felix joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felix has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Felix is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas & coconuts to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Felix from HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional bananas & coconuts for sale

loans.name: Mwamko Group

texts.en:
Anitha T., who is in her early thirties, is married with three children.  She has been running a second-hand sales business for 9 years.  She works from 7.00 am to 6.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Anitha's 1st "motisha" loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A "motisha" loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. She hopes for a loan to expand her business stock.  Her dream is to open a shop selling food.

Anitha will share this loan with her loan group "Mwamko", which has a total of 11 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

In the picture, Anitha is first on the left.

loans.use: To expand her inventory

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en: Svetlana M. lives with her husband and three children in Vaghatin village in the Syunik region.   Svetlana works as a nurse at the local Medical Center. The main income for her family comes from beekeeping and agriculture. It has been only recently that Svetlana had taken her loan from SEF to purchase more beehives. Her aim was to diversify her sources of revenue to have sufficient income during both good and bad seasons. Her beekeeping business was so successful that the additional income allowed Svetlana to pay off her loan before its due time. Now Svetlana has applied for her next loan to invest further in her agriculture business. She will use the loan to purchase wheat seeds, fertilizer and diesel.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her agriculture business

loans.name: Gisèle

texts.en:
Gisèle is 38 years old and lives in the Womey district of Cocotomey on the outskirts of Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. Together with her husband Lozare, she looks after their two children who both go to school, and also one other child.

For the past eight years Gisèle has run a general grocery store from outside her home. This is her third loan with ALIDE following successful past repayments and will allow her to purchase stock in bulk from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. She hopes to be able to build her business.

loans.use: to purchase various food items for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 38-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three young children. He has a wide experience working in the photocopy field. He started running his own business in 2009. He deals directly with customers and signs contracts with multiple companies to do all their photocopy work for them. He has newly hired three full-time employees to help him out with the work as he is planning to grow his business.
