He has obtained three Kiva loans, and he notes that his post-loan business has been doing so well that he plans to renew his loan over and over again. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new photocopier and needed extra tools. He has high hopes for the future of his business and wants to earn higher income to better support his family.

loans.use: to purchase a new photocopier and needed extra tools.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia, a 50-year-old married woman, has 2 children--aged 23 and 16. She and her husband are both farmers. Lucia does her best to keep their farm productive. She plants rice crops and makes sure they grow healthy. Lucia wants to help improve her family's living conditions.

Lucia's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
En la zona denominada Fracción Santo Domingo, ciudad de Yaguarón a 3 Km. de la ciudad de Paraguarí, se reune un grupo de mujeres quienes se interiorizan sobre el programa ofrecido por la Fundación Paraguaya y trabajan todas juntas por su objetivo. 
El comité lleva por nombre  Mujeres Unidas, por estar integrada por luchadoras mujeres que siempre han trabajado en conjunto para realizar todas sus actividades, manteniendose juntas en todo momento. Trabajan por sis familias y la comunidad en que viven, por lo cual solicitan el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de ropas de todo tipo destinadas especialmente a los niños, jóvenes y adultos que las necesitan. 
Por ejemplo, la señora Cinthia D. se dedica a la venta de ropas en su ciudad, con ello mantiene a su familia y sus hijos dignamente y coopera con las demás integrantes del comité.
Ella ha progresado mucho en su grupo y con su familia, por eso desea poder aumentar sus ingresos adquiriendo mayor cantidad de ropas que puedan ser vendidas a precios más accesibles y así obtener mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
A group of women who are familiar with the program offered by Fundación Paraguaya and work together to achieve their goal meet in Fracción Santo Domingo neighborhood, in the town of Yaguarón, 3km from the city of Paraguarí.

The committee is called 'Mujeres Unidas' (United Women) because it is made up of hard-working women who have always worked together to carry out all their activities, remaining united at all times.  They work for their families and the community in which they live.  They are requesting this loan to invest in buying all types of clothes, especially for the children, young people and adults who need them.

For example, Cinthia D. sells clothes in her town.  Through her work, she supports her family and her children in an honorable manner and cooperates with the other members of the committee.  She has made a lot of progress with her group and her family.  She would like to be able to increase her income, acquiring a larger quantity of clothes that she can sell at more affordable prices, thereby making more profits.

loans.use: to buy clothes for children, young people and adults

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy nació en la ciudad de San Francisco, tiene 41 años, esta casada con Lucio de 43 años y fruto de esa relación concibieron 02 hijos, Jhamil de 11 años y Nayel de 10 años de edad,  juntos viven en su propia casa donde predomina la armonía. Nancy ejerce la profesión de docente, cada día se esmera por entregar algo nuevo a sus educandos. Ella labora en el centro educativo número 39017, ubicado en la ciudad de San Francisco, donde trabaja como docente de nivel primario durante hace 20 años. Ella se entrega por completo a su trabajo por que gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano pudo comprarse una parcela en donde cultiva cacao, café y árboles maderables que con mucho sacrificio trata de sacar adelante este negocio. Por ello pide de su apoyo y colaboración para obtener el capital necesario para invertir en sus cultivos.  Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por lo cual se compromete a pagar puntualmente todos sus aportes mensuales. Con el crédito solicitado comprará mas semillas de árboles maderables como: caoba, cedro y roble, para sembrarlos, pues estos árboles demoran en crecer durante 20 años.
texts.en: Nancy was born in the city of San Francisco.  She is 41, married to Lucio, 43, and they have 2 children: Jhamil, 11, and Navel, 10.  They all live harmoniously in their own house.  Nancy is a teacher and every day she tries to give something new to her students.  She works in the Centro Educative number 39017, located in San Francisco. She has taught first grade for the past 20 years.  She gives her all to her work and thanks to her daily effort she was able to buy a piece of land where she grows cacao, coffee and hardwood trees.  She has sacrificed a lot to get her business ahead and for this she requested help and collaboration to obtain the necessary capital to invest in her plants.  This is her fifth loan with MFP and she promises to make all the monthly payments punctually.  She will use the loan to buy seeds of hardwood trees such as: mahogany, cedar, and oak to plant since these trees take about 20 years to grow.

loans.use: To buy mahogany, cedar, and oak seeds

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Los Laureles.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María ella tiene 65 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha procreado 4 hijos ya todos son mayores de edad, el menor de ellos estudia el primer año de Universidad. Su marido es taxista. Hace varios años estudió corte y confección en una Academia en la ciudad de Bahía.
 
Es una mujer muy luchadora que busca la forma de conseguir sus propios ingresos y con estos ayudar a su esposo y a sus hijos. Tiene un pequeño taller de corte y confección en su casa donde realiza diversidad de trabajos a personas particulares que les confecciona sus prendas de vestir, además de coser también vende productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios de damas) y agua en bidón. En la actualidad ha empezado también con un negocio de venta de bombonas de gas de uso domestico, nos cuenta que le está yendo muy bien ya que no hay otro lugar para comprar este producto. Trabaja todos los días en sus diversas actividades desde las 8h00 hasta las 19h00.

Este crédito es para comprar bombonas de gas para aumentar su negocio. Ella es fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta los beneficios que le brinda la institución.
 
Su sueño es seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
In the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez, known for its beaches, its rich cuisine and the warmth of its people, the members of the “Los Laureles”         (The Laurels) communal bank meet every two weeks.

We met María, 65, here.  She’s in a relationship and has had four children all of whom are now adults.  The youngest of them is in first year of university.  Her husband is a taxi driver.  Several years ago she studied fashion design and dressmaking at an academy in the city of Bahía.

She is a tenacious woman who seeks ways of earning her own income to help her husband and children.  She has a small dressmaking workshop at home where she does various jobs for individuals making clothes for them.  In addition, she also sells Yanbal brand products (beauty supplies, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories).  She also sells large bottles of water.

In addition, she’s recently gone into the sale of gas cylinders for domestic use.  She tells us that she’s doing very well because there is no other place to buy this product. She works every day at her various activities from 8am until 7pm.

This loan is to buy gas tanks to increase her business.  She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because of the benefits the institution provides her.  Her dream is to continue growing in business.

loans.use: to buy gas cylinders.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is a married woman with four children. Two of them attend school while two are still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge in transporting charcoal from the village to the market for sale. She dreams of constructing houses in the future.

With the loan of Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to get access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Everlinda

texts.en:
Everlinda is 38 years old and lives in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of four school-age dependents.

Everlinda has a retail shop at home to earn a living. She sells different types of food products like biscuits, candies, noodles and canned goods. She had been in this business for five years. She earns a total income of PHP 5,808 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 from GDMPC to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Everlinda has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Everlinda hopes to expand her retail business and gain more income to purchase other products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Stanely

texts.en:
Stanely, age 28, is a single man who runs a cafeteria that has been in operation for four years. The business earns him a monthly profit of KES 15,000.

This is his first loan with KADET LTD. He will use the loan funds to buy flour, cooking oil and other food supplies for his cafe. He intends to use the anticipated profits to open another cafe and hopes to own a huge restaurant in the future.

loans.use: To buy food supplies for the cafeteria like flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a 50-year-old woman. She is married and has three sons and three daughters. Halima lives in Rafah city, Gaza Strip in Palestine. One of her sons is a Palestinian National Authority employee and her husband is a taxi driver. Halima's husband wants to repair, paint and license his taxi. Her family income is not enough to pay for all the taxi's expenses, so she needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN.

Getting FATEN's loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, will offer to Halima the opportunity to pay in cash for doing all the taxi repairs and will enable her husband to work extra hours and generate a better income to support the family. This will result in better living conditions. Halima is a religious conservative woman so her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: To repair, paint and license the taxi.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van, 38 years old, is married and has two children. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City.

Her husband earns money as a security guard for a market. Van supports her family with the income that she earns selling fruit, cakes and sweet soup. She intends to use her loan to buy more fruit and ingredients for production of her cakes and soup.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fruit and ingredients for making and selling cakes and sweet soup.

loans.name: Claudia Janeth

texts.es: Claudia Janeth desde hace 11 años, que se dedica es la venta de ropa. Ella tiene 4  hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Por lo que siempre busca la forma de mejorar sus ingresos, ella es una mujer muy responsable, lo que hace la diferencia es que siempre está al pendiente con sus clientes le solicitan. Ella solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar ropa interior, pantalones, camisas, faldas y trajes. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es que tiene la posibilidad de interactuar con sus clientes.
texts.en: For the past eleven years Claudia Janeth has been selling clothes for a living. She has four minor children in her care. She is always looking for a way to increase her earnings. She is a responsible woman. What makes her a good businesswoman is that she is always responsive to her customers. She is asking for this new loan in order to buy underwear, pants, blouses, skirts and suits. What she likes the most about this business is the opportunity to interact with her customers.

loans.use: to buy underwear, pants, shirts, skirts and suits.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
Evangelina nació en la provincia de Paruro del departamento del Cusco y tiene 43 años de edad, ella tiene una relación de libre unión de la cual tiene tres hijos.  

Actualmente, Evangelina vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica  a la venta de verduras en uno de los mercados más visitados de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son diez años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Evangelina requiere el préstamo para comprar más verduras. 

El Banco Comunal “Comuzone I” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Evangelina was born in Paruro Province in the Department of Cusco. She is 43 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has three children.

Evangelina currently lives in Cusco, which is where she conducts her business activities. She sells vegetables at one of the most frequented markets in the city of Cusco. Evangelina has been in this business for 10 years and has done very well. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy more vegetables.

The Communal Bank “Comuzone I” meets every 30 days in the city of Cusco, Peru. This city is known for being a tourist and business area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Esperanza has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Esperanza has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Esperanza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
Dante is 52 years old and married. He is blessed with two children and provides for their needs. He has a piggery business as a source of income. Despite the difficulty in caring for his pigs, he is patiently working hard to achieve greater income soon. He knows that his diligence will be reciprocated with success. His wife also helps him to improve their living conditions by selling vegetables in their market every day.

Dante is requesting a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos to buy feed for his hogs to avoid food deficiency. He hopes to earn a higher income for security purposes in times of emergencies, as well as for the future studies of his children.

loans.use: to buy feed for his hogs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 23 years. She is 49 years old and married to John; they have four school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her fourth loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs.

In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her farming skills.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Habib

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune célibataire sans enfant qui exerce comme tailleur.Il a arrété ses études il y'a cinq ans et s'est engagé dans ce métier auprès de son frére qui l'a formé.Il a ensuite ouvert son atelier de couture et a acheté sa première machine sur un pret de l'UIMCEC.La position de son atelier situé au coeur du marché lui donne une grande clientèle; ce qui lui assure des revenus assez importants.Il supporte ainsi une grande partie des dépenses d'entretien de sa famille ainsi que ses propres besoins.Actuellement, il sollicite un pret de 400000f pour acheter une machine à coudre "cornière" afin d'améliorer la qualité de ses services.Son ambition est d'ouvrir un second atelier de couture.
texts.en: This borrower is a young single man without any children, who works as a tailor. He stopped studying five years ago and took up this trade with his brother who trained him. He then opened his own sewing workshop and bought his first machine with a loan from UIMCEC. His workshop is situated at the heart of the market giving him a large customer base; this ensures that he has a reasonably significant income. He thus bears a large proportion of his family's running expenses as well as providing for his own needs. He is now requesting a loan of 400,000 francs to buy a "Cornière" sewing machine so that he can improve his service quality. His ambition is to open a second workshop.

loans.use: to buy a "Cornière" sewing machine

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 31 years old and is married with three children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past two years, she has run a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, shampoo, and detergents. Adelina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.

Adelina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP loan to buy canned goods, snacks, shampoo, and detergents. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, shampoo, and detergents

loans.name: Lieu

texts.en:
Lieu, a 38-year-old married mother of two, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Lieu and her husband have been running a food stall for three years, selling noodles with beef.

Lieu is requesting a loan to expand her business through the purchase of more furniture and good quality foods. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy furniture and good quality foods  for her food stall.

loans.name: Vianca Ivonne

texts.es:
La cliente es soltera, no cuenta con dependiente de sus ingresos.
La principal actividad del cliente es el la Produccion, elaboracion de joyas de Bijouteria y Fantasia , tiene una experiencia de 2 años en el rubro pero tambien cuenta con otra actividad de elaboracion de maquetas para estudiantes de la universidad que estan cursando la carrera de Arquitectura o estudiantes de colegio lo cual le genera un ingreso extra.
Vianca se dedica con mucho entusiasmo a la elaboracion de collares, pulseras y otros articulos para mujer, le agrada combinar colores, y crear nuevos diseños, por lo que ha ha tenido muchos clientes que le piden a ella la elaboracion de este tipode articulos porque confian en su buen gusto y creatividad.

El credito que esta solicitando es para comprar mas insumos para poder seguir realizando su trabajo artesanal.
texts.en:
Vianca, the client, is single. She does not have anyone dependent on her income. Her primary business is the production of costume jewelry. She has two years of experience in this field. She also has another business making models for university architecture students or secondary school students. This business produces extra income.  Vianca is very enthusiastic about making necklaces, bracelets and other items of women’s jewelry. She likes combining colors and creating new designs. She has had many customers order custom jewelry because they trust her good taste and her creativity. 

The loan she is requesting is for purchasing more supplies to continue making her handcrafted work.

loans.use: with working capital for her costume jewelry business.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is 30 years old and single.  He is a farmer in the Philippines and has been in business for the past 10 years.  He was fortunate to earn 10,000 PHP from his last crop harvest.  He hopes to increase both his revenue and his crop yield in the future and is requesting a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

Erick said he aims to improve his family's standard of living in order to attract a wife.  He feels he is getting old to establish a family of his own and works very hard to improve his lifestyle. Through his untiring work in the field, he hopes to sufficiently improve his family's living conditions and save to establish a family of his own in the future.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Mariela; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es casada; La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos para la salud,ella vende en forma independiente desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia tambien sigue trabajando como psicologa,ella trabaja en un consultorio,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos naturales para la salud . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos naturales al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member's name is Mariela. She is 35 years old and married. She is still working at her business selling health products. She sells independently from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. She also continues to work as a psychologist in a doctor's office. Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell her natural health products. She is asking for the loan to buy natural products wholesale.

Mariela is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy natural products wholesale.

loans.name: Khardiata

texts.fr: Khardiata est une femme mariée âgée  de 28 ans. Elle vit dans une des communautés villageoises du Sénégal. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant de 2 ans. Elle est propriétaire d’une pirogue depuis plus d’un an. Elle a confiée l’exploitation et la gestion a son frère  avec qui  elle  partage les bénéfices. Ce sont les difficultés de la vie qui l’ont   influencé  a choisir une    telle activité.  Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus c’est  son aspect lucratif . Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis octobre 2010. Elle sollicite un crédit de 75 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de caisses qui  sont utilisées pour la conservation des   poissons  et  filets  de pêche. Ce financement lui permettra de mieux développer son activité et  d’améliorer ses revenus.
texts.en: Khardiata is a married woman who is 28 years old. She lives in one of Senegal's village communities. She is mother to one child who is two years old. She has owned a pirogue for more than a year and has entrusted the operation and management of the pirogue to her brother, with whom she shares the profits. The difficulties of life led her to choose this activity and it is the profitable aspect of it which interests her most. She has been a member of one of the U-IMCEC branches since October 2010 and she is requesting a loan of 75,000 francs to buy crates which will be used to conserve fish and fishing nets. This loan will allow her to develop her business more easily and to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy crates for conserving fish and fishing nets

loans.name: Rabea'a

texts.en:
Rabea'a is a 34 year old married woman who has 5 family members from Irbid Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for foodstuffs to sell, she wants to develop her project by buying a perfumes and makeup to sell. In the future she is planning on adding another room.
Rabea'a is a conservative woman,she is unwilling to upload her photo in the internet the photo is for her husband

loans.use: to pay for foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Yessoufou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe YESSOUFOU est composé de quatre personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Moulikatou Abiketou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Moulikatou Abiketou a très peu fréquentée l’école. Moulikatou Abiketou  est âgée de 54 ans et vit au Bénin. Moulikatou Abiketou est veuve, et mère de deux enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par la bénéficiaire. Pour cette raison, Moulikatou Abiketou vend depuis vingt ans des boites de conserves et du charbon de bois. Moulikatou Abiketou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Moulikatou Abiketou  ensemble avec les membres du  groupe YESSOUFOU, sollicite un troisième crédit. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des boites de conserves et du charbon de bois.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Priscilla is a 36-year-old smallholder farmer, a fighter of a thousand battles and always she has emerged victorious. She is a complete example of hard work. Priscilla is a woman with a total willingness to work. She hails from the Chuka area of Kenya, an area that has good rainfall patterns and is known for dairy farming. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past ten years, and is making great strides. She has been able to earn a decent and honest living through milk and egg selling, and personal business. These ventures have enabled her to support her family. Priscilla has planted many trees on her compound, and also has Napier grass, which has high protein and is used to feed her dairy cows, thereby enhancing her milk-selling profits. Because of increased demand, Priscilla is kindly requesting a loan to buy a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming is a very profitable venture, and she wants to take full advantage of the ready market for dairy products. Through the loan, Priscilla is sure of satisfying the demand for milk in her area. Through increased profits, she is sure that she will repay the loan on time and also be in a position to comfortably take care of her family. Priscilla, with her entrepreneurial spirit, strength and tenacity, would like to continue fighting so that she can achieve her dream of owning her own business and empowering society by being a source of employment. Juhudi Kilimo, through its training, has helped Priscilla save more effectively, and through her accumulated profits, she plans to add value to her milk through packaging. She also hopes to one day start manufacturing milk products such as yogurt and cream.

loans.use: To buy another quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.ru:
28 летняя, активная женщина Санавбар. Санавбар живет в районе Хамадони вместе мужем и 3 леном дочкой. Санавбар настоящая мастерица и рукодельница. Она дома занимается шитьем женской одежды. Санавбар очень хорошо умеет шить и кроить национальные женские платья. 
Санавбар уже 2.5 года занимается такой деятельностью и довольна своей работой, но ее швейная машинка сильно устарела и она хочет на деньги от кредита купить новую машинку. Санавбар надеется, что с появлением новой швейной машинки она будет принимать больше заказы и увеличиться доходы.

loans.use: Для купли новую швейную машинку.

loans.name: Viole

texts.en:
Viole used her first loan to start an ice cake business, then she used her next two loans to start a small shop, using them to buy stock. The photo shows sweets in the foreground, canned tuna and beef in the background as well as traditionally printed cloths. Her first loan was WST 750 (USD 325) and current loan is WST 3000.

Viole’s family consist of her husband and three children who all attend school. The profit from her shop business helps her to support her family..

In 2005 she was awarded one of the seven best businesswomen awards in SPBD. This was due to the way she built up her business, used her shop to sell products of other SPBD members and the way she conducts herself in the weekly payment meetings.

loans.use: Purchase stock for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her wool spinning business

loans.name: Cong

texts.en: Mrs Cong is 49 years old and her husband is 59 of ages. They have 7 children between 25 and 7. They have only 1000 square meters so two eldest children stopped going to school and had to work as a daily laborer to support five children who are going to school. Mrs Cong buys waste materials and jack-fruits from door to door and then selling it to the local business in the commune. Mrs Cong borrowed an interest-free loan of $50 and has already repaid the loan. Her income increased $1.50/person/month. Now the average income is $11 per person per month. Mrs Cong wants another loan of $75 for expanding her business.

loans.use: buys waste materials and jack-fruits

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena is married and lives in Apodaca in the Mexican state of Nuevo León. Her love of pastry making made her take a class on it, and as soon as she started she began baking cakes for her family. Out of necessity to cover household expenses she started her own business, and began selling her products to rave reviews from customers. This has allowed her to grow her business and help her afford household expenses and her children's education.

To keep her business growing and increase production, Maria is requesting a loan of $475, which she will use to purchase ingredients and cooking utensils with the hope of meeting her customers' demands. She plans to repay the loan within six months. You can be part of this business' development. Maria is sincerely grateful for your confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Maria Elena es casada y vive en la localidad de Apodaca, Nuevo León. El gusto que tiene hacia la repostería la llevo a estudiar un curso, pronto comenzó a elaborar pasteles solo para su familia, pero la necesidad de cubrir los gastos de su hogar la llevaron a iniciar su propio negocio y comenzó a vender sus productos teniendo mucha aceptación de sus clientes, lo que le ha permitido hacer crecer su negocio y contribuir con gastos de su hogar y de la educación de sus hijos.

Para poder continuar creciendo e incrementar su producción, Maria está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de utensilios de cocina e insumos, con lo que espera poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, Maria agradece sinceramente la confianza y apoyo que le brindas.

loans.use: Purchase cooking utensils and ingredients.

loans.name: Faigasuega

texts.en: Faigasuega is a hard working woman of thirty-eight years of age.  She has three children and all of them are attending school.  In order to meet her family's needs, she worked very hard to run her business well.  She’s been doing this for almost two years and her husband is always behind her supporting her in every way.  Faigasuega is grateful for the help of S.P.B.D for lending her the money to make everything for her business possible.  She will use the money to buy the equipment needed to develop her business. She will increase her business, because she realizes that her customers' needs are growing.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and supplies

loans.name: Loydi

texts.es:
Loydi’s family consists of seven children. Three of the children work with their father and the other four are students. Her husband is responsible to the home and its expenses. He works as a lumberjack and therefore travels often with the three oldest children. Loydi learned to sew when she was fourteen. This noble profession was passed on to her by her mother. Loydi began as a seamstress in a small shop for a fixed wage and purchased a pedal operated sewing machine. From there Loydi started her own seamstress shop in her home. Over time, with the clientele that she attracted, she was able to purchase an electric sewing machine. Having had customers placing advanced orders she increased her sales greatly.

She is very proud of her work and what she sews. In order to maintain the satisfaction of her clients, Loydi is asking for a loan which she will repay in six months. This money will enable her to purchase materials to make clothing.

Eternal thanks for the noble assistance of our father in heaven.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La familia de Loydi consta de siete hijos, de los cuales tres trabajan con su papá y los otros cuatro estudian en el colegio; su esposo se dedica a la extracción de madera por lo que viaja frecuentemente con sus hijos mayores, sin descuidar los gastos de su hogar. Loydi aprendió a coser cuando tenía catorce años a raíz que aprendió esta noble labor de su mamá, empezó a elaborar sus primeras creaciones en una máquina a pedal que se había conseguido de ocasión ya que ella trabaja en un taller como costurera con un sueldo fijo, llevando adelante el proyecto de tener su propio taller de costura en su casa.Con el transcurrir del tiempo y la clientela que pudo conseguir, compró una máquina eléctrica y empezó a incrementar sus ventas teniendo pedidos con anticipación y sintiéndose muy orgullosa de su trabajo y sus creaciones. Para poder mantener a sus clientes satisfechos, está solicitando un préstamo con un período de devolución de seis meses, este dinero le permitirá comprar los materiales para la elaboración de las prendas, agradeciendo eternamente por tan noble apoyo de vuestra parte.

loans.use: Purchase of sewing materials in order to increase sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To supply many products for her sales business:  costume jewelry, cosmetics, perfumes, cleaning products, beverages and candy

loans.name: Nashravan

texts.en: Nashravan H.  is a 46-year-old farmer in a village in the Saatli region. He is married and has two children. He has been selling dairy products to neighbors and local bazaar traders for 9 years. Now he would like to expand his business from one to three cows. Nashravan would like a loan of $1200 to purchase two additional cows.

loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch N., 51, is married with six children and works as a housewife. Her husband, Mr. Sor Seam, 53, works as a palm climber collecting palm juice which is finally refined as a palm sugar. With this business’s activity, he can typically make $6.10 each day from selling palm sugar to a busy market. The couple has six children. Two of them work in the factory, each making about five dollars per day; two other children are enrolled in school and the balance of the children are unemployed. Mrs. Touch N. will use this loan to purchase more tools to facilitate her husband’s work and to purchase pigs to raise and resell to the market. ( Her husband is pictured while Mrs. Touch N. is unavailable.)

loans.use: Purchase additional tools for palm sugar refining and pigs to resell at the market.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
39-year-old Gladis sells beauty products from a nationally recognized cosmetics line. Galdis’ desire to contribute to her family’s economic well-being and raise their standard of living keeps her dedicated to her work. She also has clothing for sale and with the help of her beloved husband has built a small store. However, she still enjoys selling the cosmetics, which is why she is looking to increase her working capital and invest in a greater quantity of products for her esteemed clients.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Gladis de 39 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de productos de Belleza de una línea cosmética muy reconocida a nivel nacional, su dedicación a esta actividad tiene el objetivo de contribuir con la economía de su hogar a fin de elevar el nivel de vida de su querida familia. También oferta prendas de vestir y con la ayuda de su querido esposo ha construido una pequeña bodeguita, sin embargo disfruta mucho con su primera actividad, por esa razón desea incrementar su capital de trabajo para así ofrecer mayor cantidad de productos a sus estimados clientes.

loans.use: Buy a greater quantity and quality of cosmetic products for her business

loans.name: Navy

texts.en: Mrs. Navy H., 32, lives in Sarikakeo Village in Kompong Speu Province and is married to Mr. Chan Seourn. They have two children who are both too young to work or attend school. Mrs. Nary Hul and her husband own a grocery store in a local market and have no difficulties running the business. However, Mrs. Navy H. would like to expand her business and is therefore applying for a loan to buy more grocery goods for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of grocery goods for sale

loans.name: Emakina Self-Help Group

texts.en:
George O. is a young Kenyan father aged 30 with 2 children. He also lives with 1 orphan child of his late brother who perished 2 years ago.

George started his business 3 years ago after accumulating savings from his former work place in a local petrol station in Busia town. He currently deals in men’s second-hand shoes but would like to diversify to children's and ladies' collections as well.

Being the bread winner for his family, it would enable him to support his family better. With the little profit that he gets from the business, George is still able to provide his family the basic needs of life. With the help of his loan, George will be able to purchase more second-hand shoes to enable him boost his business sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase shoes in bulk

loans.name: Doung

texts.en: Doung S., 28, is a grocery seller from her house in her village and her average income is $1.5 per day. Her husband is a farmer and can make around $1 per day. They live with two children in Chan Sery Village, Pursat Province. Now S. seeks a loan of $100 to purchase grocery stocks for her business.

loans.use: To purchase grocery stocks for her business

loans.name: Vannak Chhon

texts.en: Mr. Vannak C. is a 27 year old farmer in Thnaol Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. His wife, Mrs. Sokun Uon, is a garment factory worker. They have a child who is too young to work or study. Mr. Vannak C.’s living conditions are poor, and to improve them he wants to start a pig breeding business; unfortunately, he does not have enough money to buy pigs. Last year, Mr. Vannak C. spent $100 to cure his child from an infection.  Mr. Vannak C. has decided to request a loan to purchase some pigs to begin the piggery. His wife is presented in the right of the photo.

loans.use: To start a pig breeding business in order to support his family.

loans.name: La-Oo

texts.en:
Mrs. La-oo S., 36, and her husband, Mr. Ban Eam, 37, who live along National Road Number Six about 18 kilometers north of Phnom Penh, were married in 1992 and have four children: three sons and one daughter.  Three of their children study in a local school, and the youngest one stays home.

Mrs. La-oo has been selling citronella for two years.  She bought the plants from a farmer in her village to resell at Demkor Market in Phnom Penh.  Her husband is a motor taxi driver and helps her with the business.  Currently, she needs money to buy citronella on a forward contract, which means that she must pay the farmer before harvesting.

Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase citronella on forward contract and to replace her husband’s motorcycle for his motor taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase citronella on forward contract and replace a motorcycle

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es:
Señor Oscar Antonio M. is 54, is married, and has 3 children. For more than 8 years, he has traveled to the capital of Managua to purchase different products that some businesses in the city of Bluefields order from him. He obtains a profit that has allowed him to pay for his home's expenses. In this business, his main customers are barber shops in the city to whom he brings lotions, hair clippers, and razors, which are used in hair cuts and shaving. Another sector that señor M. supplies are some jewelers, to whom he mainly sells silver and stones to make rings. In the same way, many people like cabinet makers order files, saws, and other products from him to avoid making a trip to the capital themselves.

On every one of these orders, M. makes a small profit that allows him to pay for his basic needs. Nevertheless, he needs financing to be able to fill all of his orders, to make larger profits, and to continue developing his business. He is requesting this loan to purchase 250 grams of silver at $1 per gram, 10 scientific calculators at $7 each, 4 razors at $15 each, and 4 hair clippers at $30 each.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El señor Oscar Antonio M. tiene 54 años de edad, es casado con 3 hijos y desde hace mas de 8 años se dedica a viajar a la capital Managua con el objetivo de comprar diferentes productos que les encargan algunos negocios de esta ciudad de Bluefields y en donde obtiene una ganancia que le a permitido sufragar los gasto de su hogar. En este negocio sus principales clientes son barberos de esta ciudad a quienes les trae lociones, cuchillas de barbero, navajas las cuales utilizan en los cortes de cabellos y afeitadas. Otro sector que abastece el señor M. son algunas joyerías a las cuales les vende principalmente plata y piedras para anillos. De igual manera algunas personas como los ebanistas para evitarse viajar a la capital les hacen encargos de limas, sierras entre otros productos.

En cada uno de estos encargos el comerciante M. obtiene una pequeña ganancia que le permite pagar sus necesidades básicas, sin embargo requiere un financiamiento para poder cumplir con todos sus encargos y poder obtener mayores ganancias e irse desarrollando en este negocio. Por lo que solicita el financiamiento para comprar 250 gramos de plata el cual compra a US$ 1 dólar cada gramo, 10 calculadoras científicas a US$ 7 dólares cada unidad, 4 navajas de afeitar a US$ 15 dólares cada unidad y 4 cuchillas para barbería a US$ 30 dólares cada unidad.

loans.use: To purchase 250 grams of silver, 10 scientific calculators, 4 razors, and 4 hair clippers

loans.name: Tolfi

texts.en: Tolfi L., 42, is married with 2 children.  She has many years of experience in the cabbages, cucumbers, pumpkins and beans business. She sells to the public and villagers 2 days per week. She has had 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 410 Tala (~170 USD).  SPBD loans are Tolfi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  Her husband is also working to help out with family needs and in running the business.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals and pesticides

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba O. has a small business in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar.  She has taken out one prior loan from BRAC Tanzania and as a result, she is currently able to earn a profit of approximately $60 each month. She is requesting her second loan so that she can further expand her business and increase her profit.  

Habiba is 45 years old, single, and has no chidlren.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her business.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen baji is a 22 year old young lady and a mother of two children: one son and one daughter. She resides in Riwind, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 11 years. Her husband has a grocery shop in the community. He has been running this shop for the past 5 years.

Yasmeen baji makes embroidered dresses and stitches clothing. She charges $2.00 for stitching and $3.00 for embroidery. Yasmeen baji successfully repaid her two previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more groceries for her husband’s grocery shop.

loans.use: To buy groceries for the grocery shop.

loans.name: Alexander Nabbakka’S Group

texts.en:
Alexander is the leader of a 4-member loan group. She is a 52-year-old single mother of three. She had five children but two died. The three remaining children are in school. Alex also takes care of the four orphans of her late children.  She resides and owns a two-room house where she is staying with four people, and only two people bring in additional income to the family. They neither have electricity nor piped water at home The family gets two meals a day and rarely take tea.

Alexander works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala. She uses public transport to and from shopping. Alexander operates a business from home and sells to an average of 20 customers a day and works seven days a week. Alexander sells to all categories of people. Alexander has been in this business for over ten years. She owns a kiosk in the village beside a shoe business. She has been with MCDT for six years working all this long with the same group mates and servicing her twelfth loan. Alexander wants to use this loan to buy more shoes for her business. She is aspiring to build rental rooms in the plot she bought with previous loans. The other group members want to do similar things.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to resell and to build rental rooms on a lot

loans.name: Thun

texts.en: Mrs. S. is 46 years old, widowed, and grows vegetables to sell in Veal Village, Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has two children, both of whom are single (one daughter and one son). Her daughter is employed as a garment worker in Phnom Penh City and her son works providing battery recharge service in the village. To improve her vegetable crop and increase income, she needs a loan to purchase a pump machine to use.

loans.use: To purchase a pump machine to use

loans.name: Anjelina

texts.en:
Anjelina T. is currently in the business of selling fruits like tomatoes, mangoes, and pineapple and is requesting a loan to expand the business.  Anjelina is 40 years old and is married with a husband who is a business man. She has 5 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business.  Profits will be used to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. is 22 years old, married, and a mother with two children. One of her children is in school whilst the last born is breastfeeding. Esther lives with her husband at Wasa Asamang in the western region of Ghana. She dropped out of school because no one was there to support her. For that reason she decided to hook up with a man who could provide for her basic needs, and she got herself pregnant.

She has been selling cocoa drink and sachet mineral water for the past two years now. Cocoa drink is prepared with powdered cocoa; water is added to it with sugar and then it is left in a fridge for a while and it is served whilst chilled and is taken with bread. This is mostly purchased by school children because it's tasty.

Esther wants the loan to make headway so that she can buy more cocoa powder, sugar, loaves of bread and rubber bags. With the loan she believes she can produce in larger quantity. She would be grateful for your assistance. Esther belongs to a village bank called ‘God’s Time’. She hopes to receive GHS 400 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa powder, sachet mineral water, etc.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
El Sr. Porfirio Pérez vive en la localidad de Santa Martha en casa familiar con su esposa y su hijo, que lo colaboran aportando con sus negocios a la manutencion de casa. 
El se dedica a la actividad de transporte urbano, es presidente de su sindicato, es una persona muy trabajadora. La esposa, Alcira Cruz, se dedica a la actividad de venta de ropa. Ellos cuentan con una vagoneta propia con la cual vienen trabajando hace 4 años. 
Su objetivo es colocarle un puesto dentro del mercado a su esposa para la venta ropa, ya que ahora es vendedora ambulante.
texts.en:
Mr. Porfirio Pérez lives in Santa Martha with his wife and son. They both contribute to the maintenance of their home through their respective jobs. He works in public urban transportation, is president of his labor union, and is a very hard worker. His wife, Alcira Cruz, sells clothing for a living. They rely on their own car, which they've been using for the past four years. His objective is to place a stand for his wife within the marketplace in order for her to sell her clothing, as she is now a mobile vendor.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce A. is 32 years old. She is single and seriously looking for her better half. Joyce is a physically challenged person. She has difficulties talking and especially walking. She is proactive, time bound, and consistent in work in spite of being disabled. She owns and operates a Rasta hairdo salon in her neighborhood at Cape Coast in the central region of Ghana.  Rasta hairdo is what most people call it. It is plaiting ones hair with mesh. Joyce is very skillful and a talented hairdresser who adds lots of beauty to the hair of her many customers. She says that is her secret. Joyce uses the weavons and meshes to plaits her client’s hair to add beauty to them and she has been in the job for the past five years now. She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service, so she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, mesh, hair cream, threads etc. to avoid shortages and poor servicing. As a result of this, she has one beautiful young lady as her apprentice; she is training her for her future career. Training was organized for her so that she can use the loan to achieve her business goal to increase efficiency and profitability. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Mpeasem’, which simply means I don’t want trouble.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products like weavings, mesh, thread, needle etc.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo, 50 years old and working as a tricycle operator in Santiago City, also cultivates his little rice field. He uses some of the income from his farm for the education of his two college-aged children, and is now requesting a loan of PHP 10,000.00 for the registration and maintenance of his motorcycle. He is doing his best to sustain the needs of his two children and hopefully enable them to finish their college education.

Wifredo is happily living with his wife Ofelia and four children in Barangay Rizal of Santiago City. Their children are: Wilmer - 23 years old, college undergraduate; Rowel - 21 years old, a high school graduate; John - 17 years old, a senior high school student and Warren - 15 years old, high school freshman.

loans.use: Motorcycle maintenace.

loans.name: Glenda Orestila

texts.es: la Sra. Glenda G. se dedica a la venta ropa nueva y cosmeticos, ella compra el producto en algunas tiendas de la ciudad y sale a vender a barrios, caserios, colonias y pueblos cercanos ala ciudad de Choluteca, pero ella quiere ir a la frontera con nicaragua a comprar mercaderia ya que ahi es mas barata y de buena calidad, asi ella compra su producto a mejor precio y tiene mejores ganancias. ella tiene una pequeña hija a quien saca adelante con la ayuda de su esposo, el se dedica a vender camarones, ellos son  muy trabjadores y tienen muchos deseos de salir adelante con su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Glenda G. is sells new clothing and cosmetics. She purchases her products in stores in the city and resells them in the local neighbourhoods, complexes, colonies, and towns nears the city of Choluteca. But she wants to go to the Nicaragua border to purchase merchandise because it is much more affordable there and of good quality. This way she can purchase her products at a better price and have better earnings. She has a little girl that she supports with the help of her husband who is a shrimp salesman. They both are very hard workers and they have so many dreams of pulling through with their little girl.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
“Persevere to become successful,” says Julie R.. This saying motivates Julie to work very hard for her family. Her family lives in the village of Bonfal Proper in Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She finished high school and is doing her best and is determined to become successful someday through patience, hard work and with the support of her husband Wagner. They have two children.

Julie sells fish in their village while her husband sells coconuts. They earn enough to educate their children. Because of their desire to improve their business, Julie is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 8,000 as additional working capital. She is very thankful to Kiva lenders as believes the loan will help increase her standard of living.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl is 33 years old and married. She and her husband are gifted with a daughter named Jessa May who is now in the elementary level. They are presently residing in Barangay Lullutan of Ilagan, Isabela. Sheryl wishes that her child will finish her studies until college so as to be able to have a good future someday, because she believes that a way to success starts with knowledge and, through education, knowledge is acquired.

To uplift their standard of living, Sheryl ventures herself in food vending in their village. She also sells barbecue in the afternoons. Lack of financial capital sometimes makes her business work very slow - thus her request to borrow from Kiva lenders the amount of PHP 4,000 as additional capital. She dreams to have a better standard of living. That’s why she is working very hard to support her family’s daily needs.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: İkram

texts.en:
İkram S. has always been a hard-working man who has made sure, from a young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread. He is married with 4 children.
 
İkram has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs. With a starting capital of $30 (USD), thanks to his perseverance and dedication, İkram began this enterprise 3 years ago. Over time he expanded his business, and today his whole family is engaged in this business. 

Today İkram needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase the range of his goods. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: purchase additional foodstuffs to increase the range of goods in his store

loans.name: Aqelah Group

texts.en:
Aqelah is the group leader of Aqelah group. There are three members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their own businesses: Nasema and Saleha want to take a loan for the business of tailoring, and Aqelah would like to take a loan for her father's vegetable business. They all want to see progress in their businesses and to earn more money to support their families better.

They say that these loans can be very useful because they provide a chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of ingredients for her grocery.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua is fifty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to five children: two daughters and three sons, who are currently in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Akua is a trader, running a palm oil production business. She procures the palm fruits from nearby communities and supplies to retailers in her community. She has been in business for over twenty-five years and wants a loan to buy palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 38 years old and married with two children. She sells provisions like noodles, toothpaste, cornflakes, sugar, etc.

Dorothy hopes for the loan of N70,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She expresses her gratitude to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Florina

texts.en:
Florina S. runs a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is married and has a small baby. She is a 22-year-old woman living in the town of Malie. Florina has been in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 650 talas a month.

In 2006, Florina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 750 talas from SPBD, which was used to purchase products to sell, Florina is now requesting a new loan of 1500 talas which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her fourth loan from SPBD. Florina plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Batyi's Group

texts.en:
Batyi is the leader of this group. Her husband is engaged in animal husbandry and agriculture. For the age of fifty four, Batyi has achieved a lot. She and her husband have raised seven children, all of whom are now adults and have their own families, except for their youngest son, who is just seven years old. Her daughter, age 36 and single, is temporarily unemployed. Her oldest son, age 35, is married and works as a car mechanic. Their second son, age 34, is married and works as a driver. Their third son is also married and works as a taxi-driver. Next is another son who works in a factory. The fifth son is 21 years old and works at a construction site. Their youngest son goes to school.

Despite having this army of sons as her supporters, Batyi has been fully independent in managing her own business. She sells sheep. It has been her main source of income for six years. By doing this, she has been able to buy a flat for one of her sons and help him get married. Her income is now around $230, even though she started with a third as much money. She obtains her children’s help when needed. It does not undermine the courage and determination that she possesses.

Now Batyi is preparing a dowry for her daughter, whom she wants to marry off next year. So she has thought about obtaining a loan to by cattle to increase the turnover and prepare a rich dowry for her daughter.

Batyi’s partners are: Kyial, Nazgul and Zarylbubu. Kyial, age 32, is the mother of three children. She sells “bozo” and “maxym,” which are national drinks. Her husband is a taxi driver. Kyial needs a loan to purchase ingredients to prepare the national drinks.

Zarylbubul, age 46, is a widow and the mother of four children. Fortunately, most of them are adust. To make a living, Zarylbubu works as a cashier. Nazgul needs a loan to buy a dowry for her daughter.

Nazgul, age 27, has two children. She works in an ice cream shop. She needs a loan to buy furniture.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites M. is from the village of Palacapao, Quezon Bukidnon. She is 38 years old. Marites is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling rice and corn in the local community. Marites has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Marites joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Marites is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 14th loan taken out by Marites from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Natalie

texts.en: Natalia T. skillfully faces challenges to bring her family out of the umbrella of poverty. Through loans she had requested from ASHI since her membership in 2007, she has able to finance several livelihood activities, which she has learned from her parents and others, such as cosmetology (manicure, pedicure, and haircutting), hog raising and native mat weaving (using palm tree leaf called “pandan” in Filipino) to earn money. At her age, now 74, it was hard for her to sustain her sources of income because she the sole provider for her 14-year-old daughter who is a high school student while she also helps some of her grandchildren and children who have their own families.

loans.use: Purchase piglets for fattening and finance her mat-weaving business.

loans.name: Gricelda

texts.en:
Gricelda is 21 years old; she lives with her partner, Juan Carlos, in the indigenous community of Suretka near the Caribbean coast of Costa Rica.

Gricelda has a business selling merchandise in her community. She spends her days knocking on doors, offering various products such as perfumes, clothing, sandals, cosmetics and other household items to potential customers. She is a hardworking individual which is exhibited through her initiative to complete high school by attending night classes.

Gricelda is applying for a loan of 200,000 colons. With this loan she plans to purchase more products for sale and hopes to secure a better price from her suppliers through larger purchases. This will be her second loan with Fundacion Mujer; her first loan was paid back, on time and in full, in a short six months. This loan will enable her business to grow and take her closer to her dream of one day being able to open a store from where she could sell products, allowing her to travel less.

Gricelda’s main challenges are logistical. In order to purchase raw materials, she must travel to a town called Chasse. The town is not very far away, in absolute terms, but it is separated from Suretka by a large river. The river water travels at high speed which makes crossing dangerous, especially during the rainy season. Gricelda says that her main challenge is getting from her village, Suretka, to the location of her supplier, in Chasse. Buses are infrequent; Gricelda often ends up making the trip on foot which is a laborious task to say the least.

Indigenous rural areas such as Suretka are characterized by many difficulties such as a lack of job opportunities, infrastructural deficiencies, low levels of formal education and lack of available financial services. Additionally, despite her entrepreneurial spirit, Gricelda´s efforts have been hamstrung due to her exclusion from the traditional banking system. This is where you, through Kiva’s lending model, can help. Your loan is a direct investment in the improvement of living conditions of a woman living in a poor Indigenous community of Caribbean Costa Rica. By lending to Gricelda, a proactive and hard working entrepreneur, you are enabling her to take the first steps on a path that leads to the end of poverty.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Víctor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor Manuel D. G. de 49 años de edad, reside en Apastepeque en el departamento de San Vicente. Vive junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como cosmetóloga y vive junto a sus tres hijos. Víctor posee una carpintería desde ya hace varios años, negocio el cual le ha permitido llevar el sustento diario a su familia por mucho tiempo. Ahora el desea poder surtir con más madera su carpintería ya que por ser un señor muy trabajador y responsable goza de mucho trabajo, lo cual le incentiva a seguir creciendo en el negocio. Víctor solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar madera y de esta manera poder aumentar su trabajo y así mismo agilizarlo ya que al contar con más materia prima para su trabajo no corre el riesgo de no poder entregar los pedidos a tiempo. Es por esto que Víctor espera mejorar su situación económica a través de dicho préstamo.
texts.en:
Víctor Manuel D. G. is 49 years old and lives in Apastepeque in the San Vicente department. He lives with his wife, a cosmetologist, and their three children. Víctor has had a carpentry workshop for several years, and this business has helped provide daily sustenance for the family for a long time. He now wants to supply his workshop with more lumber, as he is a very hard-working man who enjoys his work a great deal. This motivates him to continue growing his enterprise. Víctor is requesting a loan through which he can buy more wood to increase the amount of work he has and complete it faster, since this way he won’t run the risk of failing to meet deadlines on his orders. This is why Víctor is hoping to improve his financial situation through said loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood.

loans.name: Silvano Aquiles

texts.es:
El señor Silvano Aquiles A. como todo padre responsable se ha preocupado por el bienestar de su cónyuge y sus cuatro hijos a los que debe de mantener y brindarle las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen ya que están en edades escolares y requieren excelentes condiciones de vida.
Ha decidido mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda que por mucho tiempo han estado falladas y por este motivo es que no duda en solicitar un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de los materiales de construcción. Es importante destacar que él ha sido fiel cliente de la institución y con crédito anteriores logró comprar el terreno de su casa y ahora necesita continuar con la obra de construcción para brindarle un techo digno a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Silvano Aquiles A., like all responsible fathers, has worried about the well being of his life partner and their four children. He needs to support them and provide them with the necessary conditions to develop. They are school-aged and require excellent living conditions. He has decided to improve the house’s conditions. It has been failing for a long time. That is why he has not hesitated to ask for a loan with Ceprodel to buy construction materials. It is noteworthy that he has been a loyal client of the institution. With previous loans he was able to buy the land for his house. Now he needs to continue the construction work to give his children a decent roof.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Benkelema Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Benkelema sont essentiellement des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames  au quartier Babemba, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur quatrième  prêt solidaire. Les prêts  précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Elles font le commerce d’articles divers avec  la vente de wax – real, savons, friperie, pâte d’arachide etc.
Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 14 pièces de pagnes wax – real, 20 cartons de savons, 4 balles de friperies et 350kg d’arachides (pour en faire la pâte d’arachide). 
Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent au  marché de Médine, de façon ambulante  et à domicile, au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera réinvestie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The four members of the Benkelema group are essentially married women with an average age of 35 and 4 children, on average. They mostly live in polygamous families in the Babemba neighborhood of the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to satisfy the needs of their clientele, and they are on their fourth solidarity loan. The preceding loans have been correctly reimbursed.

They sell a variety of items such as Real brand African print cloth, soap, used clothing, peanut butter, etc. With their new loan they intend to buy 14 lengths of Real brand African print cloth, 20 cases of soap, 4 bales of used clothing, and 350 kg of peanuts (to make into peanut butter). They get their inventory at the Sikasso city market and in the surrounding villages. They sell at the Médine market, hawking their wares, and out of their houses, for cash and often on credit, to a clientele composed of men and women. They each expect to make an average monthly profit of 30,500 F CFA, of which part will be added to their savings or used for family needs, and the rest invested into their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various items for resale

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhor M. is 49 years old, and she lives in Dei Chrab village in Takeo province. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

She and her husband, Mr. Chhoem Ben, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice to support their family. They have a problem in the rice field because it is far from the irrigation system. They do not have the needed water supply to support their farm. Thus, Mrs. Nhor M. decided to ask for loan to buy a water machine, and with the rest of the loan, she would like to buy more fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy a water machine and more fertilizers

loans.name: Anifat

texts.en:
Anifat makes lovely Nigerian and Western hairstyles for her customers. She also sells hair extensions, cosmetics and creams. She opens her salon daily from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. She hopes to own a world-class salon in the future. She loves her business because she makes her customers look beautiful. 

She hopes for a loan of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more extensions to sell. Anifat is 28 years old and married with two children. Her eldest child is 10 years old while the youngest is 7. Her children are doing well in school. Her husband is a mechanic and he also supports their home. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Acner Adrian

texts.es:
El señor Acner Adrian U. T., tiene la edad de 31 años, vive en el Barrio Veracruz, es casado y su esposa es comerciante, apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen 2 hijos de las edades de 9 y 3 años de edad ambos son mujeres, por ellas es que se han propuesto remodelar la infraestructura del hogar.

El señor es transportista, y con los ingresos de ambos, no ajusta para la inversión al 100% del gasto que les llevaria el construir un muro al frente del hogar, parqa esto el solicita de un prestamo para la compra de materiales de construción. 

Ellos son una familia humilde que el beneficio con este apoyo, les significaria la mejoria a las condiciones económicas de toda la familia.
texts.en:
Acner Adrian U. T., age 31, lives in Barrio Veracruz, is married, and his wife is a merchant and helps with the household expenses. They have two girls, ages 9 and 3. For their sake, they plan to remodel the infrastructure of their home. Mr. T. works in shipping, but the income of both won't cover 100% of what it would cost to build a wall in front of their house. That is why they are requesting a loan to be able to buy the building materials. They are a humble family, and the benefits from this support would improve the economic condition of the entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of building materials

loans.name: Miss. Leanghong Chim Village Bank Group

texts.en: Miss. Leanghong C. is the leader of a twelve-person loan group in Preaek Ta In, Kandal province. She was elected by all the members who will use the loan for different purposes. She is a fisherwoman who is part of a three-person household. She tries to work hard fishing but still makes veR. little income, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy some piglets and pig food to start a new business breeding pigs. In this way, she hopes to increase her income in the coming year.

loans.use: To buy some piglets to raise

loans.name: Seydina Hamiza

texts.fr:
Monsieur Seydina Hamiza Koné est marié à une femme, père de 2 enfants,il est né vers 1976  dans la préfecture de Kadiolo, 3eme région administrative du Mali.  Il vit à Loulouni dans une famille monogame.
Il fait le commerçant depuis 5 ans et a comme créneau l’achat vente des habits prêt à porter. Il mène son commerce avec assez de réussite compte tenue de son expérience à la matière.
Il est à sa deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Le prêt passé a été bien remboursé et Seydina souhaite maintenir cette relation afin de mieux  satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse. 
Il compte acheter avec son prêt, 15 douzaines de prêt à porter pour les jeunes hommes et 30 douzaines pour les enfants. Il s’approvisionne au grand marché de  Sikasso ville et au marché de Bamako. Il vend au comptant et souvent à crédit, en détail à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Il envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour augmenter le fonds de commerce et l’autre partie sera mise en épargne car il  ambitionne construire une maison à usage à Kadiolo ville.
texts.en:
Mr. Seydina Hamiza Koné is married and the father of two children.  He was born around 1976 in Kadiolo Prefecture, 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. Seydina lives in Loulouni in a monogamous family.  He has been a merchant for five years, and his niche is in buying and selling read-to-wear clothing.  His business has been fairly successful, given his experience in it. Seydina is on his second collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso.  The past loan was repaid, and he wishes to maintain this relationship in order to satisfy further his burgeoning customers base.  He intends to use his loan to buy 15 dozen pieces of ready-to-wear clothing for young men and 30 dozen for children.  He gets his supplies at the grand market of Sikasso Ccity and at the Bamako market.  He accepts cash and often credit for retail sales made to a customer base composed of women and men.  He envisions making a monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA.  A portion of the profits will be use to increase his working capital, and the other portion will be put into savings, since his ambition is to build a house in Kadiolo City.  

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For buying ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Chanthea's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthea U. is the leader of this five-member group loan and has beE. selected by the group members, who all live in Rovieng village in Takeo province. The group members will all use their loans for different purposes.
Mrs. Chanthea U. is a 27-year-old married woman. She and her husband, Mr. Oun Orn, are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare field to cultivate rice for a living. Aside from farming, they also sell rice and salt. In order to support the rice business, Mrs. Chanthea U. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to enlarge her business activities. The couple has two childrE.; one is a student in the local school while the youngest is three years old.

loans.use: To buy more rice

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis, de 41 años,  es soltero y  vive en su casa que es propia, junto a su hermana Epifania (60) y su sobrina.
