En su familia todos colaboran con las actividades del hogar de manera organizada.Desde hace 15 años se dedica al comercio de productos comestibles en su vivienda y con la ayuda de todos los miembros de la casa.Paralelamente a esta labor se dedica a sembrar papa, alverja y maíz, que comercializa en el mercado de su  ciudad, a precios considerables que le alcanzan para surtir bien su bodega y obtener mayores ganancias.Lo que más le gusta es atender a los clientes porque le dan la oportunidad de conversar un poco y muchas veces él ayuda a resolver los problemas en su localidad. Para más adelante, piensa ampliar su negocio, y además desea  incrementar su  mercadería, de igual modo quiere empezar a ser prestar dinero a sus conocidos.Es el décimo tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y asegura que le agrada laborar en su banco comunal, porque todos los integrantes  buscan la unión y el desarrollo.Luis invertirá el dinero del préstamo en la compra de  mercadería  en productos comestibles, para dinamizar la venta en su tienda.
texts.en:
Luis, 41, is single and lives in his own home along with his sister, Epiphany, 60, and his niece. All members of his family work together with household chores. Luis has been selling groceries from his home for 15 years with the help of his family. At the same time he has grown potatoes, peas, and corn which he sells in the city market at fair prices that allow him to stock his store and increase his earnings. What he likes most is serving his customers because it gives him the opportunity to talk a bit and many times to resolve problems in his town. In the future he would like to expand his business and increase his merchandise. Likewise, he wants to begin to be able to lend money to his friends. This is his 13th loan with MFP and he says he likes working with his community bank because all the members seek connection and development. Luis will invest the loan in purchasing food products that will boost his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Vida Plena (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Vida Plena esta formado por señoras que buscan mejorar la salud de sus clientes ofreciéndoles productos naturales que mejoran su salud, todas son mujeres luchadoras, viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad mas importante económicamente del Ecuador, esta ciudad se caracteriza por sus iglesias, los cuatro ríos que bañan la ciudad y la calidez de su gente así como nuestras socias.
  
La Sra. María G. se encuentra en su segundo ciclo que realiza los créditos en la fundación y nos comenta que es un buen apoyo para la venta de sus productos.
La Señora María vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, por el sector de Narancay Bajo, tiene 36 años es madre soltera y ha procreado 4 hijos de 16 años gemelos y de 12 y 6 años de edad, lo dos primeros hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad y sus dos últimos hijos están en la escuela, sus hijos no tienen ningún apoyo de parte de su padre, esta orgullosa de contar con su casa propia.
Nuestra socia ha comenzado ha consumir los productos de Omnilife, hace 4 años y hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de este prestigioso producto, le va muy bien vende solo medio tiempo ya que le dedica también tiempo a sus hijos y familia.
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mas productos naturales de la misma marca, su meta es llegar a comprarse un carro para facilitarse en la venta de su producto.

La Sra. María P. vive en la parroquia de Tarqui, se dedica  a la venta de productos Omnilife, se ha dedicado a la venta de estos productos hace 4 años y vende sus productos todos los días sin tener un solo día de descanso, sale a vender su producto desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.
Nuestra socia tiene 42 años de edad, es soltera y es el sustento de la casa junto con su hermana ya que viven solas con su mamá, cuentan con su casa propia.
Nuestra socia se encuentra dos ciclos en el banco comunal y el dinero que ha obtenido le ha beneficiado para comprar más productos y es en lo que va invertir este crédito, su meta es crecer mucho más en su negocio para mejorar la economía de su hogar y poder ayudarle a su mamá.
texts.en:
The community bank Vida Plena is made up of women who want to improve the health of their customers through offering natural health products. They are all fighters. The women live in Cuenca, the third most economically important city in Ecuador. Cuenca is known for its churches, the four rivers that surround the city, and the warmth of its people, like these group members. María G. is entering her second loan cycle, and says that it is a good support for her business. Maria lives in the outskirts of Cuenca, in the Narancay Bajo sector. She is a 36-year-old single mother of 4 children, ages 12 and 6, and 16-year-old twins. The twins go to a high school in the city, and the two younger children are in elementary school. They do not get any support from the father, and are proud to own their own home. Maria began using Omnilife products 4 years ago and started selling this prestigious product 2 years ago. It is going very well and she only works part-time, since she also dedicates time to her children and family. Her credit will be invested in the purchase of more natural products from Omnilife; her goal is to eventually buy a car to facilitate her sales. Maria P. lives in the Tarqui parish, and has sold Omnilife products for 4 years. She sells every day without a single day of rest. She leaves to sell her products at 8 am and works until 8 pm. Maria is 42, single, and is the main earner in her household, along with her sister; they live alone with their mother in their own home. She has had two loan cycles in the community bank, and the money she has obtained has allowed her to buy more products. She will invest this credit in more products; her goal is to expand her business in order to improve the economic situation of her home and help her mother.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Omnilife natural health products

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Mr. Sem P. has been spending his life cultivating crops. This is a skill he learned from his grandparent when he was young. He is now married and has four children who are going to school and work. His wife appears on the right in the photo. She works in the farm fields frequently alongside him. Growing crops is an annual action with which he has had great success. He is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. Sem P. is concerned that he doesn’t have a vehicle to deliver the mature crops to the market for sale, so he decided to look for assistance to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima S. is from the village of West Poblacion, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Zosima is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Zosima owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Zosima has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Zosima joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zosima is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the Zosima's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: Alejandra tiene 21 años, ella vive junto a su esposo y su hijo Aldair de 4 años de edad, en una casa que le cedieron sus padres. El trabajo que se dedica es la venta de ropa y la manera como llega vender es mediante pedidos que le hacen sus clientes. Para esto posee una serie de prendas en diversos diseños y en modelos que está en boga, siendo estos adquiridos en el mercado mayorista y textil de  Lima, y que luego son ofrecidos a un precio más conveniente a sus compradores. En un futuro le gustaría tener un puesto donde pueda ofrecer la mercadería que tiene, exhibiendo vitrinas y maniquíes para tener mayor salida de sus productos. Sabe que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación lograra todas sus metas. Es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete de a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para así mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Alejandra is 21 years old and lives with her husband and son Aldair, who is 4, in a house given to them by her parents. Alejandra earns a living by selling clothes according to her customers’ requests. She stocks a variety of clothing styles and designs that are in fashion which are purchased in the wholesale textile markets in Lima and then offered at a more convenient price for her buyers. In the future she would like to have a clothing stand with display cases and mannequins to display her merchandise in order to increase the turnover of her products. She knows that by much dedicated effort she will achieve all her goals. This is her first loan with MFP and she commits to being very punctual with all her payments. With the loan she is seeking she plans to buy a greater quantity of merchandise by which to improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more clothing merchandise

loans.name: Sope Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE MAME DIARRA est créé le 04 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 12 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Elles ont formé leur groupe par copinage et par voisinage. 

Madame NDEYE LOBE G., debout à l'extrême droite de la photo, est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge. 

Elle fait de l'embouche bovine et ovine. Elle pratique cette activité depuis son entrée dans le Banc Villageois il y a trois ans de cela.

Avec son prêt de 200.000 francs CFA elle va acheter un bœuf et deux moutons. Elle va les emboucher pendant au moins 5 mois avant de les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaire de sa localité.

Avec ses bénéfices elle va participer à l'amélioration des condition de vie de sa famille. Par exemple la nourriture et l'habillement des enfants. En sus, elle verse mensuellement une épargne au niveau de son Banc Villageois.
texts.en:
The Sope Mame Diarra solidarity group was created on 4th December 2007. It is made up of 12 women who are all from the same village, and who are all friends or neighbors. Mrs. Ndeye Lobe G., who is standing at the extreme right of the photo, is in charge of the group. She is 43 years old, married and mother to five children, who are in her care. She has a beef and sheep fattening business, which she has carried out since she joined the Banc Villageois three years ago. With her 200,000 francs loan she is going to buy an ox and two sheep. She will fatten them up for at least five months before reselling them at the weekly markets in her town. With the profits she makes she will contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions. She will, for instance, be able to contribute to the costs of feeding and clothing the children. Furthermore, she saves money each month with her Banc Villageois.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an ox and two sheep

loans.name: Gorrett

texts.en:
Gorrett is a young lady, 31 years old, and is a single mother of three children between 13 and 2 years old. She has no other dependents apart from her children and her family therefore consists of four people. She owns her home and her family goal is to educate her children.

Gorrett lives in Hoima, Uganda where she has operated a bar business for five years. She started as a housemaid then later on worked as a bar attendant before saving some money which she used to start her own small bar. The only challenge she has is that electrify bills are always too high. In future she would like her business to grow into a big pub.

Gorrett wants the loan to furnish her chicken house with a good floor and to buy more chicks.

loans.use: To furnish her chicken house with a good floor and also buy more chicks

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 26 years old and has a two-year-old child.  He is a member of Kamahindu Victory Group with Faulu Kenya, where he saves his money.  He does dairy farming to earn a living.  He has been in the business for five years.  He also does crop farming.  He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy manure, farm inputs and fertilizer.  He hopes to improve his farming in the future.  He sees himself becoming a large-scale farmer in five years.

loans.use: To buy manure, farm inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis, de 46 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposa Tania de 36 años y de sus 3 hijos menores que estudian en el colegio, juntos se esfuerzan por salir adelante cada día. Desde hace 14 años, este trabajador hombre se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte en una combi (movilidad que transporta a 12 personas). Dice que le gusta mucho su trabajo pues obtiene regulares ganancias, además se entretiene mucho pues mientras se moviliza observa las calles y se distrae. Aunque muchas veces siente el cansancio del tráfico de la ciudad, pero sabe que todo sacrificio tiene su recompensa, en este caso, son las ganancias diarias que obtiene luego de jornada larga de trabajo. Así transcurren los días de este hombre que tiene muchos planes en mente, como el de comprar varias movilidades para emprender su empresa de transporte, por eso se esfuerza cada día hasta conseguirlo. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar con puntualidad sus cuotas, porque no quiere defraudar a todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá salir adelante en su negocio. Luis tiene planeado invertir el crédito que solicita, en la compra de nuevas llantas pues las que tiene están algo deterioradas; asimismo podrá darle un mantenimiento técnico.
texts.en:
Luis, 46, lives in his own home with his wife, Tania, 36, and their three minor children who are in school. Together they make an effort to get ahead in life daily. For the last 14 years this hard working man has provided public transportation services in a combi (a 12-passenger vehicle). He says that he enjoys his work very much because he earns regular income. Besides, he amuses himself quite a bit as he travels along the streets observing. Although the city traffic often exhausts him he knows that every sacrifice has its reward. In this case it’s daily profits he gets after a long day of work. Thus the days pass for this man who has many plans in mind, like buying several vehicles to launch a transportation firm. He therefore makes a daily effort to reach this goal. This is his first loan with MFP and he promises to repay on time because he doesn’t want to disappoint all those who made the money possible that will permit him to succeed with his business. Luis plans to use the requested funds to buy new tires because the ones he has are pretty deteriorated. He also plans to provide technical maintenance to the vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires and provide technical maintenance to his vehicle.

loans.name: Vicente Elias

texts.es:
Vicente es un padre de familia de 40 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector denominado Fundo Marquez del distrito de Jayanca, un distrito agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicado a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde muy joven, se dedica a trabajar como agricultor independiente ya que cuenta con un pequeño terreno de cultivo de su propiedad. Adicionalmente trabaja como obrero en una fábrica agroindustrial que se encuentra localizada en su distrito. Vicente depende estas actividades para mantener a su familia y salir adelante por lo que siempre se esfuerza en ambas para mantener asegurado su sustento.

Actualmente ha instalado maíz en su terreno de cultivo y está trabajando arduamente para obtener una buena consecha. Para asegurarse el logro de esta meta ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que planea invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y pesticidas con los cuales va a aplicar mantenimiento a su cultivo.

Eugenio es una persona bastante trabajadora y empeñosa, el siempre pone toda su energia y esfuerzo en las labores que realiza, las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien tranquilo y responsable.
texts.en:
Vicente is a 40 year old father who lives with his wife and children in the Fundo Marquez sector of the Jayanca district. This is an agricultural disrict in the Lambayeqye district located more than an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Since his youth he has worked in agriculture. He is a farmer since he depends on a small piece of farmland in his property. In addition he works as an agroindustrial factory worker in his distict. Vicente depends on these jobs to help his family assure they have their basic necessities met since it is difficult to maintain them.

At the moment he has planted a corn crop and is working hard to have a good turnout. To assure he meets this goal it is convenient that he request a 1500 soles (Peruvian currency) from Edpyme Alternativa to buy fertilizers and persticides to maintain his crop.

Vicente is a hardworking and diligent person. He always puts all of his energy and strength in the work he does. The people who know him describe him as a tranquil and responsible person.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides to maintain his corn crop.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary Y. makes a living selling clothes and has applied for a loan so that she can buy more inventory to sell to her customers. She is 30 years old, married and has six children, two of whom are in school. With the additional income made possible by this loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Agatuna

texts.en:
Agatuna D. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Agatuna is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Agatuna owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising goats for sale. Agatuna has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Agatuna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agatuna is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional goats to raise. This will be the first loan taken out by Agatuna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional goats to raise

loans.name: Junita

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Junita T..  She is married and has 2 children, aged 11 and 4.  In 2007, she established  her vegetable farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent loan to buys seeds and fertilizer for her farming.  In the future, Junita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:  BPW Partner Page.    Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Yut

texts.en:
Yut R. (in the photo) and her husband, Chhoung Vat, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1979 and have seven children. 

Yut was a silk weaver for more than 15 years, but she quit weaving on her loom because the price of silk fabric dropped.

She now wants to start weaving again because weaving is a traditional profession. Yut is asking for a loan of $200 to purchase weaving materials.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her business.

loans.name: María Ilda

texts.es:
María Ilda tiene 55 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su familia en el distrito D. San José, una zona pesquera que pertenece a la provincia D. Lambayeque y que se encuentra situada a más D. veinte minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio, allí suele ofrecer a sus clientes productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes a precios razonables y brindando una buena atención, adicionalmente ofrece en venta artículos D. oficina y útiles escolares durante la temporada escolar. Su negocio tiene bastante acogida en la zona y le sirve para ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a su familia.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio para poder responder D. mejor modo a su demanda, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.
texts.en:
María Ilda is 55 years old.  She is married and lives with her family in San José district, a fishing area in Lambayeque province which is more than twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

María Ilda has a small grocery store in her home where she offers her customers essentials and groceries at reasonable prices and provides them with good service.  She also sells office supplies and school supplies during the school season.  Her business is quite popular in the area and it allows her to help her husband to get the family ahead.

María Ilda would like to expand her business so that she can better respond to demand.  She is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: To buy products to expand the small grocery store she has in her home

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa de verdes  montañas y paisajes  encantadores, encontramos el lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal San Judas Tadeo.

La señora Elena, lleva 14 ciclos en el  Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución y porque los intereses son muy bajos. Tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos  hijos de 15 y 11 años, los cuales estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Tiene un negocio de comida rápida en el cual prepara tortillas de maíz, yuca, bolones, corviches, café, chocolate,  además también vende gaseosas y aguas. Trabaja de lunes a sábado, en la elaboración de alimentos los mismos que su esposo lleva a distribuir en la cooperativa de transportes Coactur.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar productos e ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración de los alimentos. Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en: In the outskirts of Portoviejo, a beautiful city of green mountains and enchanted landscapes, we find the place where the members of the San Judas Tadeo communal bank gather every 15 days. Ms. Elena has been with the communal bank for 14 cycles and she enjoys the low interest rates and the additional benefits offered by the institution. She is 31 years old, married, and has two children who are 15 and 11 years old and attend high school and primary school, respectively. Her husband is a businessman. She has a fast food business for which she prepares corn tortillas, cassava, bolones [smashed banana balls stuffed with cheese or pork rinds], corviches [deep-fried stuffed pastries made with bananas, fish and onion], coffee and hot chocolate. She also sells soft drinks and fresh juices. She works preparing these dishes from Monday to Saturday, and her husband then brings them to sell on buses of the Coactur transportation system. Ms. Elena will use this loan to buy necessary products and ingredients for preparing her dishes. Her dream is to have a large restaurant.

loans.use: to buy products and ingredients for preparing dishes

loans.name: Anecito

texts.en:
Anecito N. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is 44 years old. Anecito is married and has three children aged 20, 18 and 12. To make a living, Anecito owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Aside from farming, Anecito also owns a sari-sari store that his wife manages.

Anecito joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anecito has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Anecito is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Phallin

texts.en:
Mrs. Phallin Y. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Sokhom Noun, live in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. The couple has been married since 1996 and has four children: three sons and one daughter. 

Mrs. Phallin Y. runs a grocery store at home in the village and also rents a space in her house to garment-factory workers. She has requested a Kiva loan two times; she now is asking for another loan of $300 to purchase grocery items for her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her inventory

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan K., 27, is the mother of a young child. She has been in the farming business for a long time in Kompong Tom province, Cambodia. To earn a living, Chan K. has cultivated a rice crop on her own farmland. With this loan, Chan K. will purchase a plot of farmland from a villager in order to expand and grow various kinds of crops. This will enable her family to accrue an extra profit to meet their daily expenses. Note: Chan K., her husband, and their lovely child appear in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of farmland in order to grow various kinds of crops.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy material for making mats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase horticultural inputs.

loans.name: Sidiki

texts.fr:
Monsieur Sidiki S. est âgé de 46 ans et vit dans une famille polygame avec ses  épouses et ses 6 enfants  dans le quartier Lafiala  de la préfecture de Koutiala. 
Du à des problèmes de famille, il a prématurément abandonné l’école pour s’intéresser aux activités génératrices de revenus depuis son enfance. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, il s’est finalement intéressé à la vente de poissons fumés qu’il appris auprès de son père il y a 20 ans. Les poissons fumés sont très prisés à Koutiala.  
Pour pouvoir  augmenter son fonds de commerce et renforcer sa capacité de vente, il a décidé de rejoindre  l‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, et il est à son premier prêt individuel. Avec ce financement, il compte acheter  4 paniers de poissons fumés  à Korientzé  (Région de Mopti) auprès des  pêcheurs d’ethnie  Bozo  et  Somono. Monsieur Sidiki  effectue sa vente au  marché poisson de Koutiala  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’ hommes,  au comptant et à crédit. Avec ce financement il compte  réaliser un profit de 70000FCFA par mois qu’il utilisera  pour  le remboursement des intérêts de Soro Yiriwaso, satisfaire les besoins  de sa  famille et investir le reste dans son activité
texts.en:
Mr. Sidiki S. is 46 years old and lives in a polygamous family with his wives and his six children in the Lafiala district of Koutiala prefecture. Due to some family problems, he quit school prematurely and became interested in revenue-generating businesses since he was young.  After having run several businesses unsuccessfully, he was ultimately interested in selling smoked fish. This was something he learned from his father twenty years ago. Smoked fish is highly prized in Koutiala.  

To be able to increase his business capital and to bolster his selling capacity, Sidiki decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He is now on his first individual loan. With this financing, he intends to buy 4 baskets of smoked fish in Korientzé (Region of Mopti) from fisher folk of the Bozo and Somono ethnic groups. He makes his sales at the Koutiala fish market. He accepts cash or credit from a customer base composed of women and men. 

With this financing, Sidiki plans on making a profit of 70,000 francs CFA per month that he will use to cover the Soro Yiriwaso loan interest and to satisfy the needs of his family. The rest will be invested in his business.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan is 46 years old. She lives in Kakheti, in the village of Patardzeuli. Ketevan is married and lives with her husband and 25-year-old son. Ketevan’s husband works as a driver and earns 500 Laris per month. Her son is unemployed at the moment. Ketevan earns 350 Laris per month, selling traditional Georgian cheese in Tbilisi. She has three milk cows, whose milk is used for the production of cheese. 

With the requested loan, Ketevan plans to purchase 4-5 calves and raise them. In 6-7 months she will sell the grown calves for a higher price. The profit will be reinvested in the same activity – more calves will be purchased for the next season. She hopes that after some time she’ll be able to put aside some savings for renovation of their house.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en: Mary Joy R. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 24 years old. Mary Joy is married and has an infant. To make a living, Mary Joy runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling snack foods, candies, biscuits and spices in the local community. She is also buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing like t-shirts and blouses. Mary Joy has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2009, Mary Joy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Mary Joy is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods for the store. This will be the second loan taken out by Mary Joy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods for the store.

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un cliente de  33 años de edad, es padre soltero de dos hijos los cuales tienen 7 y 10 años de edad. Miguel vive en el distrito de Pomalca- Chiclayo. Pomalca es una zona rica en sus bienes naturales, existe mucha agricultura y ganadería.

Miguel se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte público, es taxista y cuenta con un pequeño carro donde desarrolla su labor. Esta actividad la viene desarrollando desde hace 5 años.  Ser taxista le permite a  Miguel generar ingresos para la educación de sus hijos, él no puede descuidar esta actividad ya que el bienestar de sus hijos depende de ella. Sin embargo la unidad móvil de Miguel ha estado presentando algunas fallas en su motor.
 
Miguel solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles, el cuál le permitirá arreglar las fallas de motor de su vehículo, así como darle un mantenimiento a este.

Miguel es un cliente recurrente de Edpyme Alternativa y tiene buenas referencias en cuanto a la cancelación de sus pagos.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 33 year old client. He is a single father of two children who are 7 and 10. Miguel lives in the district of Pomalca- Chiclayo. Pomalca is an area rich in natural resources. There is a lot of farming and cattle raising.  

Miguel offers public transport services. He is a taxi driver with a small car in which he does his work. He has been doing this activity for 5 years. Being a taxi driver allows Miguel to generate income for his children's education. He cannot neglect this activity since his children's wellbeing depends on it. Noetheless, Miguel's mobile unit has been having some problems with its motor.  
 
Miguel is asking for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 nuevos soles. This will allow him to fix the problem's in his vehicle's motor, as well a do maintenance on it.  

Miguel is a return client of Edpyme Alternativa and he has good references in regards to making his payments.

loans.use: to repair a mobile unit.

loans.name: Jesus Alberto

texts.es:
El Joven Jesús Alberto ,tiene 28 años de edad, tiene un hijo de dos años de edad, el es originario de la comarca Matapalo localizada en Pueblo Nuevo , Municipio de Estelí, de oficio agricultor se dedica a sembrar hortalizas tales como tomate y chiltoma . El empezó desde niño, su padre le enseño las labores del campo, como sembrar,  en especial granos básicos, preparar el terreno toda esa enseñanza le sirvió de mucho fue gracias a eso  que con le tiempo se fue independizando poco a poco de su padre hace 5 años siembra por su propia cuenta, sembrando hortalizas y con lo obtenido de las ganancias fue haciendo su casita poco a poco. Su papa le ayuda cuando puede, pues le gustaría ir creciendo su producción poco a poco. 
El solicito el préstamo para comprar insumos y pago de mano de obra para sembrar tomate. Con esta inversión espera sacar un producción con altos rendimientos y buena calidad y darle un mejor mantenimiento a su siembra. 
El desea seguir sembrando, hacerle mejoras a su hogar. Tiene como meta próxima hacer un pozo.
texts.en:
Jesús Alberto, 28, has a two-year-old son.  He is from Matapalo which is located in Pueblo Nuevo, Estelí Municipality.  He is a vegetable farmer; he grows tomatoes and peppers.  He started as a child.  His father taught him farming chores like how to plant, especially basic grains, and to prepare the soil.  All that knowledge was very helpful because thanks to it he was able, in time, to become independent from his parents.  Since five years ago he’s been farming for himself.  He grows vegetables and has used his profits from their sale to build his house little by little.  His father helps him when he can for he’d like to increase production gradually.

He asked for the loan to buy farming supplies and pay labor costs to plant tomatoes.  With this investment he hopes to produce high quality crop yields and to provide maintenance to his plants.  He wants to continue planting and to do some home improvements.  His next goal is to dig a well.

loans.use: buy farming supplies and pay labor costs for his tomato crops.

loans.name: Bayani

texts.en:
Bayani, 21 years of age, is still single.  He has been growing corn for almost 4 years.  Last season his net income was 35,000 PHP. 

He is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase additional seedling and fertilizer for his farm.  He would like to maintain his good relationship with KIVA and ASKI to request larger loans so that he can have a plentiful harvest.

loans.use: To purchase additional seedling and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 42 years old and lives in Oroquieta City. She is married with three children.

Chona has a jewelry repair business and earns approximately PHP 3000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan to purchase additional equipment for her jewelry repair shop.

Chona has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment for her jewelry repair shop.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is married and has 3 children. She is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. Editha has been farming for 5 years, growing vegetables to earn a living. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase fertilizers. Editha has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, 45 years old, lives in the village of Kakabeti, in the Kakheti region. Mariam is married and lives with her husband, Akaki, two adult sons and two daughters-in-law. Mariam has a small grocery shop in the village and is also actively involved in the family's agricultural business. The family has 3 hectares of vineyard and sell their grapes at the local market. On another 3 hectares of land, they grow watermelons and sell the harvested fruit to retailers. 

The family's average monthly income is 1,200 GEL. Mariam is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and drugs to treat their watermelon plants for parasites. This investment will increase the quality of the harvested fruits and their potential price as well, raising the family's income. Mariam plans to use the increase in income to purchase household appliances in order to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and drugs to treat their watermelon plants for parasites.

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is from the village of Khizabavra, South Georgia. He is 23 years old and lives with his father, adult brother and two sisters. All family members are involved in the family farming business. In particular, they have three milk cows and produce approximately 60 kg of cheese per month. They sell it in Akhaltsikhe (nearby town). In addition, Gela grows potatoes on family-owned land and sells approximately two tons of potatoes in nearby villages. The total average monthly income of the family is 300 Laris. 

Gela requested a loan from Credo to purchase a mini-bus. He will use it to transport his potatoes and cheese. At the moment, he doesn’t have a car and has to rent it to transport his products, which is quite expensive. When he has a mini-bus, he will significantly save the costs of transportation. On the other hand, he will also rent it to villagers as well, getting additional income. 

Gela plans to reinvest the increase in income and expand the dairy farm.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-bus to transport his agricultural products

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 43 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Eugenio de 50 años y su querida hija Stefanny de 13 años, a quien desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida.Maria, mujer de arduas labores que cumplir, por ello se despierta muy temprano para preparar los alimentos para los miembros de su familia para luego dirigirse a abrir las puertas de su negocio en espera de sus primeros consumidores, La tienda de abarrotes de Sabina es una de las más visitadas de su centro poblado por el gran carisma que posee y la amabilidad en su trato, han hecho que sea la preferida por sus vecinos, quienes no dudan en hacer sus compras sabiendo de la gran variedad de productos de primera necesidad lo encontraran en la tienda de Sabina. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es dialogar con sus clientes, lleva 12 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer de pie todo el transcurso del día. Con el apoyo del crédito solicitado comprará más provisiones para su tienda.Más adelante, espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en la más preferida y concurrida de su comunidad.Este será su quinto crédito y necesita el apoyo de los financistas para llevar consigo  su propósito, además se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente y agradece por ser parte de su banco comunal.Con el monto solicitado, comprará mas mercaderías como sacos de arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, conservas y entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Maria, 43, is a happy and hardworking woman. She lives in a rented house together with her husband, Eugenio, 50, and her beloved daughter, Stefanny, 13, for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. Maria, a woman who has many tasks to perform, wakes up very early in the morning to prepare food for her family before going to open her business and await her first customers. The Sabina grocery story is one of the most frequented in the town center due to Maria’s great charisma and her courteous treatment of customers. These have made her store a favorite in the neighborhood, whose occupants do not hesitate to make purchases there, knowing of the great variety of essential goods they will find.

What Maria likes best about her work is the opportunity to talk to her customers. She has been in this business for 12 years and considers the most difficult aspect having to remain on her feet all day. This loan will enable her to buy more supplies for her store. In the future she hopes that her business will grow and that it will become the busiest and most popular store in the wider community. This will be her fifth loan and she needs the funding to help her fulfill her goal. In addition, she is committed to making her payments on time and is grateful that she is a member of her communal bank. She will buy more merchandise with the loan such as sacks of flour, sugar, milk, noodles and canned food among other supplies.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as sacks of rice, sugar, milk, noodles and canned goods among other supplies.

loans.name: Yadira Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Yadira tiene su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general, desde hace más de 8 años, la experiencia que ha obtenido en su negocio ha sido muy reconfortante. La mayoría de sus clientes siempre le solicitan una gran variedad de productos. ella tiene 4 hijos pero solamente 1 está a su cargo, siempre se ha hecho responsable por proporcionarle las cosas más básicas, a pesar de que ella no pudo terminar sus estudios quiere que su hija logra ser una profesional. Este crédito es para la compra de  perfumes, calzado, ropa en general, cosméticos, sabanas, entre otros.
texts.en: Yadira has had a business selling general merchandise for over 8 years.  The experience she’s acquired in business has been reassuring.  Most of her customers always request a wide variety of merchandise from her.  She has four children but only one is still dependent on her.  She’s always been responsible for providing them with the basics. Even though she was unable to finish her schooling she wants her daughter to become a professional.  This loan is to buy perfume, footwear, clothing in general, cosmetics and sheets, among others.

loans.use: to buy perfume, footwear, clothes in general, cosmetics and sheets, among others.

loans.name: Geovanna Rocío

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, en este lugar se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Geovanna, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y aun no tiene hijos. Su esposo es artesano. 

Nuestra amiga se dedica a la compra y venta de  de adornos y cerámicas, pero sin descuidar su hogar ya que tiene su local en su casa, allí ella vende todo tipo de artesanía, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00. Además por las noches ayuda a su esposo en la elaboración de las obras. Nos cuenta que ella además de vender lo que fabrican también vende los productos que otros artesanos que producen en su localidad. Lleva más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad y  le ha ido muy bien.
 
Este crédito es para comprar más artesanía y materia prima como: arcilla, pinceles, pinturas y esmaltes para la elaboración de estas obras. Lleva 12 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy unidas y nunca han tenido ningún problema. 

su sueño es tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the communal bank "Para el Futuro de la Mujer" meets in the Montecristi Canton.  This place is known in the province and country for its rich traditional culture.  One can find here a wide variety of handicrafts that are made by the local people following traditional customs.

Here we meet Mrs. Geovanna who is 23, married and has no children.  Her husband is a craftsman.  She buys and sells ornaments and ceramics but also takes care of her home since this is where she has her shop set up.  She sells all kinds of crafts and works from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  At night she helps her husband with his work.  She says that she not only sells what they make but also products made by other people in their town.  She has been in business for over five years and it has gone well.

She plans to use the loan to buy crafts and raw materials such as clay, brushes, paint and enamel.  She has been involved with the communal bank for 12 loan cycles and she enjoys it because her colleagues are very supportive of each other and have never had any problems.

Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy crafts, clay, brushes, paint and enamel.

loans.name: Mouy

texts.en: Mouy, 57, resides with her husband and one kid in Battambong province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. Mouy sells fish for an income of around USD 4 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 30 on the other necessary expenses. Mouy is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her kid to commute to work. With the remainder of the loan, she wants to purchase more fish to sell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her kid to commute to work

loans.name: Dorothe

texts.fr:
Femme de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 5 et 15 ans.Elle se lance dans la vente des vivres frais il y' a de cela 20 ans.Elle a déjà bénéficie de 3 cycles de prêts.
Ses ventes ont largement augmentées , elle a en moyenne 55.000 fr a 200.000 fr par jour.

Avec le nouveau prêt elle va renforcer le stock de ses marchandises en achetant des 20 cartons de poules a bouillir,20 cartons  de la viande avant et arriéré, 20 cartons de cuisses de poulets...
 Tres entreprenante, elle tient a aller au bout avec Hope,elle a déjà sa chambre froide et veut continuer dans le même sens.
texts.en: She is 45 years old, married and has three children who are between the ages of 5 and 15. She has been in the business of selling fresh goods for the past 20 years. She has already benefited from three previous loans. Her sales have increased significantly, she makes on average between 55,000 and 200,000 cfa francs per day. With this new loan, she is going to replenish her inventory by purchasing 20 cases of chickens, 20 cases of different cuts of meat, and 20 cases of chicken thighs. Very entrepreneurial, she intends to continue working with Hope Congo. She already has a freezer room and will continue to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy boxes of whole chickens, chicken thighs and fish.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is 26 years old and married to a businessman who sells cattle. Aisha has no children yet.  She sells different items such as potatoes, rice, cooking oil, sugar and salt. She plans to use her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 40 years old and lives in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has six children, with five of them currently in school. For the past eight years, Moses has been working hard to manage his business of selling timber. 

To help expand his business, Moses has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more trees and will help Moses to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Moses hopes that in the future he will be able to start supplying lumber to nearby districts. 

Moses is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Moses who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans micro loans.

loans.use: to puchase more trees

loans.name: Abdyrahman's Group

texts.en:
Abdyrahman is a member of this group. He is 58 and, together with his wife, they raise two daughters. Their older daughter studies at school while their second daughter is pre-school age (under seven). His wife works in the department of water resources.

In order to earn money to provide for his family, Abdyrahman breeds livestock and re-sells them after fattening. Abdyrahman earns approximately 2,000 KGS per month from this business. He started his livestock-breeding business ten years ago with an initial investment of 10,000 KGS. At the moment he is applying for this loan because he needs additional funds to purchase more sheep for breeding. In the future he plans to open a big farm. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase additional sheep

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en:
Quyen is a 53-year-old married woman. She has two children and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income by delivering newspapers. 

Quyen earns an income by selling ornamental fish. She has done this for the past two years. Quyen would like a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety and quantity of fish. She hopes this will enabL. her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of fish to sell.

loans.name: Rrisca

texts.es:
Rrisca de 60 años de edad, es una mujer casada con Gerardo, con quien tiene 7 hijos. Vive en una casa propia en Pueblo Pardo, anexo del distrito de Chanchamayo. A pesar de su edad, Rrisca no duda en coger el machete y limpiar la maleza de sus sembríos o coger la pala para labrar la tierra. La agricultura ha sido, desde niña, su sustento y ahora el de su familia.
En sus terrenos propios siembra: carambolas, palta, cacao y café. “La ventaja de sembrar tantos productos es que recibo ingresos en distintos meses del año, ya que sus temporadas son fijas”, explica.
Gerardo, no puede esforzarse mucho por la edad, por eso, Ever su hijo de 30 años le ayuda en tan arduo trabajo.
Al mismo tiempo, Rrisca cuenta con un pequeño kiosco de golosinas y gaseosas, que abrió hace poco.
Ella no tendrá las mismas energías, mas adelante, por ello piensa consolidar su negocio, para asegurar su ancianidad. Sería el crédito número 7 que gracias a su ayuda obtendría de MFP. Será puntual y constante en el pago de las cuotas. Por su parte, siente un gran respaldo de pertenecer a “Los Caramboleros”, su banco comunal. De darse el préstamo, podrá comprar gaseosas, golosinas y algunos abarrotes para surtir el, recientemente, abierto kiosco.
texts.en:
Rrisca is 60 years old. She is married to Gerardo, with whom she has seven children. They live in their own house in Pueblo Pardo, an annex of the district of Chanchamayo. In spite of her age, Rrisca doesn't hesitate to take up the machete and clean the weeds from her plantings or take up the spade to cultivate the land. Agriculture has been, since she was a child, her sustenance and now that of her family.

On her own land she plants carambolas, avocados, cocoa, and coffee. "The advantage of planting so many crops is that I receive income in different months of the year, since they have definite seasons," she explains.

Gerardo cannot exert himself much because of his age, so their son Ever, who is 30, helps him with such difficult work.

At the same time, Rrisca has a little kiosk where she sells candies and soft drinks, which she opened recently.

She will not have the same energy in the future, so she thought about setting up her business for security in her old age. This will be her seventh loan, which, thanks to their help, she will obtain through MFP.  She will be punctual and reliable in he payments. On her part, she feels a great endorsement from belonging to "Los Caramboleros," her communal bank. On receiving the loan, she will buy soft drinks, candies, and some groceries to stock her recently opened kiosk.

loans.use: to buy candies, soft drinks, and other products to stock her kiosk.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy  lives in Kampala, Uganda .She is married with six children and all her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (orphans). She sells bananas and also fish at the market. She has been in this business for eight years. She works seven days a week and generates additional income through selling charcoal. 

Teddy has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy fish and bunches of bananas. Her major business challenge is transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to expand her "matooke" (green banana) business into wholesale .She lives in a rented house and the family does not have access to piped water or electricity. Her monthly expenses include food, rent, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas and fish  for her stall.

loans.name: Magali  Marlene

texts.es:
En la parroquia San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Unión Y  Solidaridad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Magali, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos,  dos mayores de edad y uno de 15 años, todos sus hijos viven en su casa el mayor ya es profesional y los siguientes  estudian en Universidad y colegio. Su esposo es albañil.

Ella es una muy buena madre que para ayudar a sus hijos con los gastos de sus estudios se dedica al comercio, vende productos naturales de una marca Norteamericana y también vende bisutería de visón, ella vende sus productos en su casa aunque una que otra vez también entrega a domicilio,  le realizan muchos pedidos sus clientes ya que sus productos son muy buenos. Trabaja todos los días,  deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar productos naturales y bisutería de visón. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio, es la presidenta del mismo y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe del grupo.
 
Su sueño es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
In the parish of San Pablo, of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, the members of the Banco Comunal Unión Y Solidaridad meet every fifteen days.

It is here that we met Magali. She is 50 years old, married, and has three children from that relationship. Two of them are grown and one is fifteen years old. All her children live at home with her. The oldest is a professional and the others study at university and high school. Her husband is a bricklayer.

She is a very good mother in that in order to help her children with the cost of their studies she is in business selling natural products from a North American brand. She also sells inexpensive jewelry and eyewear. She sells her products from her home although once in a while she does home delivery. She fulfills a lot of orders from her customers and her products are very good. She works every day, selling on credit and collecting every fifteen days. She has been doing this for three years and it's going very well.

She's going to use this loan to buy natural products and inexpensive eyewear. She's been with the Banco Comunal since the beginning, she is the president, and she likes it because of the benefits that the group receives.

Her dream is to see her children finish their studies and be good professionals.

loans.use: to buy natural products and inexpensive jewelry.

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es: El señor Luis Carlos con 62 años, se ha dedicado gran parte de su vida a la agricultura, actividad que aprendió de sus padres y abuelos. Enfocado en la producción de tomate de aliño, ha sacado adelante a su esposa y 3 hijos y ha podido construir su vivienda con gran esfuerzo. Con el objetivo de comprar insumos necesarios para su cosecha como fungicidas y fertilizantes, el señor Luis Carlos busca incrementar su producción con una mayor calidad y poder brindarles un valor agregado a sus clientes que se verá reflejado en el precio de su producto.
texts.en: Señor Luis Carlos, aged 62, has worked for most of his life in agriculture, which he learnt from his parents and grandparents. He is focused on the production of tomato dressing. This activity enabled him to bring progress to his wife and their three children and with great effort he could build their home. By buying agricultural supplies for his crops, such as fungicides and fertilizers, Luis Carlos aims to increase his production through higher quality in order to provide added value to his customers, which will reflect in the price of his product.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, such as fungicides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de carpinteria junto con su esposo,ellos realizan trabajoc como mesas,sillas,puertas y ventanas,ella vende en las distintas ferias que se realizan en el distrito de Cachimayo,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el local de su carpinteria.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar herramientas y madera para hacer los trabajos de carpinteria.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Luz Marina continues making a living in carpentry along with her husband. They are doing jobs making tables, chairs, doors and windows, and she sells the items at the distinctive trade fairs in the district of Cachimayo. She wants to make headway with the business, and her dream is to expand her carpentry shop. She is requesting the loan to purchase tools and wood to do her work. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase tools and wood for her carpentry work.

loans.name: Mèvi

texts.en:
Madam Mèvi E. was born toward 1954 at Tsévié-Xétsiavi. She is married and is a mother of five (05) children. Her husband, a building master does not have a fix job and can’t assume his responsibilities of chief of family despite his good will. Before such a situation of misery, Madam Mèvi E. , tried also from her small trade to contribute to the family needs. Honest and well loved in her area, she enjoys from a good reputation which attract her customary. With the credit of $150 got and regularly repaid, she has succeeded to develop her activities which she controls has the secret. Madam Mèvi E. requests today, a credit of $550 to start again the trade of maize and yams which she was doing before. Dynamic and with good faith, she could well manage and make profit this project which will contribute, surely, to increase her incomes and consequently to assure a best living condition to all her family.

Madame E. Mèvi est née vers 1954 à Tsévié Xétsiavi. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Son mari, un maître maçon n’a pas un emploi fixe et n’arrive pas à assumer ses responsabilités de père de famille malgré sa bonne volonté. Face à cette situation de misère, Madame E. Mèvi, se débrouille également à partir de son petit commerce pour contribuer aux besoins de la famille. Honnête et bien aimée dans son quartier, elle jouit d’une bonne réputation qui lui attire la clientèle. Avec les $150 de crédit obtenu et régulièrement remboursé, elle a su développer ses activités dont elle a la maîtrise et le secret. Madame E. Mèvi sollicite aujourd’hui, un crédit de $550 pour reprendre le commerce de maïs et d’igname qu’elle faisait au paravent. Dynamique et de bonne foi, elle pourra bien gérer et rentabiliser ce projet qui contribuera, à coup sûr, à augmenter ses revenus et de facto, à assurer une meilleure condition de vie à toute sa famille.

loans.use: to start again the trade of maize and yams

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lucy intends to buy 1 tonne of clay, ochre and employee 7 more workers

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Yem S. is a 37 year-old mother of five children who lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She sells vegetables at the market and typically makes around $4/day. Her husband  works very hard in a field cultivating a variety of crops such as tomato, water convolvulus (green water), radishes, herbs and so on depending on the market demand. S. is requesting a loan for $300 to purchase a cow to help her husband cultivate his crops. In the future, she hopes to own another piece of land for growing many kinds of crops which will produce more income.

loans.use: To purchase a cow  to work in her field

loans.name: Gloria Emerita

texts.es:
I've had a small home business for about 2 years which has helped me buy my medicines that I have to buy due to my old age. I'm very poor and I need to work to survive. Most of my good clients are my neighbors and there are some others that I go and visit to their offices. Currently, I need to buy more merchandise since I don't have enough to sell for this month.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Yo tengo este pequeño negocio en mi casa hace unos dos años, cuan el cual me ayuda para poder comprar medicinas ya que por mi edad me las han recetado. Yo soy una mujer que vive muy pobre y nesecito trabajar. Tengo muy buenas clientas que son mis vecinas y otras que visito en oficinas. Ahora necesito comprar mas producto ya que no tengo suficiente que vender en este mes.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products such as facial creams, body lotion for children and adults, shampoos, etc.

loans.name: Talaia

texts.en: Thirty-five year old Talaia has one child, and already has an existing business of selling bananas and fresh produce in front of her house in Vailele. Her sales make a profit of $72 which is used for different purposes, such as church donations, bills, food, but most of all she saves to expand her business into a big commercial supplier of banana and vegetables. Her husband helps her a lot, as he earns $60 a week from his work as a carpenter.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other supplies

loans.name: Erika Fabiola

texts.es:
In July 1997, Erika Fabiola needed money to finish her studies to be able to offer her unborn child a promising future. She also had to help her unemployed brothers, this is why they joined forces to open an automotive electrical repair shop. With very few tools, and no client base they managed to raise the business through enthusiasm and a lot of faith in themselves.

Her child is currently 10 years old and is achieving excellent report cards at primary school which is a great source of joy for her family.

In her business, Erika would like to offer her clients a guarantee that the repairs are well performed. To this end, she wishes to purchase a tester for starter motors and alternators. Erika feels that this tool would give her clients a better service and would increase their confidence in her repair shop.

Erika is requesting a $1050 loan to be payed back in 6 months to purchase the tester. With your loan, Erika will make her business grow so her son can continue studying and she will be able to keep helping her brothers.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.< En Julio de 1997, Erika Fabiola, necesitaba dinero para poder terminar sus estudios, ofrecerle un futuro alentador a su hijo de quien estaba esperando su llegada y ayudar a sus hermanos que no tenían trabajo. Así fue como con unos pocos ahorros que tenía, rentó un tejaban que adecuaron para dar servicio de reparaciones autoelectricas, ya que sus hermanos, quienes también tenían familia, estaban desempleados. Con poca herramienta, sin clientes, pero con fe y entusiasmo lograron despegar su negocio. Su hijo actualmente tiene 10 años y está estudiando la primaria con muy buenas calificaciones, lo que enorgullece a Erika, sin embargo, el negocio necesita de una garantía que ofrecerle a sus clientes para que éstos se vayan más tranquilos.

Por lo tanto Erika está solicitando un crédito de US $ 1,050 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y así poder comprar una maquina que le va a ayudar a hacer pruebas de arranques y alternadores, para que ellos puedan otorgarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes, y éstos salgan con más confianza. Con tu ayuda Erika podrá crecer su negocio y con esto ayuda a sus hermanos y a que su hijo pueda seguir estudiando.

loans.use: To purchase an electrical tester

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Mr. Ángel R. is 51 years old and married. He has two children, one grown and the other still in school.

For the past twelve years Ángel has worked as a welder and sharpening items such as meat and wood saws, a trade he learned from his father.

Recently, he received an offer to purchase materials at a very good price, including saws of various sizes. He is seeking a loan to purchase these items.

Next year, he would like to purchase machines to automate his work given that he currently performs all tasks manually with the help of two assistants.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Ángel R. tiene 51 años, es casado y tiene dos hijos un mayor y una en edad escolar.

Ángel trabaja hace doce años como soldador y afilador, afila sierras de carnicería y carpintería, y el oficio lo aprendió de su padre.

Recientemente ha recibido una oferta de materiales a buen precio que consiste en sierras de distintas medidas, para poder adquirir estos materiales el desea un crédito.

El próximo año tiene pensado comprar máquinas para mecanizar su trabajo, ya que actualmente realiza el trabajo manualmente con ayuda de dos personales.

loans.use: Purchase saws for cutting meat and wood.

loans.name: Anor

texts.ru:
Anor has been in business of reselling dried fruits for the past 10 years. She rents a spot on the food market "Sahovat". She is married and has 5 children. Her husband is earning money in Russia. He sends her $500 every month. However, because the children have grown up this money is insufficient to pay for education and food. Anor is happy to have 5 children and work hard to provide for them. She has a stable business. She purchases goods from peasants from distant villages which is delivered to her ready to sell. Anor's business has a good turnover. She is a good client of our organization.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Анор занимается куплей продажей сухофруктов уже 10 лет.Она арендует место на пищевом рынке "Саховат".Замужем,имеет 5 детей.Муж работает в России наемным рабочим. Ежемесечно присылает деньги в размере $500.Но так как дети выросли этих денег недостаточно на образование и питание.Анор счастлива что имеет 5 детей и работает для них.У неё стабильный налаженный бизнес, то есть она закупает свой ассортимент у крестян с отдаленных кишлаков и он привозят готовую продукцию( расфассованную и высущенную.)Анор имеет нормальный оборот товара и в данный момент успешно кредитуется в нашей организации.

loans.use: Purchase 20kg of peanuts, 30kg of almonds, 20kg of raisins, 30kg of pistachios, 15kg of salted apricot pits and 40kg of dried apricots with pits.

loans.name: Lisnawati

texts.en: Lisnawati is 36 years old, married, and works as a driver for public transportation. She must support her family of two children, and sells cookies and other baked goods in a door-to-door vending service. She would like a loan of $100 to help fund for her children’s education and future, and plans to repay the loan in a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Jose Hedi

texts.es:
I put up plywood, posts, and wire around my yard to prevent criminals from breaking in. I need to build a protective concrete fence as soon as possible because there are a lot of thieves in this area who have burglarized my neighbors’ homes in the past, and I do not want put my family in danger. I am requesting a loan of $1,200.00 USD in order to build a protective concrete fence around my home.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

“En el patio de mi vivienda he puesto maderas, palos y alambres para evitar que se metan a robar, tengo la necesidad de construir una barda lo antes posible ya que en esa colonia hay muchos bandidos, ya se han metido a robar en otras casas y no me gusta que mi familia este en riesgo” Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para construir una barda en mi vivienda

loans.use: Construction of concrete fence

loans.name: Lidia's Maisha Group

texts.en:
Lidia is 28 years old and is a single woman and she takes care of one other person. Lidia owns a small shop and is a tailor, which she started in 2007. Everyday she works from 8.30am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Emmy, who is a shop owner.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Tujikaze Women's Group

texts.en:
Jeremiah W. is a young Kenyan father aged 36 with 4 children. He also lives with 2 orphan children of his late brother who perished 2 years ago.

Jeremiah started his business 4 years ago after accumulating savings from his former work place. He currently operates a small retail shop in the neighborhood where he resides with his family, located in Bungoma district. He would like to expand his business and start operating a wholesale shop in future.

As he is the primary bread winner for his family, it would enable him to support both his children and his wife, who has a low-paying job. With the little profit that he gets from the business, Jeremiah still struggles to feed, clothe, and educate his children. With the help of his loan, Jeremiah will be able to increase his stock and boost his monthly sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To increase his shop's stock

loans.name: Sarum

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarum L., 28, and her husband, Mr. Klang Soeun, 35, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1995 and have three sons, all of whom are in local schools.

Mrs. Sarum has been a silk weaver since she was twelve years old, having learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh.  Mr. Klang has been a silk weaver for eleven years, a skill he learned from his wife. He is a bicycle repairer as well.

Now Sarum is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase silk materials for her and her husband's weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Fili

texts.en: Fili U., 58, is married with 8 children. She has 2 years of experience in the pancake business. She sells to the villagers/public 3 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 280 Tala (~116 USD). SPBD loans are Fili’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. This will assist in buying equipment used in her pancake business.

loans.use: Purchase flour, vegetable oil, baking bowder and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a variety of merchandise to stock the business.

loans.name: Jamila's Twaomba Salama Group

texts.en:
Jamila is 28 years old and married with 2 children, aged 12 and 10. She has been a food seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 7AM to 6PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Jamila is now looking for a loan to buy more food items to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Saumu, Khadija and Fatma.

loans.use: To buy more food items for to expand her business.

loans.name: Meaiti

texts.en:
Meaiti I., 26, is married with one child. She has two years of experience in the ice cake and pancake business. She sells to the villagers and the public seven days per week.

Meaiti has one previous loan with SPBD. She will use this loan to improve her business by purchasing plastic cups, sugar, sack of flour, cooking oil, large frying pan and packets of koolaid. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~125 USD). SPBD loans are Meaiti's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her husband and her older daughter is helping her with the business.

loans.use: To purchase plastic cups, sack of sugar, cool aid, sack of flour, cooking oil and a large frying pan.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Урунова  Саодат жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст 38 лет,разведенна, имеет 3 детей.Образование среднее. Саодат занимается куплей продажей обуви и женской одежды.Она имеет  небольшую торговую точку на центральном рынке города.Бизнес является единственным источником дохода ее семьи.На кредит клиентка хочет увеличить товарооборот.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Saodat U. lives in the city of Tursunzoda. She is 38 years old, divorced and has three children. Saodat has a high school degree and makes a living selling shoes and women clothes. She manages a small market stall at the city's central market. This business is the sole source of income for her large family and Saodat is hoping to use this loan to expand her inventory and consequently improve sales. She is planning to pay back the loan in the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding inventory

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.en:
P. Hafiza is 37 years old and is married with four children. Hafiza is a teacher in a local school. Considering that the teachers earn low wages, for the past seven years, Hafiza has had a small business of processing apricots. The dried fruits - especially dried apricots - are very popular in Tajikistan. In addition, it is very beneficial for the health. 

Considering the constant demand for this kind of good, the Hafiza's business is quite successful and brings about a stable income for the family, thereby allowing Hafiza to contribute significantly to the household and education of her dearest children. 

Today, she is requesting 2500 Somoni (750 USD) for the term of 11 months. She is going to spend the loan for purchasing the dried apricots with the purpose of processing and further selling them in order increase the range of goods. Hafiza expresses her gratitude for everyone supporting her. Please support this woman of immense strength and courage.

loans.use: To buy dried apricots in order to increase her food sales business inventory

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Mrs. Phorn S., 34, is a grocery seller and sells a variety of products such as sugarcane juice, cakes, household use products, and cooked rice with pork.
