She has been selling these things since 2006 and can earn around US$ 5 per day. She lives with her husband and three children, all of whom are in school. With a view to growing her business, she needs a loan to expand the business by purchasing more inventory such as groceries, sugarcane to make juice, and ingredients for cooked rice.

loans.use: purchasing more inventory such as groceries, sugarcane to make juice, etc.

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
Doña Marilu O. esta agradecido por su gran apoyo que le brindaron en su anterior crédito el cual su negocio ha crecido mucho.
Ella solicita su cooperación para este nuevo préstamo ya que desea invertir le al negocio mercancía como (Verduras, frutas, carnes y lácteos), ya que sus clientes se lo están pidiendo que venda estos productos, porque es el único negocio de la colonia.
 Así tendrá más ingresos a su negocio y posterior mente para la familia.
texts.en:
Marilu O. is grateful for your considerable help with her previous loan thanks to which her business grew greatly. She is asking for your help with this new loan which she wishes to invest in goods for her store, such as vegetables, fruit, meat and cheese. Her clients are asking for these products and she is the only store in the area. This will create more income for her business and later for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods for her store

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen K. is married and has 7 dependents. He has received schooling through junior high. Stephen makes and sells palm oil at Dosi near Cape Coast, which he has done for about 8 years.  Stephen uses his income to pay for the children's school fees, rent, utility bills and other expenses. Stephen will use the loan as additional capital to enable him to increase the purchase of palm fruit for the production of palm oil to meet the increase in demand by his customers. With the new profits from his expanded business, Stephen plans to invest in his farm.

loans.use: additional capital to  increase  production of  palm oil

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José tiene 40 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos que son su razón de salir adelante cada día mediante su esforzado trabajo. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a brindar servicios de seguridad (vigilante) a diferentes instituciones, con lo que lleva ingresos económicos a su casa, aunque algo peligroso, es un trabajo estable. Adicionalmente, él y su esposa tienen un negocio de venta de comida, al cual, ella se dedica mucho más tiempo porque es quien cocina y lo administra, mientras José la apoya en lo que sea necesario durante sus momentos libres, así como sus hijos, quienes disfrutan de trabajar todos juntos porque saben que aportan para mejorar la economía de su hogar. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, José comenta que le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal, porque aparte de haber hecho buenos amigos y amigas, puede aprender e intercambiar ideas para la mejorar su economía, así como la guía de su asesor de crédito. Con el dinero que está solicitando quiere mandar a construir un Kiosco para el negocio de la comida, implementarlo con utensilios de cocina y todo lo necesario para su esposa, así invertirá 1000 soles. Con lo restante reparará el motocarro que tiene para usarlo en transporte y tener otro medio con el cual se genere ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
José is 40 years old and lives with his wife and his two children, who are his reason for going forward every day through hard work. For the last 5 years he has offered his services as a security guard (watchman) to different institutions, which brings in additional income to his house, and although its somewhat dangerous, it is a stable job. Additionally, he and his wife have a business selling food, to which she dedicates much more time because she cooks and administers the business while Jose helps her when necessary during his spare time, as do his children, who enjoy working all together because the know that they are contributing to improving the economic well-being of their home. This is his 3rd loan from MFP: Jose remarks that he likes working with his community bank because apart from having made good friends, you can learn and exchange ideas to improve your business, such as through the guidance of his credit assessor. With the money that he is asking for he wants to construct a Kiosk for the food business, installing kitchen utensils and everything else his wife needs: in this way he will invest 1000 soles. With the rest of the money, he will repair the motorcycle which he owns in order to use it for transport and have another means of generating an income.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Consturction of a kiosk and purchase of kitchen utensils

loans.name: Mildre Olivia

texts.es:
LA Sra. Mildre es nacida en la ciudad de Potosí, y actualmente vive en la localidad del torno en la zona de  Santa Rita, en la casa de sus padres los cuales ya fallecieron,  es madre soltera vive con sus hermana. 
La actividad a la que se dedica por mas de un año es la elaboración de pan casero, con este negocio mantiene a su familia.
Además de esto también cuenta con el ingreso de la renta de sus vagoneta para al que ahora esta solicitando el crédito.
Es una persona muy trabajadora mantiene a su hijo sola y hace estudiar a su hermana que ahora se encuentra bajo su responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Mildres was born in Potosí city and today lives in the Santa Rita neighborhood of Torno. She lives in her parent’s home (they are deceased), she is a single mother and lives with her sister. For more than a year she has been making bread and with this business supports her family. In addition she also has income from renting her car for which she is seeking a loan. She works very hard to support her only son and so that her sister, for whom she is now responsible, can study.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a fuel system for her transportation vehicle

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa P. is 53 years old. She is married and the mother of five children. Currently all her children are working. She lives at Twifo Praso in the central region of Ghana with her husband who is a farmer. Yaa says she has a God-given talent to heal the sick, especially those suffering from goiter disease. She once had a goiter by her neck and it was revealed to her to use shear butter with other leaves for treatment. Lo and behold, she did it and the goiter vanished. Yaa decided to carry out research and find out how she can help people with the same problem. Currently Yaa is a specialist in herbal medicine with specialization in goiter. She prepares her medicine with the use of shear butter and special leaves in the bush, which are known, to her alone. Through that she has healed lots of people with the same challenge. Yaa has nine years experience in herbal medicine. She use to sell her products in paper but now she has designed a smaller container in which she packages the herbal medicine. The inscription on the container is Nyame Bekyere which means ‘God will provide’
Based on her performance and the quality of her medicine, lots of people have come to her for treatment. Fortunately those that came and had their healing are doing well. She needs the loan to buy shear butter for production. With your help she believes others will have the treatment and will be happy too. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Amen’.

loans.use: To buy shear butter for processing of herbal medicine

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa lives in Nilabo, Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte. She is on her second cycle now on her loan request. Her husband is a coconut toddy gatherer and sometimes works odd jobs just to earn an income. Marissa has her own grocery store. She is requesting the loan amount of 4,500 Philippine Pesos for the purchase of additional stocks such as goodies, noodles, sacks of rice, and many other things.

She is hoping that someday they can augment their income and send all their children to college.

loans.use: Sari-sari (grocery) store inventory

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence A. is thirty–nine years old. She is married and has given birth to three children who are currently studying in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her family in their own house at Ejura, a farming community in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Florence works hard to help her husband provide for the family. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates food crops and all kinds of vegetables.

Florence sells fresh eggs and clothing materials. She buys her stocks of eggs from the poultry farmers in the surrounding villages. She has been in business for four years. She also distributes the eggs to coffee sellers, food vendors and canteen operators. She wants a loan to buy fresh eggs on large scale so that she can cut down on cost, as in frequent trips to procure the goods, and also to maximize profit.

Florence is a member of the community group called “Yesu do” (translated Jesus’ love) trust group. Members of this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase fresh eggs in bulk

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en: "I started having a store using my small savings of php 4,000. With the help of CEVI, I was able to sustain my business until now. My income from my store is what I use to help my husband raise our three children," says Luciana S., an entrepreneur from Bien Unido, Bohol. Luciana would like to ask for a loan of Php 25,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her store. She thinks that the loan will really help her attract more customers and could increase her income as well. CEVI helps small business to grow. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina C. has been managing and operating her general store business in her village for ten years. She is married to Eduardo, who is a laborer. They reside in Allinguigan Ilagan, Isabela, and they have six children. Due to a lack of financial resources, her children were not able to graduate from high school. Rufina patiently works hard to provide for their children, and she hopes that her children will remain healthy and keep their faith in God through the years.

Rufina is now seeking an infusion of capital in order to expand and improve her business. Specifically, she would like to borrow a loan in the amount of 13,000 PHP ($275) to purchase more products such as coffee, sugar, detergent, and bath soap. Rufina notes that she has been saving some money to repair their house.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional products (e.g., coffee, sugar, detergent, and soap)

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La señora Valentina M. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, área suburbana de la ciudad de La Paz, con sus dos hijas.
La señora Valentina trabaja como cocinera en un centro de ayuda a su comunidad, ingresos con los que mantiene a su familia.
Con sus ahorros pudo adquirir un lote de terreno, el mismo que ya tiene habitaciones en la planta baja, pero su familia crece y las habitaciones de las que disponen les resultan pequeñas.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de dos habitaciones en planta alta.
Esta es la sexta vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Valentina M. lives in a house she owns in the Pasankeri district, a suburban section of the city of La Paz, with her two daughters. Valentina works as a cook in a soup kitchen in her community, generating income that supports her family. With her savings, she was able to acquire a plot of land and build some first-floor rooms. However, her family is growing and the rooms they have are small. The loan she is soliciting is two build two second-floor rooms. This is the sixth time she requests a loan, and the socioeconomic analysis realized qualifies her favorably for access to credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build some second-floor rooms to her house.

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen sells foodstuffs like rice and other items. She lives in Benin City. She is 31 years old and married with 5 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N50000 to purchase more foodstuffs and other items to sell. She thanks all her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs  to sell

loans.name: Paciencia Alberto

texts.pt:
Paciência Alberto C. nasceu em Homoine na provincial de inhambane, tem 38 anos de idade e é mãe de 4 filhos de idades compreendidas entre 3 e 13 anos que estudam na escola de boane, na exceção do mais novo. Estudou ate 6 classe tendo parado devido à gravidez precoce.

Saiu de Homoine com seus pais a boane em 1986 e vive com seu marido na casa própria. Sustenta um sobrinho que esta sob sua responsabilidade.
Aprendeu a fazer negocio quando vivia em casa dos pais e neste momento, no lar, vende produtos alimentícios (batata, cebola e outros) que adquire na áfrica do sul. Compra cada saco de 10 kg a 100,00MT e vende a 140,00MT obtendo um rendimento médio mensal de 5.000,00MT que aplica no sustento da família e pagamento de crédito.

É pela segunda vez que levanta o credito da Hluvuku-Adsema e no valor de 10.000,00MT que pretende comprar produtos para vender (batata,arroz, cebola e outros).
O primeiro empréstimo foi de 7.00,00MT que aplicou na mesma actividade e tendo reembolsado sem dificuldades.

Compromete se a reembolsar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a outros empréstimos com o objectivo de construir uma casa e ampliar suas instalações de comerciais.
texts.en:
Paciência Alberto C. was born in Homoine, in the province of Inhambane. She is 38 years old. She’s the mother of 4 children from 3 to 13, who go to school in Boane, -except for the youngest. She finished up to 6th grade, as he got pregnant when she was still a teenager. She left Homoine with her parents to live in Boane in 1986, where she now lives with her husband in their own house. She is supporting a nephew who is under her care. She learnt the business when she lived with her parents, and now, at home, she sells food products (potatoes, onions and others) that she buys in South Africa. She buys each 10 kg sac at 100.00MT and sells them at 140.00MT getting an average monthly salary of 5,000.00MT which she uses to support her family and repay her loans. This is the second time she requests for a loan from Hluvuku-Adsema for 10,000.00MT which she would like to use to purchase more products to resell (potatoes, rice, onions and others). Her first loan was for 700.00MT which she used for the same activity and that she paid without any problems. She promises to repay the loan without any issues in order to access to more loans in the future to be able to build her house and expand her business facilities.

Translated from Portuguese by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of grocery products (potatoes, rice, onions and others)

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is thirty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to five children: two daughters and three sons, who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Elizabeth is a trader, running a palm oil production business. She procures the palm fruits from nearby communities and supplies to retailers in her community. She has been in business for barely a year now and wants a loan to buy palm fruits in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Oghogho

texts.en: Oghogho is 32 years old and married with 2 children.  She is a friendly and hard-working woman. She sells sarongs of various colors and sizes. This business is her source of income. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Ahmad Shekab Group

texts.en:
Ahmad Shekab is the group leader of the Ahmad Shekab group, which consists of five people. They are seeking a loan, so that each can reinvest into his/her own respective business, with the hope that their efforts will allow them to better provide for their families.

M. Jawad and Shakylah plan to use the loan to purchase a couple sewing machines. Ahmad Shekab and Abdull Ghafor plan to use their loan to purchase merchandise for their general store. Bibi Kabra plans to use her loan to obtain materials for her carpet weaving business.

With this loan they can expand their business and have the potential to create a better future for themselves, as well as their families.

loans.use: To reinvest into and expand their respective business.

loans.name: 02.1.6 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Chính N. Thị (33) is a 49 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Chính is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02.1.6 Nam Ngạn (02.02.1.6).

Chính is widowed and has 2 adult-aged children. To making a living, Chính owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling rice products in the local community. Chính has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,800,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Chính joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chính has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,963,500 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to further invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Chính plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. B. Thị Hài (28) is a 63 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

2. N. Thị Hiền (29) is a 31 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.

3. Đỗ Thị T. Hương (30) is a 30 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

4. Vũ Thị Vân (31) is a 25 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

5. P. Thị Nga (32) is a 26 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

6. H. Thị Lâm (34) is a 55 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Chính N. Thị (33) là 49 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá. Chính là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.1.6 Nam Ngạn (02.02.1.6).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương. Chính thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Chính kiếm được khoảng 1.800.000 VND. Vào 2008, Chính đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Chính đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1.963.500 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. B. Thị Hài (28) là 63 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.

2. N. Thị Hiền (29) là 31 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

3. Đỗ Thị T. Hương (30) là 30 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.

4. Vũ Thị Vân (31) là 25 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

5. P. Thị Nga (32) là 26 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

6. H. Thị Lâm (34) là 55 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en:
The selling of fruit is the main source of income of Jovy B.. She is married to Joseph, her partner in her buy and sell business. They have five children: Ma. Loreta - 17 years old, a high school graduate; Mark Joe - 13 years old, in 3rd year high school; Mary Joy - 10 years old, in grade-V; Maria Josefa - 7 years old, in grade I; and Mark Joseph - 5 years old, already in preschool.

Jovy and her husband are engaged in the buying and selling of bananas. She wishes to make her business grow and with this in mind she is borrowing PHP 5,000. She hopes that the lenders will grant her request so she can purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is excited to take his first loan with Kiva. He will use this loan to invest in his business of selling cosmetics and baby wear which he will buy in bulk to get a better price. He hopes that this loan will help him build a business that will be profitable and provide benefits for his family. Joseph has been in this business for eight years. He is currently taking a part-time course in one of the higher institutions. In order to make more profit and to complete his education, he is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more cosmetics and baby wear to meet with customers' demands in this festive season. He also needs to increase his capital and his profits. Joseph is 28 years old.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics and baby wear to sell

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia Sonia es una humilde madre de familia que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”.    

La socia tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos varones. El hijo mayor estudia en el colegio y el menor estudia en el PRONEI (Programa Nacional de Educación Inicial). Nuestra socia esta acompañada de su esposo José. Ellos viven en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la comunidad de Angostura que se encuentra ubicada al sur de la ciudad del Cusco. La socia se dedica a la venta de frutas en el paradero final de los buses de la comunidad de Angostura. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que va sacar adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más frutas como naranjas, plátanos, mandarinas, uvas, etc. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Sonia is a humble mother who belongs to the Virgen Purificada – Angostura Communal Bank. She is 30, in a common law marriage, and has two sons. Her oldest son goes to school, and the youngest goes to PRONEI (National Program for Initial Education). She is accompanied by her husband, José. They live in the San Jerónimo district in the Angostura community, which is south of the city of Cusco. She sells fruit at the last bus stop in the Angostura community. She has been working in this business for several years. It has gone very well for her thanks to all of the effort she puts into her work. She is an enterprising and hard-working mother who wants to get her family ahead. She needs the loan to buy more fruit like oranges, bananas, tangerines, and grapes, etc. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: By more fruit like oranges, bananas, tangerines, and grapes, etc.

loans.name: Graciela Guadalupe

texts.es:
Graciela S. es una señora de 37 años, casada con 5 hijos de 22, 16, 12, 8 y 1 mes de edad. Sus hijos estudian en escuelas y colegios fiscales. Su actividad principal es la venta de cosméticos, tales como perfumes, cremas para manos y colonias, esta actividad la escogió porque le gustan ventas. 
Su horario de trabajo es por las tardes ( 15h30 – 18h00 ) y su mamá la ayuda a vender los productos, el negocio le da una rentabilidad del 50% por ejemplo si invierte US$ 300.0 obtiene como ganancia US$ 150.00. Con el préstamo planea comprar productos de belleza y juguetes para la época navideña.  Sus metas a futuro son terminar de construir su casa y tener más productos de belleza para vender
texts.en:
Graciela S., 37, is married and has 5 children; their ages range from 1 month to 22 years. Her children study in public elementary and secondary schools. Her main source of income is the sale of cosmetics like perfume, hand creams, colognes. She chose this line of work because she likes sales. She works afternoons from 3:30-6:00 and her mother helps her with the sales. She has a profit margin of 50%. For example: she invests US$ 300 and earns US$ 150 profit. With the financing she plans to buy beauty products and toys for the Christmas season. Her future goal is to finish her house and to have a wider selection of beauty products to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy toys and cosmetics.

loans.name: Bella Besnarda

texts.es: La. Sra. Bella vive en la urbanizacion el Guapuru zona del plan 3000, en el lugar vive como cacera hace 8 años, la actividad que realiza es  trabajos D. costura, hace camisas, pantalones, sabanas, cortinas y edredones. Ella trabaja con esta actividad hace aproximadamente 10 años,  actualmente vive sola hace unos años atras que su esposo fallecio, tiene 3 hijos los cuales ya son mayores D. edad y tienen sus propios hogares. El capital solicitado es para la compra D. material para raelizar sus trabajos. ella cuenta con tres maquinas D. costura dos singer y una over. es una persona D. caracter humilD. y tiene muchas ganas D. seguir trabajando, y D. esa manbera mejorar su calidad D. vida
texts.en:
Señora Bella lives in the Guapuru housing project of the 3000 plan. She has lived in this place as a housing agent for 8 years. The activity that she carries out is the work of dressmaking. She makes shirts, pants, sheets, curtains and comforters. She has worked at this activity for approximately 10 years. At present she lives alone. Some years ago her husband passed away. She has 3 children who are already of legal age and they have their own homes. The requested capital is for the purchase of material to create her works. She relies on three sewing machines; two singer and one over. She is a person of humble character and she has much desire to continue working, and in this way to improve her quality of life

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material for making clothing, curtains, comforters, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine B. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Josephine is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a business running a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Josephine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en: Hamida is a married woman of 22 years old. She got married early and she has 2 young children. Because their living situation is hard with a lot of expenses such as family expenses, schooling expenses, hospitality, etc., Hamida decided to help her husband with the household finances, so she started selling clothes from her home in 2008. And she has been able to have a good number of clients passing by her home to buy clothes. Today, Hamida is requesting to borrow US$ 800 to buy a big quantity of clothes at lower prices to make a good profit.

loans.use: buy a big quantity of clothes at lower prices

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana Julia O. de 48 años de edad, reside en la Ciudad de Soyapango, ubicada en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a sus cuatro hijos de los cuales el mayor se dedica a trabajar para ayudarle a su madre con los gastos del hogar, los tres menores estudian y por las tardes le ayudan a Ana con los quehaceres de la casa. Ana posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad, negocio a través del cual ha logrado salir adelante junto a sus cuatro hijos. Es por esta razón que Ana solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio, ya que a pesar de que cuenta con varios años de poseerlo no ha logrado surtirlo con todo lo necesario para atender todos los pedidos de sus clientes, lo cual la deja en desventaja a comparación de su competencia. Para Ana el mejorar su negocio es vital, debido a que es por medio de este como ella logra obtener el dinero necesario para sostén de su familia, la cual depende por completo de ella y de las pocas ganancias que con mucho esfuerzo aporta su hijo mayor.
texts.en:
Ana Julia O. is 48 years old and lives in the city of Soyapango, in the area of San Salvador. She lives with her four children, the oldest of whom works to help his mother with the expenses of the home. The younger three children study and, in the afternoon, help Ana with the housework. Ana has a store selling basic products, and this business has allowed her to get ahead, along with her four children. Ana is asking for a loan to be able to stock her store. Despite having run the store for many years, she still has not stocked it with everything her customers request, which causes her business to suffer when compared to the competition. It is very important to Ana to improve her business, as this is her means of obtaining the money to support her family. They are entirely dependent upon her and upon the small amount that her oldest son contributes by working very hard.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina tiene 54 años, es una mujer que siempre ha trabajado muy duro por sobre salir en la vida. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Sotelo D. 55 años y lo que más desean es tener una vejez tranquila.

Su tienda D. abarrotes es una D. las más visitadas en la ciudad D. Tarma, desD. muy temprano por la mañana abre su bodega en espera D. sus clientes. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y atenta, ya que siempre recibe a todas las personas con una sonrisa y está dispuesta ayudarlos en sus compras.
Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 27 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro D. su tienda sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, hará ampliar su tienda y la llenará D. más mercadería para ofrecer una mejor variedad D. productos.

Este es el primer préstamo D. Justina con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que según manifiesta, la responsabilidad es muy importante para ella. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda D. abarrotes.
texts.en:
Justina is a 54-year-old woman who has always worked very arduously to get ahead in life. She and her husband, Sotelo (age 55), live in their own home, and what they want most is to have a tranquil old age.

Her general store is one of the most frequented in the city of Tarma. She opens her store very early in the morning, eagerly awaiting her customers. She is a very cheerful and attentive seller who always receives everyone with a smile and is willing to help them shop.

What she likes most about her job is being able to converse with her customers. She has been in business for 27 years, and she thinks that the most difficult thing for her is having to stay in her store all day long without being able to leave. In the future, she would like to expand her store and fill it with more goods so that she can offer her customers a wider selection of products.

This is Justina's first loan with MFP. However, she is willing to make her payments punctually, stating that responsibility is very important to her. With the 1,000.00 PEN that she is requesting, she will purchase more products so that she can better stock her general store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Saleem Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Nazia wants a loan to buy animals (goats) for her animal-selling business. Sakina wants a loan to buy seasonal fruit for her fruit-selling business. Saleem akhtar is the group leader for the afore-mentioned ladies. They all live in a city called Borewala, a city famous for its shrines in Pakistan. 

Saleem is a kind-hearted, good-natured woman. She runs a sewing business. She learnt this skill from her mother and it has given her rewards in a shape of money now. She does this work to supplement the income of her husband. Her husband's name is I. A. and he runs a pan shop in the community. (Pan is an Urdu term which is used for betel leaves.)  He has a good reputation among his customers. He deals with them with respect. Saleem is applying for a loan to buy items (betel nuts, betel leaves) to expand her husband’s pan shop.

loans.use: To buy material for her husband's pan shop

loans.name: Ramadan

texts.en:
Ramadan is a 26-year-old young man who lives in Qadoura refugee camp in Ramallah district. He had to start working repairing vehicles when he was 19 years old. Starting at a young age gave him excellent experience as a car electrician, enabling him to start his own workshop which has a very good number of clients by this time.

Ramadan came to FATEN to take a loan which will enable him to purchase needed equipment. He is also thinking of expanding his workshop by using the space next to it to be able to serve an increased number of clients.

Ramadan's workshop is located at the entrance to the refugee camp which is a good location to serve both the refugee camp and some Ramallah city clients.

Ramadan looks forward to building his career and starting his family using the project's returns.

loans.use: To purchase needed equipment and improve his vehicle-repair workshop

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en:
Mahmud is a farmer who is not only devoted to his work but also to being the father of a family. He works hard raising cattle, which he takes out to graze in the early mornings. Without a doubt, it is not an easy task but the love for his family gives his work reason and meaning. Currently, Mahmud wants to improve his situation by increasing the number of his cattle which in the long run will provide better financial income. If you support him, he will be forever grateful.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON International's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
La señora Celestina inicia su negocio hace mas de 6 años, en el mismo sector de su canton. Al inicio ella tenia que alquilar el lugar para poner su negocio. Poco despues logro construir una pequeña galera para tener su propio local. Ella tiene 3 hijos y cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo para poder administrar el negocio.
Su sueño es hacer que su negocio siga creciendo, para poder tenerlo bien surtido, sus mayores ventas se dan en el maiz y el frijol. Ella quiere sacar adelante a sus hijas para que en el futuro ellas tengan una profecion y pueden defenderse solas como mujeres de exito. Ya que a doña Celestina sus padres no le dieron estudio ella quieres que sus hijas lo tengan.
texts.en:
Celestina started her business over 6 years ago in her own neighborhood. At first, she had to lease a space for it. Eventually, however, she was able to build a small room to have her own locale. She has three children and she can count on her husband’s help so that she can tend to her business. Her dream is to see her business continue to grow so that she can have it well stocked. Her best selling items are corn and beans. She wants her daughters get ahead in life having a profession so that they can fend for themselves as successful women. Since Celestina’s parents couldn’t afford to provide her with an education she wants to insure that her daughters have one.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, water, sugar, eggs and beans.

loans.name: Leydi De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Doña Leydi de edad de 32 años, es una madre dedicada a su familia como  a su trabajo, en la venta de cosmético y ropa. Desde hace varios años logro con el apoyo de su esposo y financiamiento de la  institución el aumento de su negocio como la mejora de su casa.

La necesidad que tiene es el cambio del zinc ya que esta en mal estado y desea mejorar para poder dar a sus hijos mejor seguridad.
Las ventas han estado bajas, pero no se deja de vender, desea invertir en producto nuevo para poder lograr la captación de clientes. Y mejorar sus ingresos ya que todo esta con costos altos y solo con el salario de su esposo no se ajusta.
texts.en:
Leydi is 32 years old. She is a mother who is dedicated to her family and her job selling cosmetics and clothes. Several years ago, with her husband's support and financing fom the institution, she was able to grow her business and improve her house. What she needs is to change the zinc sheeting because it is in poor condition and she wants to improve it to be safer for her children. Sales have been low, but she hasn't stopped selling. She wants to invest in new products to be able to attract new customers and improve her income, since everything is expensive and her husband's salary isn't enough.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy zinc sheeting to change the roof of her house which is in poor condition.

loans.name: Tsendsuren

texts.en:
Tsendsuren D., 61, lives with her husband in a ger, a traditional Mongolian tent home, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband, Yadamsuren, owns a car and earns money by transporting people. Tsendsuren operates a grocery trading business at Narantuul, the biggest market in Ulaanbaatar. She started her grocery service in 2000, quickly making good progress and gaining valuable experience.

A very hardworking, open-minded and responsible woman focused on operating an honest business, she is now requesting a 2,900,000 MNT loan to purchase a car for her youngest son. Tsendsuren says, "I will work hard to pay the bank loan on time. The earnings from grocery sales will enable us to pay the loan on time."

loans.use: To purchase a car

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena B., 52, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Manolito B., a driver, they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She distributes and retails gasoline to her neighbors and the surrounding community.

Lucena has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow twelve times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her fuel business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a 17,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by allowing her to buy wholesale fuel to be re-packaged in one-liter bottles and sold at retail prices.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fuel to be repackaged in one-liter bottles and sold at retail

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
La  señora Maribel S. E. tiene 20 años de edad y vive en el barrio Defensores del Chaco de la ciudad de Tarija. Maribel  es casada pero su esposo por motivos de trabajo se fue a la argentina, con quien tiene dos hijos. 
Maribel se dedica desde hace mas de 2 años a la elaboración de salteñas (empanadas al horno con relleno de carne o pollo) teniendo varios clientes que consumen sus alimentos.                                                                                                                                                             Maribel nos dice  que tiene la necesidad de comprarse otro horno industrial para incrementar el número de salteñas que elabora para que mejoren sus ingresos familiares. Es por eso que se ve en la necesidad de solicitar el crédito para la compra de dicho horno.  
                                                                                                                                                                                                  Maribel nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es poder darles toda la comodidad a sus hijos para que no les falte nada y puedan ser felices y en un futuro cercano verlos estudiar y llegar a ser profesionales. También nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite quisiera utilizarlo para poder mejorar las condiciones de su casa.
texts.en:
Maribel S. E. is 20 years old and lives in the Defensores del Chaco suburb in Tarija city. Maribel is married and has two children with her husband, who for work reasons has gone to Argentina. For over 2 years Maribel has worked making salteñas (oven-baked empanadas with meat or chicken filling), having many clients who consume her food. Maribel tells us that she needs to purchase another industrial oven to increase the number of salteñas that she makes to increase her family's earnings. For this reason she is seeking a loan to purchase this oven. Maribel's biggest dream is to give her children every comfort so they don't want for anything and so that they can be happy, and in the near future see them study and become professionals. She also says that the next loan that she seeks will be used to improve her home's conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an industrial oven

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
La Sra. Ramona B. D. G. tiene 55 años, esta casada, tiene 3 hijos, D. los cuales dos cursan la educación secundaria y el mayor trabaja y estudia en la facultad.
La Sra. Ramona es modista D. alta costura, se dedica a esta profesión hace más D. 30 años, comenzó muy joven ya que esta profesión fue inculcada por la madre y estudio para poder adquirir mayor conocimiento sobre este trabajo .
Ella primero trabajó en una boutique como diseñadora y   confeccionista D. los pedidos que recibían y así adquirió sus maquinas y empezó a realizar trabajos nocturnos ya  forma independiente, y así después D. unos años se independizó totalmente.
Actualmente cuenta con una importante cantidad D. clientes en su barrio.
Y esta en proceso D. crecimiento D. su negocio y para ello esta equipando con todo lo necesario su taller D. costura para brindar la mayor calidad a sus clientes.
Por ello solicita el crédito para la compra D. una máquina y más telas D. temporada fría.
texts.en:
Ramona B. D. G. is 55 years old. She is married and has three children, two of whom attend junior high school and the oldest works and studies in school. Ramona is a high quality dressmaker and has been doing this for more than 30 years. She started when she was very young, after her mother introduced her to it. She later studied in order to better learn this business. She started off working as a designer and seamstress in a boutique, where she would fill customer orders. In this way, she acquired her sewing machines and later began working on her own in the evenings. After a few years, she ventured exclusively out on her own. Now she has important customers in her neighborhood and she is in the process of growing her business and equipping her tailor shop so that she can proviD. her customers with the best quality products. She is asking for this loan so that she can buy a sewing machine and cold weather fabric.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Alam's Group

texts.en:
Alam lives in the small city of Vehari, Pakistan. She has a 3-roomed house and lives in it with her family. She has a daughter who is 17 years old and studies in 10th standard. Her husband is working in the government sector, but his income alone is not enough to fulfill the basic needs of the family. This is why Alam also works to share the financial burden of the family. She operates a blanket-selling business. She has been doing this work for over 10 years.  

Alam’s business is now established and she has maintained a good customer base from different cities such as Lahore, Faisalabad and Islamabad. Now she receives a good number of orders. To fulfill those orders on time he has to have the blankets in large quantities, otherwise it will negatively affect her business. Therefore, she has applied for a loan from Asasah. With the loan amount she will buy blankets in larger quantities, which will minimize her cost and improve her chances of making more income. 

Alam’s only daughter, named Madiha, has a dream to get higher education. For that purpose, Alam works very hard to provide her with all the facilities of a good & quality education. Alam is in her 2nd loan cycle. She fulfilled her responsibilities as a loan user very well last year and paid all the installments on time.

loans.use: Purchase blankets for reselling.

loans.name: Khel

texts.en:
Mr. Khel A. has been working at cultivating crops since before he married. He is now married and has seven children. Two of them are no longer in school and work as farmers. Khel A. has a partner in his wife who works in the farm fields frequently alongside him. 

Growing crops is an annual job with which he has had great success. He is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by taking advantage of both rainy and dry seasons. Mr. Khel A. is taking out his loan to purchase a pump to irrigate his crops. He intends to use any remaining cash from the loan to buy more farm supplies for his field.

loans.use: To purchase a pump to irrigate his crops

loans.name: Angela Rosa

texts.es:
Doña Angela Rosa de 40 años de edad, vive en la comarca Villa Alvarez junto a su familia la cual le ha apoyado en el trabajo ganadero y agricola de su pequeña parcela la cual presenta buenas condiciones técnicas, en donde ademas realiza manejo sanitario y nutricional.  

Esta solicitando 1er crédito con el objetivo, realizar siembra de yuca lo cual le permitira incrementar los ingresos  y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. Recibe ingreso adicionales por la comercializacion de leche, granos basico y cultivos de raices y tuberculos. Su mayor sueño es poder continuar cultivando su finca y obtener ganancias para salir adelante con su familia.  Angela es una señora que se caracteriza por ser responsable y tener gran liderazgo en la comarca.
texts.en:
Angela Rosa, age 40, lives in the Villa Alvarez region with her family, who have supported her in her livestock and farm work on her small plot of land. Her land has good technical conditions, and she also manages health and nutrition. She is requesting her first loan with the goal of planting yucca, which will allow her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions. She receives additional income from selling milk, basic grains, roots and tubers. Her greatest dream is to be able to continue cultivating on her farm and obtaining income to get her family ahead. Angela is a responsible woman and has a lot of leadership in her region.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: yucca planting

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen belongs to Faisalabad which is Pakistan’s third largest city and is known for its textile industry. She lives in a 2 room, brick house with her family in the area of Madina town. She moved there 3 years ago.
 
She is 37 years old, married to I. M. and has 4 children: 3 sons and a daughter. She couldn’t educate her children due to poor financial conditions.
  
She is a beauty expert and operates her beauty salon from home. Her husband has a job in a private firm on a monthly wage. Her cousin from her mother's side also lives with her family and contributes financially by doing a private job.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her beauty salon business. With the loan, she will purchase beauty products such as cosmetics, skin-creams and a hair dryer for her business. 
She hopes that this investment will bring positive changes to her business and that her monthly income will double.
 
She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. She is confident there will be positive results from her business as a result of investment. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Perveen”.

loans.use: To buy beauty products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es: El señor Juan Ramón tiene 38 años, es casado y tiene 1 hijo. El se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado y soldadura, El dio inicio a este negocio hace mas de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. El negocio consiste es su principal medio de vida. Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de cerdos, debido a que tiene cierta demanda con sus clientes. Cabe señalar que el solicitar su préstamo le brindara más confianza para con su negocio,  de las buenas condiciones crediticias con las que trabaja nuestra institución.
texts.en: Juan Ramón is 38 years old, married, and has a son.  He works buying and selling cattle and welding equipment.  He started this business himself and has been with it for more than 10 years.  The business is his main means of income.  This is the first time that Juan Ramón is taking out a loan with our institution and it will be for the purchase of pigs because he has a demand from his customers.  It is worth mentioning that the loan will provide him with more confidence with regards to his business because of the institution’s good credit conditions.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
The woman and man shown in the picture are Mrs. Kong L. and her husband, who live in the province of Kompong Cham. This couple has spent their lives cultivating crops. This is a skill they learned from their grandparents when they were young. They have five school-age children. 

Mrs. Kong L. and her husband are able to plant the crops at least twice a year following both rainy and dry seasons. Usually this family generates around $4 of profit a day to meet the needs of their family. This is currently the harvesting season. Mrs. Kong L. needs capital to purchase many sacks of rice and peanuts to store. She will sell them when the rice and peanuts are commanding the highest price.

loans.use: To purchase many sacks of rice and peanuts to store.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle a 28 ans et est née à Vogan mais habite à Agoè.  Elle  a remboursé plusieurs crédits  déjà. Elle compte 7 ans dans cette activité et exerce son activité à Assigamé. Pour contribuer au ménage, elle fait la vente de tissus skaï. Elle s’approvisionne au Ghana à Accra et au Nigéria à Lagos pour pouvoir se procurer de ses marchandises.   Elle demande un prêt pour accroître son commerce.
texts.en: Kossiwa is married and the mother of two children. Born in Vogan, she is 28 years old and now lives in Agoè.  She has already repaid several loans. Kossiwa works in Assigamé and has been involved in this business for 7 years. To contribute to household expenses, she sells skaï fabric, traveling to Accra in Ghana and Lagos in Nigeria for her supplies. She is requesting a loan in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy skaï fabric

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 35-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents. He used to work as a traveling furniture carpenter for almost 10 years.  As of June 2010, he opened his own carpenter shop and he is very thankful for his decision and feels very comfortable owning his personA. business. He is working to modify his business operation; he works closely with locA. furniture galleries and he also gets new catalogs to offer good service to his clients. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.  to purchase new tools and invest in a new wood-sanding machine. He hopes that the coming year will continue to bring positive growth and increased sales.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and invest in a new wood-sanding machine

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Oun P. was born in 1988; she is a married woman and blessed with one child. Her child is a student in the local public school. Her husband, Vorn Saran, 29, is a local farmer who operates a farm which he got from his grandmother. Oun P. has built a pigpen behind her house where she raises many pigs to earn a living. Oun P.’s husband had planted rice and vegetable crops two months ago, but his crops are not growing well because they need more fertilizer. To remedy the situation, Oun P. would like a loan for her husband to buy sacks of fertilizer and seed for planting.

loans.use: To buy  sacks of fertilizer and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Wafae

texts.en: Wafae is a 56-year-old married woman living in Saida with her husband and three children. Wafae has owned a grocery store since 1997. She’s requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, for the 10th time, in order to buy olives produced on her neighbors land for the whole year to sell at retail. Wafae's previous loans were very useful and productive and she is a very good borrower. She helps her family with their needs as she struggles for a better living . She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy olives to sell

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn S. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 35 years old. Jenalyn is married and has two children aged 16 and 14. To make a living, Jenalyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Like any other mother, she wants her children to finish college and have bright futures.

Jenalyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Jenalyn is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and feeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and feeds

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe A., 41 years old, is a very industrious mother from Talisay, Pandan, Antique, Philippines. She is married to a very supportive husband, Ceriaco A. Jr., and they are blessed with four children: Gerald, Gerryl, Kenneth and Kenny John, who are all studying. Ma. Fe believes that children are really the future of the land and that this future could be attained through education, the best weapon to combat poverty. Despite poverty, Ma. Fe and her husband really work hard just to earn an income to send their children to school.

This couple earns a living through their tricycle business and Ma. Fe has a variety store situated at Pandan Public Market.  As of now, this couple has already repaid their loan and Ma. Fe is proposing another loan in the amount of PHP 24,000 to be used as additional capital for her business. Ma. Fe's greatest dream is that all of her children finish their studies until college so that they will get better jobs. She also plans to expand her store if she gets more capital so that she will have a greater income.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Maria Berfalia

texts.es: Maria Berfalia L. C. de 43 años de edad, reside en el municipio de ilopango, en donde vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos, los cuales son estudiantes. María posee una tortillería, la cual esta ubicada en su propia casa, desde hace un tiempo atrás que ella se dedica a este oficio, debido a que es madre muy responsable a la cual le interesa aportar económicamente a su hogar. Es por esta razón que María debe trabajar muy duro por seguir adelante tratando de crecer en su negocio de tortillas. María solicitó un préstamo a Integral con la esperanza de poder mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, ya que por medio de este ella comprará mayor cantidad de maíz, el cual al comprarlo por mayor lo obtiene a precios más bajos. Esto será de mucho beneficio para ella ya que le permitirá atender mayor demanda, lo cual le brindará mayores ganancias. Esto llena de muchas esperanzas a María ya que contará con el dinero necesario para brindarle todos lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en: Maria Berfalia Leon C. is 43 years old and resides in the municipality of Ilopango where she lives with her spouse and 2 children; they are students.  Maria has a tortilla making business that she has been running out of her home for some time now.  She is a responsible mother who likes to contribue economically to the household.  This is why Maria must work really hard to get ahead and continue to grow her business of making tortillas.  Maria has solicited a loan from Integral with the hope of improving her working conditions and purchasing corn in bulk which allows her to purchase it at a lower price.  This will be very beneficial to her because it will allow her to meet a greater demand and bring in more earnings.  This fills Maria with a lot of hope since she counts on the money to offer her kids all the necessary things.

loans.use: Purchase corn to produce more tortillas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: stock more paste (groundnuts and simsim) and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Kekognouman Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Kekognouman qui toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 38 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Warassala, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce des condiments, du riz, du charbon de bois et du beurre de karité.                                                                                                                               
Après avoir correctement remboursés les quinze prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe Kekognouman sont à leur seizième prêt solidaire.                                                                       
KAFOUNE D. compte acheter des condiments alimentaires avec les revendeurs du marché de Fana. Elle effectue sa vente quotidiennement au village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40.000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce de condiments alimentaires.
texts.en:
he members of the Kekognouman group are all married women, averaging 38 years of age, with three children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Warassala, Sub-prefecture of Fana, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali). They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They sell condiments, rice, charcoal and shea butter. After having duly repaid 15 prior loans, the members of the Kekognouman group are on their 16th solidarity loan.

Kafoune D. plans to  purchase food condiments from resellers af thte Fana Market. She sells daily out of her home in the village, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed of both men and women. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 40,000 West African francs, which will be used to repay the loan, with the remainder of the income reinvested in her retail business.

loans.use: to purchase food condiments

loans.name: Josie

texts.en: Josie is 46 years, married and has six children. Her oldest child is 27 years old and her youngest is 6. She makes a living as a farmer, helping her husband grow rice and corn. The couple works hard to raise a good crop and has been farming for 20 years. Josie has applied for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer, and her goal is to raise a very large crop this year. Her main hope in life is to give her children the brightest possible futures.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Roger

texts.es: El señor Roger se dedica a la colocación de aretes (piercing), el crédito lo requiere para la compra de guantes, aretes, tijeras, pinzas, gasas, etc., pues esta actividad es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantenerse y ayudar a su madre. Es soltero,  vive en casa de su mare  ubicada en la zona de las Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en: Sr. Roger operates an ear-piercing service.  The loan he is requesting will be used to buy gloves, earrings, scissors, tweezers, gauze, and other supplies.  This business is the only source of income that he has to support himself and help his mother.  Roger is single and lives at his mother’s house in the District of Sopocachi in the city of La Paz.

loans.use: To purchase gloves, earrings, scissors, tweezers, gauze, and other supplies.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen works hard to support two children. She is married and has a fruits and vegetables vending business in the Philippines. 

Carmen requested a 1,800 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove. 

She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to make the firewood that she buys last longer--the Envirofit stove needs less fuel to cook food. 

Carmen is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase an Envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Jericho Nomba One Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JERICHO NOMBA ONE est formé de trois personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier à Hindé à Cotonou. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Antoinette, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo.  C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Née en Septembre 1946 à Cotonou, Antoinette est mariée à un vitrier du nom de Joseph. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à leur charge. Antoinette habite à Hindé avec ses enfants et son mari. Antoinette vit dans ce quartier depuis sa naissance. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Il y a près de trois ans que Antoinette mène comme activité, la vente de charbon de bois à son domicile. Antoinette s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Antoinette désire obtenir un autre financement, ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe.
texts.en:
The Jericho Nomba One group is made up of three people who all live in the same district of Hindé in Cotonou. The representative of this group, called Antoinette, is the one raising her hand on the photo. This is the second time that the group is requesting financial aid from Alidé, with a view to expanding their business. 

Antoinette was born in September 1946 in Cotonou and is married to a glazier by the name of Joseph. The couple has six children, all of whom have been educated, and three of whom are in their care. Antoinette lives in Hindé with her children and husband. She has lived in this district since she was born. The couple shares the various family expenses between them. Antoinette has been selling charcoal from home for three years. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, Benin's international market. With the aim of strengthening her business and responding better to customer demand, Antoinette would like to obtain another loan together with the other members of her group.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Cecilia Elena

texts.es:
Cecilia vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla y tiene un restaurante donde vende permanentemente los más deliciosos menús típicos, como sancochos, asados de pollo y carne a la plancha principalmente; ella inició su negocio para adicionarle a su hogar un segundo ingreso que aumentara el bienestar de su familia, compuesta por su conyugue y su hijo de 9 años. 
Hoy Cecilia goza de una buena clientela y para lograr perfeccionar su oficio, está estudiando cocina internacional con la que impactará el mercado próximamente, pues son pocos los negocios que ofrecen este tipo de comidas, su sueño es hacerlo crecer y con el aprendizaje de nuevos platos, diversificará su oferta y agregará a ella comidas típica sabanera, muy apetecidas en la ciudad. Sus principales clientes son vecinos, referidos y algunos empleados. 
Este es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará materias primas en mayor volumen, con tal de ahorrar en sus compras con los descuentos que ofrecen los proveedores y también comprará silletería plásticas, para aumentar las posibilidades de acceso a nuevos clientes, que muchas veces se van, porque todas las sillas están ocupadas. Su sueño es ubicar su infraestructura en un punto estratégico de mayor alcance, para lograr ser reconocida visualmente desde el principio y no a través de referidos como es lo que hasta ahora está ayudandole al incremento de sus ventas.
texts.en:
Cecilia lives in the city of Barranquilla and has a restaurant where she permanently sells the most delicious traditional meals like “sancocho,” (a hardy soup), grilled chicken and meat.  She started her business to add a second income to her home to increase the wellbeing of her family which consists of her husband and 9-year-old son.

Today, Cecilia enjoys a good clientele and to perfect her occupation is studying international cuisine to impact the market soon since there are few businesses that offer this type of meal.  Her dream is to make it grow and by learning new dishes she’ll diversify her offering and add meals typical of the savannah which are very appreciated in the city.  Her main customers are neighbors, referred folks and a few employees.

This is the first loan Fundación Mario Santo Domingo has granted her and she’ll use it to buy raw materials in large volume to save on costs taking advantage of discounts offered by suppliers for bulk purchases.  She will also buy plastic tables and chairs to increase access possibilities for new customers who often leave because all the seats are occupied.

Her dream is to install her infrastructure in a strategic spot with wider reach to become visually recognized from the beginning and not through referrals which is what’s been helping her sales grow to date.

loans.use: to buy raw materials in bulk to take advantage of discounts offered by suppliers and also to buy plastic tables and chairs.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 53-year-old mother of two daughters and two sons. Her husband is an employee with a meager salary, Samar and her husband managed to save money and open a clothes store for their son Muhammad who appears in the picture here instead of his mother as she is a conservative woman.

Samar took out a loan from FATEN to pay for clothes her son imported from Egypt as he wants to increase the profit and have the chance to expand the display space for clothes in the store. The store is located in one of the city center shopping streets.

 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. 

FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m

loans.use: Purchase clothes and enlarge the exhibiting space for goods.

loans.name: Arche De Noé Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mutima, représentante du groupe d’affaire « Arche de Noé»,  est entrepreneur, âgée de 50 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants, tous étudient, parmi les quels, il y a des universitaires et d’autres ont leurs propres foyers. Elle est vendeuse de friperie et sociétaire d’un atelier moderne de coupe couture. Son mari est un professeur de l’université. Elle étale ses marchandise  au long de la route, devant son domicile. Il y a 20 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces activités. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  9 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  2 ballons de friperies.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et construire une maison dans la parcelle qu’elle avait acheté des bénéfices cumulés de son business.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Arche de Noé» est majoritairement féminins.Certaines mamans clientes portent joyeusement leurs bébés dans leurs mains. et que d’autres figures sont difficilement visibles sur cette photo du groupe suite à l’espace et positionnement.
texts.en:
The client Mutima is the representative of the business group “Noah’s Ark,” is an entrepreneur, 50 years old, married, and the mother of six. All her children study; some are already university students and others have their own households. She sells used clothing and is a member of a modern sewing shop. Her husband is a university professor. She displays her goods by the road, in front of her home. She has been in this business for 20 years.

She just finished nine loan cycles with Hekima. This new loan will allow her to purchase two bales of used clothing. In addition, her goal is to provide for her children’s education and to buy a house on the land plot she has bought thanks to the income from her business. She thanks Hekima for its work in support of impoverished women who don’t have access to the classical bank system. It needs to be noted that the majority of “Noah’s Ark” group members are women. Some mothers are seen in the photo joyfully holding their babies; some women’s faces are hard to see because the entire group had to fit into the picture.

loans.use: to buy two bales of clothing

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en:
Dionesio is 51 years old and married with six children. The oldest child is 21 years old and the youngest is nine.

Dionesio is a farmer who owns and tills land in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. He has been growing rice and corn crops for 13 years. He plans to use his loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Dionesio hopes to have a stable income that will enable him to save for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is 32 years old and married to Winfred. They have two children aged ten and seven years old. He has been running his bakery business for the past three years. He earns a monthly income of about KES 15,000, which he uses to run his business and care for his family.

He has been loaned KES 20,000 by KADET LTD. He intends to use the loan to purchase more stock like wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and expand his business. With the anticipated profit, he plans to save and repay his loan. 

He plans to open a butchery trading business at Tala in the future.

loans.use: To buy more stock like wheat flour, cooking oil, and sugar for his bakery

loans.name: Help Me- Are- Help You Group

texts.en:
Fatmata is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Aged 52, she was born in Lunsar, northern Sierra Leone. She is divorced with three children, two of whom are in college and secondary school. 

For 10 years Fatmata has been selling market food – tomatoes, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), pepper, salt, onions, fish, etc. This is the first loan that Fatmata and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Fatmata will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business. She will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to resell at retail.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, margi, pepper, salt, onions, fish, etc. at wholesale to sell at the market

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca, de 35 años es una valerosa madre soltera que cuida con amor a su hijo Antony de 2 años de edad. Ella vive en casa de su madre ubicada en el caserío de Purhuaracra.
