Su razón de progreso, es su hijo a quien desea brindarle la mejor educación. Razón por la que comenzó desde los 18 años a trabajar la tierra y dedicar sus fuerzas al oficio de la agricultura. Desde niña aprendió todo lo necesario para comenzar a sembrar papa y variedad de hortalizas como espinaca, lechuga y demás. Asimismo trabaja en sociedad con su hermana en la siembra de alfalfa. Lo que más le gusta a ella es comercializar sus cosechas a la ciudad de Tarma, pero según cuenta en temporadas de mayor venta, lleva a vender sus verduras a la capital del país. Paralelo a este trabajo, también se dedica a la ganadería, con la compra y venta de ganado ovino y vacuno, los cuales enseba para luego venderlos a un mayor precio, comenta que hay épocas donde duplica el valor de lo comprado. Ahora ella desea ahorrar lo necesario para mejorar sus cultivos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Productores de purhuaracra” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo financiero de todos ustedes. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Rebeca de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varias cabezas de ganado ovino, asimismo en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir en su próxima siembra de papa “andina”.
texts.en:
Rebeca, age 35, is a valiant single mother who lovingly cares for her two-year-old son Antony. She lives at her mother’s house in the village of Purhuaracra. Her reason for making progress is so that she can provide her son the best education. Rebeca has been working the land since she was 18 years old and has dedicated her efforts to farming. As a young girl, she learned everything that is required for growing potatoes and a variety of other vegetables such as spinach, lettuce, and other crops. She also grows alfalfa with the help of her sister. What she enjoys most is selling her crops in the city of Tarma. However, if her crops are in season, then she will take them to Lima to sell so that she can get a better price.

In addition to farming, Rebeca also raises livestock. She buys and sells sheep and cattle. Rebeca fattens the animals for eventual resale at a better price. She says that there are times when her returns are double the value of her original purchase price. Now she wants to save in order to improve her crops.

Rebeca is a member of the Communal Bank “Productores de Purhuaracra” (Producers of Purhuaracra) and this is her third loan with MFP. She hopes to obtain everyone’s financial support and promises to submit her payments on time. Once she receives the assistance, she will invest the money she requested in the purchase of several heads of cattle and sheep. She will also buy natural fertilizers to apply on her next crop of Andean potatoes.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and fertilizers.

loans.name: Nonvignon E Group

texts.fr: NONVIGNON E est un groupement constitué de quatorze personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Akoko Delphine. Les membres du groupe habitent dans le même quartier au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement et d'élargir leur activité, ce groupement sollicite pour la première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Akoko Delphine est âgée de 50 ans et est mariée à un certain Négniwoé. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés, dont un est à leur charge. Akoko Delphine et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Il y a près de trente ans que Akoko Delphine mène comme activité la vente de produits vivriers à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Akoko Delphine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Akoko Delphine et aux autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON E, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
NONVIGNON E is a group made up of 14 people who all live in the same district in Benin. The group is requesting their first loan from ALIDé in order to increase their working capital and grow their business activity.
The group´s leader (the woman in the picture with her hand raised) is called Akoko Delphine. She is 50 years old and is married to Négniwoé. The couple has one dependent child and 3 children in all, all of whom go to school. Akoko Delphine and her husband both contribute to the various household expenses. Akoko Delphine has sold food products from her home for nearly 30 years, an activity which enables her to meet her needs. She gets her supplies at the market.
This loan would enable Akoko Delphine and the NONVIGNON E group to increase their business levels, pull in more customers and make greater profits.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a fence for the house

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel, a 43-year-old married father of five, lives in Lower Lodiong, Tambulig, Zamboanga del sur, where he has operated a general store for almost three  years. Having joined PMPC this year, he is requesting a loan for 6000 to purchase more stocks for his general store. In the future, Daniel hopes that he can improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for his general store.

loans.name: Hussien

texts.en: Hussien, 51, has been in the trading business for a while now selling aluminum parts. He also has his own store where they make cabinets and other stuff from aluminum based on the customer’s order. Now Hussien has applied for a loan to expand his business and use other types of materiA. such as metA..

loans.use: to expand his business and use other types of material such as metal.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en: Prisca is 35 years old and married to a businessman who owns a hardware store. They have three children who are between six and thirteen years old. Prisca sells garments for both women and men, and she has been doing this business for 5 years.  With the profits, she will pay school fees and provide food for the family. She dreams to become the sole manufacturer of garments in the future.

loans.use: To buy more garments for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy poultry feed and clothes from Zambia

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo, age 47, is engaged in a farming business. For the past year of operating his farm, he has been able to master essential methodologies and to continue learning new adaptations to keep pace with modernization in the agricultural sector. However, his crops were destroyed by storms resulting from the unexpected typhoon that entered the province where he lives.
 
For this reason, he is asking for a loan in the amount of PhP 15,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides. With these inputs, he can improve his business. His goal is to lift his family out of poverty and improve their standard of living. Moreover, he is determined to provide sufficient financial support for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 43 years old and lives in Migpange, Bonifacio, Philippines. She is a married woman with two children. 
Tita has a business venture selling seafood products, including crabs and shrimp, in the local community to earn a living. She has been working in this business for 16 years. Each month, she earns 4,400 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to pay for harvesting crabs. 
Tita has been a member of Kiva partner GDMPC for a year. In the future, she wants to build house, see her children finish their studies, and save a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting crabs.

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
Rosa Mistica se llama el grupo integrado por 14 mujeres trabajadoras de la ciudad de Villa Elisa. Ellas se unieron con el proposito de trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo poder ayudar a sus familias e hijos. Se encuentran actualmente en el segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya.
Maria nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de todo tipos de calzados, gracias a lo cual ha podido ayudar a su familia y cubrir sus gastos diarios. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora. Comenta que tiene muy buena clientela debido a la buena calidad de sus productos y gracias a la simpatía de Maria.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de calzados, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir de esa forma con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Rosa Mistica communal bank is made up of 14 hardworking women from the city of Villa Elisa. They came together for the purpose of working together and through their work helping their families and children. They are now in the second loan cycle of the Mujeres Emprendedoras program of Fundación Paraguaya. 

Maria tells us that she sells all kinds of footwear, thanks to which she has been able to help her family meet daily expenses. She is known as a very hardworking and enterprising woman. She notes that she has a very good clientele due to the good quality of her products and thanks to her own friendly personality. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase shoes, with which she will be able to stock her supply and meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to purchase shoes for later sale.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a farmer in Litein, South Rift, Kenya and is married with  two children aged 7 and 9. His farm currently produces  milk and tea for the local market. He maintains his family with his farming revenue which is their sole source of income.

Robbert has requested a loan of 70,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. He believes he will be able to educate his children with the dairy income. He adds he will build a better dairy unit for his animals and appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for their loan services.

Robbert is however worried by the constant high cost of animal feed. He is aged 39 and married.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sai

texts.en: Sai, 66, resides in Prey Veng Province. Sai grows rice and her husband repairs motorbikes for people in his village. Sai is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to operate car-and-motorbike washing services. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, Sai would like to use any additional income to expand her husband’s repairing services. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to operate car-and-motorbike washing services

loans.name: Raghad

texts.en:
Raghad is a 20-years-old young woman. Her husband has a job with a decent salary. To improve his income he works in agriculture. Raghad wants to help her husband by paying the expenses for purchasing greenhouses to use for the winter agricultural season.  Since her husband's salary is not enough to pay the family's daily life expenses and to purchase greenhouses for agricultural use, Raghad needs to take a loan from FATEN to help her husband in paying for the greenhouses. 

When Raghad gets the loan, she will be able to help her husband improve his agriculture and prepare to grow better crops to increase his sales and subsequently increase the family's income and offer to them better living conditions. Raghad is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to pay the expenses for purchasing new greenhouses for agriculture use.

loans.name: Los Garcias Group

texts.es:
El grupo lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es  Mayra del Carmen quien se dedica al comercio de ropa desde hace 5 años.  Ella está casada con don Eddy con el cual tiene dos hijos. 
El crédito lo  invertirá en mercadería en especial pantalones y blusas.
Los otros integrantes son Juan quien se dedica al comercio en general desde hace varios años y Manuel quien se dedica al comercio general es decir vende de todo un poco.
texts.en:
The group is made up of three hard-working and enterprising people. One of them is Mayra del Carmen who has sold clothes for a living for the past 5 years. She is married to Don Eddy, with whom she has two children.

She will invest the loan in merchandise, in particular pants and blouses.

The other members are Juan, who has sold general items for several years, and Manuel who also sells general items, in other words a little of everything.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, pants and blouses

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 41 years old and does farming in Kangundo town. She keeps livestock and grows cash crops, such as maize and vegetables, for selling. She is married, and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with five children. Her spouse produces additional income in support of the family.

Mary plans to use the loan to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizers and seeds, for planting. She also plans to buy feed for her cattle. This is her second loan and she repaid her previous loan successfully.

Mary hopes to have more cattle as well as educate her children to tertiary level

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen sells cosmetics and perfumes. She started off as an assistant for a friend and decided to branch off and start her own operation with a $100 loan from her sister. She now offers cosmetics, perfumes and cleaning products to her customers. She is need of the loan in order to invest in more of these products and also in some clothes. She sees the time of year as a golden opportunity to increase her profits.

Carmen is a single mother of three children. Two of her children are old enough to go to school but the other is still too young. The toughest part of raising her kids on her own has been finding someone to take care of them. When she sees that she must go out and sell in order to make ends meet, she has to leave her youngest child at the care of her 9 year old daughter. She hopes that if she continues to increase profits she will be able to run the business out of her home.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She is need of the loan in order to invest in more of these products and also in some clothes

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married. After graduating from the college of commerce, she worked for a time as a market vendor. She was the only breadwinner in the family and wasn’t able to earn much income. Financial problems brought out her tenacity and innovation, however, and she decided to start her own small business. Today she has a small kiosk selling casual and dressy outerwear for women in one of the local markets. Irina is a focused, hard worker. She puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She has had a great history with “Nadiya Ukraine” having repaid each of the 12 loans she has received. Irina would like to get a loan for $1,200 to open a new vending facility and re-supply her inventory. She is planning to purchase a variety of clothing items and will significantly expand her trade with a second location. Irina believes that having an assortment of women’s outerwear that is both practical and fashionable will increase her sales and offer both warmth and style suitable to any taste and weather.

Ірина – одружена. Після закінчення технікуму торгівлі вона певний час працювала продавцем на ринку. Вона одна заробляла на життя, але грошей усе одно не вистачало. Саме фінансові проблеми виявили витривалість та творчі здібності Ірини й вона вирішила почати власний бізнес. Зараз в неї є маленький кіоск з продажу повсякденного та ошатного верхнього жіночого одягу на одному з місцевих ринків. Ірина – дуже наполеглива й працьовита. Вона багато працює задля того, щоб її бізнес був прибутковим. Ірина дуже любить спілкуватися з покупцями, завжди присвячує їм багато часу. В неї чудова кредитна історія в „Надії України”, вона сплатила усі 12 позик, які отримала в організації. Ірина хотіла б отримати позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб відкрити нову торгову точку та закупити необхідний товар. Вона планує закупити різноманітний одяг та значно розширити торгівлю завдяки другому кіоску. Ірина вважає, що широкий асортимент практичних та модних жіночих курток, пальт та светрів збільшить обсяги продажів, а багатьох покупців забезпечить теплим одягом за будь-яких погодних умов.

loans.use: To open a new vending facility

loans.name: Aaron

texts.en: Aaron M. is a married father of three. He owns a cyber cafe for a living. He intends to use the loan to restock his computers and expand his business.

loans.use: I intend to restock and expand my business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Business Description

Martha works hard to sell bedspreads, awning (like a canvas canopy), quilts as well as undergarments and home products. Having 10 years of experience, she works independently. She starts work very early in the morning, delivering goods to towns in the outskirts of the city. She travels four days of the week.

Use of Loan

Martha needs the loan to purchase more merchandise and to have well-attended clients which increase her sales. By building up her clientele, Martha, in spite of being a single mother, has managed to grow her business as a result of her hard daily efforts.

Personal Details

Currently, Martha is 33 years old and lives together with her children who are ages 17, 14, 13 and 12 and are currently studying. Thanks to the help of her children she keeps her cement home very neat and cozy. Martha’s dream is to have a large business where she can display her merchandise to the locals and no longer needs to leave the city.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Dona Martha se dedica a la venta de colchas, toldos, edredones, además venta de ropa interior y artículos para el hogar. Teniendo como experiencia 10 anos, trabajando independientemente. Trabaja desde muy temprano del día, entregando su mercadería a los pueblos aledaños del sector, viajando 4 días a la semana.

Uso del Préstamo

Martha necesita el préstamo para comprar mas mercadería y tener a su clientela bien atendida, de tal forma que llegue a incrementar sus ingresos, por el nivel de clientela que ha llegado a tener y aumentar, Martha a pesar de ser madre soltera siempre ha llevado su negocio adelante, como resultado del esfuerzo realizado tras el día a día de trabajo.

Información Personal

En la actualidad Martha tiene 33 anos de edad, en donde vive junto a sus hijos de 17, 14, 13 y 12 anos de edad actualmente estudiando, gracias a la ayuda que les brindan sus hijos mantiene su casa de estructura de cemento, muy aseada y en condiciones acogedoras. Los sueños de Martha es tener un gran local, donde pueda mostrar su mercadería a la gente del sector y así ya no tenga que salir de su ciudad.

loans.use: invest in more merchandise

loans.name: Surita

texts.en:
Surita, a married woman of 22 from Saletele Fagaloa, is pictured here with her craft work. She specialises in the weaving of the Samoan fine mat and this is her form of employment.

Surita is one of the many very young women who have utilised their skills in producing the Samoan fine mat as a form of employment. Today, a very good Samoan fine mat can go to about two thousand Samoan tala (about US$ 740). This is a lot of money, but it must be noted that the weaving and production process also takes some good 5 to 6 months.

The assistance from SPBD has provided Surita with the resources to produce a fine mat and she hopes to continue earning money through the production of the Samoan fine mat.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials

loans.name: Planificados Group

texts.pt:
Neli and Nineta are members of the Planificados group. They joined the program this year. They each sell food products at their own homes. Neither Neli nor Nineta are officially married. But each one lives with a man. Nineta has 3 children and Neli has 5. All the children are studying. Neli's husband as well as Nineta's husband are unemployed. They live on small resources to be able to support their respective families. And that's why the two of them joined the credit program to support the home expenses and pay for their children's schooling.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Neli e Nineta sao membros do grupo Planificados. Elas entraram para o programa ainda este ano.Elas vendem produtos alimenticios cada uma na sua residencia.Tanto a Neli assim como a Nineta nao sao casadas oficialmente. Mas cada uma vive com um homem. Nineta tem 3 filhos e a Neli tem 5 filhos. Todas as criancas estao a estudar.Tanto o marido da Neli assim como o da Nineta nao estao empregados. Vivem de pequenos expedientes para poderem sustentar as respectivas familias. E por isso que as duas entraram para o programa de credirto para apoiarem nas despesas da casa e pagar a escola dos filhos.

loans.use: Neli and Nineta want to use the money to purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Félix

texts.es:
Don Felix is a selfless and hard worker man. Since his childhood and all through his life, he has appreciate the essential value of work. That is the reason that now at his 64 years of age, he continues to have the same diligent spirit. But there is sorrow in his life due to the fact that he and his wife have been unable to have children even though she has gone through a lot of treatments and efforts but that has not decrease his love for her.

He own a small lemon and citrics farm where he works fervently and also sells his products to wholesale buyers. Since young, Felix has been longing for the day that he can have a sugarcane field to produce a raw, unrefined, non-centrifugal cane sugar with a high molasses content called "chancaca". He has been unable to fulfill his dream because some time ago he was swindled out of his savings for it by a fellow countryman that worked with him. He didn't thought for a minute of all the difficulties that Don Felix went through to save that money and took it. Now you have an opportunity to help Felix by contributing for a loan that will amke his dream a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Don Félix, es un hombre muy abnegado y trabajador que desde su niñez y durante toda su vida supo apreciar el valor imprescindible que tiene el trabajo, es por ello que aún ahora a sus 64 años, sigue teniendo ese mismo espíritu diligente; sin embargo la tristeza que embarga su vida es el penoso hecho de no tener hijos a pesar del esfuerzo y muchos tratamientos al que se ha sometido su esposo; hecho que no ha generado que su amor por ella disminuya. Él posee una chacra de limones y cítricos donde trabaja muy fervientemente para después comercializar sus productos a los compradores mayoristas.Félix posee un inmenso anhelo en su corazón desde muchacho, y es el de tener un cañaveral para fabricar chancaca, sueño por el que hace un tiempo atrás fue estafado por su paisano, quien trabajaba con él y no escatimó dificultades para llevarse una gran suma de dinero.Ahora vosotros podéis contribuir con Félix para el logro de sus planes a través de un préstamo que le permitirá concretar su sueño.

loans.use: Buying seeds to grow a sugarcane field.

loans.name: Nansana 7/8 2037 (B) Group

texts.en: Dorothy is 30 years old. Her current business is seeling clothes.With the extra business profits, Dorothy intends to buy a container (kiosk) for her boutique which she can station in one place. She belives this will increase total sales.

loans.use: To increase stock.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab H. is a businesswoman. She is 38 and married with 5 children, who all live together. Her business is to sell food. Zainab's plan is to expand the business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en: Mrs. Ouch H., 56, grows vegetables for a living, together with her husband. They sell their cropsin the market and earn approximately $2 a day of profit. This couple has 3 children, one of whom is a garment worker with a salary $75 a month and one other is married and lives separately. She would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a water pump to water her crops in the dry season in case it is difficult to find water.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch C. is a 31-year-old living in the province of Kampong Cham. She provides a valuable service to the villagers in her district by selling drinking water, which she pumps from the well right by her house. She earns $2 USD per day. Her husband, Kim Chun, is a mechanic and brings in $2.60 USD daily for the family. They are currently sending all three of their children to school full time. She wants to invest in a modern water pump to expedite the process of getting water each morning and, thus, to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase and install a water pump.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Mrs. Suon M. owns a small general store from which she sells desserts, cakes, biscuits and drinks in Sre Au Village in Kampong Speu Province. Her husband, Sambath Pen, is a land broker, but now he wants to start a motorcycle taxi driver business; thus Mrs. Suon M. has asked for a loan to buy a motorbike.

Mrs. Suon M. is 31 and has four children, three of whom are enrolled in school while the fourth is too young to work or study. Mrs. Suon M. and her husband work hard to support all their family expenses. Mrs. Suon M. has never obtained a micro-loan before.

loans.use: To start a motorcycle taxi driver business.

loans.name: Sokhum

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhum T., 47, and her husband, Mr. Vi Vet, 48, who live across Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1990 and have four children, three sons and one daughter. All of their children are in school.

Mrs. Sokhum has been selling vegetable and doing farming for eighteen years, a skill she learned from her parents. She sells vegetables at the market in Phnom Penh, which she buys from farmers in her village and some from her own farm. Mr. Vi has been a farmer for eighteen years. He grows papayas, cucumbers, and other kinds of vegetable in his farm a bit far from house. Beside of farming, he also raises cows as well.

Now Sokhum is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase vegetable from farmer in contract and repairing and improving her house.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable from farmer in contract and repairing and improving her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in undergarments in order to start a small business.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en: Nhung has borrowed 2 times from Kiva. She paid back her loans on time, did her job well and made more profit. She would like a loan from KIVA again in order to increase her store's stock.

loans.use: To increase her shop's stock

loans.name: Khanali

texts.en: 8 years ago, Khanali started the butchery business. He was born in 1957. This man is married and has 3 children. Khanali is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town and has settled in the Fizuli region. Now he needs a loan of US$ 750 to buy meat to expand his butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy meat for re-sale

loans.name: Mele

texts.en:
Mele T. is 59 years old and married with seven children. She has four years of experience selling desserts and cakes. She sells to local villagers and the public seven days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~$187 USD).

Mele has two previous loans with SPBD (South Pacific Business Development), and she is eager to further improve her business operation by purchasing plastic cups, sugar, and Kool Aid. SPBD loans are her only access to capital, because she is not able to qualify for a traditional bank loan.

loans.use: To purchase plastic cups, sugar, and Kool Aid.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura S. prepares and sells food in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar. She is currently able to earn a profit of approximately $80 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more flour and oil. These are two of the main ingredients in the snacks she prepares, so this loan will enable her to cook and sell more and increase her profit.

Zuhura is 26 years old, married, and has two children, ages 4 and 1-and-a-half.

loans.use: To buy flour and oil for her food-selling business.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim baji is the wife of M. and lives Riwind, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children: two daughters and one son. All of her children are enrolled in a local neighborhood school. Shamim baji’s husband owns a shuttering business. He provides beams and ropes as materials to building contractors. Shamim baji herself has been selling milk for the past four years. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to help expand her milk business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk selling business

loans.name: Thuy

texts.vi:
Chị Lưu Thị Thuý năm nay 36 tuổi, chị hiện đang sống cùng chồng và hai con nhỏ tại huyện Kim động Tỉnh Hưng Yên. Chị Thuý tham gia Quỹ tình thương đã được 11 năm. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương chị Thuý có một cửa hàng  nhỏ chuyên kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá. Sau khi có thêm nguồn vốn vay của Quỹ chị đã mạnh dạn đầu tư vốn để kinh doanh quần áo. Hiện tại chị đang là chủ cửa hàng kinh doanh rất nhiều loại quần áo tại huyện Kim Động với thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng. Ngoài ra chồng chị còn làm thêm nghề xe ôm nên thu nhập của gia đình chị rất ổn định.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay  15.000.000đ để đầu tư cho việc kinh doanh quần áo của gia đình.
texts.en:
Ms. L. Thi Thuy is 36 years old. She lives with her husband and 2 small children in Kim Dong District in the town of Hung Yen. Ms. Thuy joined TYM fund 11 years ago. Prior to joining the fund, Ms. Thuy had a small grocery store. After being able to borrow money from the fund, she invested in a clothing shop. Presently she is the owner of a clothing store that carries many different styles in Kim Dong District with average monthly income of 120 USD. In addition, her husband also makes money giving rides on his motorcycle, so her family's economic situation is very stable. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 900 USD to invest in her clothing shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James A. P. is 63 years old. He is married and the father of five children. He says that, with the help of God, all of his children attend school. 

He owns and operates a grocery shop where he sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk, and biscuits in his neighborhood of Nkawkaw. With his six years of experience in this business, James has supported two of his children to senior high school. He hopes to send them to the tertiary level.

Fortunately, his business has been positioned at a strategic location in the town where he lives. Because of this, he believes, when he receives extra income, he can serve more customers in the community. Moreover, the surrounding communities do not have big grocery shops like his. 

With the loan, he wants to purchase more assorted drinks, sugar, vegetable oil, and biscuits to increase his inventory. He hopes to improve his savings to support his children in school. 

James belongs to a village bank called Divine. He hopes to receive GH¢400 loan to make his business progress and he would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Jennifer M. from Mwanza. She is married with one child aged eight. Jennifer has been running a tailoring business since 1999. Client’s business is to make tailoring clothes. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week. Jennifer currently earns about 150 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase bedsheets and resell them. In the future, she plans to add more types of cloth. Jennifer thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bedsheets for resale

loans.name: Sackohoin

texts.fr: A. sockohoin habite le quartier d’adidogomé, elle a pour activité la vente de fripperie, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2001 et ce de faisant de façon ambulante, actuellemenent  elle a un petit stock, son objectif est d’agrandir son stock de marchandies et trouver une placve dans un marché et y dresser un étalage c’est pour cela qu’elle s’adresse à wages pour obtenir un crédit afin de financer son projet. Elle est divorcée de son mari et à deux enfants, son mari contribue partiellement à la prise en charge de ses enfants
texts.en:
A. Sockohoin lives in the Adidogomé district. Her work involves selling used clothing, towels, and the like. She has been in this business since 2001 and goes door-to-door in her work. Currently, she has a small inventory of merchandise. Her objective is to expand it and to find a spot at a marketplace for setting up a display. That's why she's enquiring with WAGES for obtaining a loan, so as to finance this project. She is divorced from her husband and has two children. Her husband partially helps with supporting the children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Daysi Georgina

texts.es: La señora Daysi Georgina V. A. tiene la edad de 35 años, su estado civil es soltera. La actividad económica de Doña Daysi es la venta de ropa y cosméticos. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, Doña Daisy heredo este negocio de su Mama y por lo que decidió hacerse cargo de su negocio para no perder esta fuente de ingresos. Los propósitos de Doña Daysi para su negocio son de son de engrandecer su negocio con el fin de mantener este trabajo. El financiamiento que Doña Daysi solicita es para capital de trabajo como es la compra de ropa, cosméticos y calzado. Sus deseos son de poseer una pulpería para que esta pueda ser una fuente de ingresos para su familia. la cantidad que solicita es de C$ 9.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Ms. Daysi Georgina V. A. is thirty-five years old and single. Her business is clothing and cosmetics retail sales. She has been in this business for four years since she inherited it from her mother and decided to manage the business so that she would not lose the steady flow of income. Daysi's objective is to expand her business with the goal to keep this job. The financing that Daysi requests is for work capital which will go towards the purchase of clothing, cosmetics, and shoes. She wishes to have a grocery store that provides her family with an inflow of income. The loan amount she requests is $450 USD.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata K. est une femme de 40 ans mariée avec 01 enfant en charge. Elle veut, avec ce prêt renforcer son capital. Son activité consiste à acheter en gros des sacs de manioc pour le revendre en détail. Elle a pour objectif  d’améliorer les conditions de vie familiales.
texts.en:
Fatoumata K., 40, is married and raising one child. She wants to use this loan to bolster her working capital. Her business consists in buying sacks of manioc wholesale and selling the merchandise retail. Her goal is to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of manioc

loans.name: Jura

texts.ru: Джуре 42 года, женат и имеет 5 детей. Джура нигде не работает и занимается предпринимательством. Он продает различные мелкие электротовары: розетки, выключатели, электропровода и тп. Кроме этого в его ассортименте запасные части для велосипедов. Все эти товары пользуются хорошим спросом и приносят хорошую прибыль. Дополнительно к этому Джура у себя дома занимается ремонтом велосипедов и электродвижков. Джура хочет получить займ и планирует закупить запасные части к велосипедам.
texts.en:
Jura is 42 years old. He is married with 5 children. Jura is officially unemployed but he works as an entrepreneur. He sells small electrical appliances: wires, switches, plugs, etc. In addition, he sells spare parts for bikes. All these goods are in demand and bring profit. Jura also repairs bikes and electic engines. Now he would like to obtain a loan and purchase more spare parts for bicycles.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Latifa Group

texts.en:
Latifa is a member of Latifa group. There are three members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan for her own business progress.

Latifa wants to take a loan for her business of tailoring.

Tamana wants to take a loan for her bead-working business.

Wazhma wants to take a loan for making head-coverings.

Together they requested a group loan of 15,000 Afghani for the term of 9 months. They are happy that, through this process, they can progress.

loans.use: To improve their businesses

loans.name: Adebola

texts.en: Adebola I. is 46 years old and married with 4 children. She has a tailoring shop where she sews clothes and also sells sarongs and tailoring materials. She is requesting the loan amount of N 60,000 to purchase more tailoring materials.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for her work

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha B. (No. II)  is forty-one years old. Her twin sister also shares the same name, hence, the numbering for clear identification. She is married and has given birth to four children, one son and three daughters. All are currently in school – senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband is a teacher by profession. Martha is a trader. She deals in local soap manufacturing. She manufactures and sells local soap called ‘Alata soap’. She sells on a table top at the market square. She wants a loan to buy materials such as soda and oil. Martha also supplies to other retailers. She has been in business for two years. She aspires to expand her business and give her a children good education.

loans.use: To buy soda and oil

loans.name: Cynthia Paola

texts.es:
La señora Cynthia Paola Q. M. tiene 21 años de edad, vive en el distrito de moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de la Libertad – Perú.
La empresaria actualmente se encuentra estudiando enfermería en el VIII ciclo de la Universidad Nacional de Trujillo.
Cynthia se dedica a la venta de abarrotes tales como: azúcar, aceite, arroz, fideos en la tienda de su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles, compró mas abarrotes y logró surtir su tienda. 
Con este crédito de S/ 600 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en su negocio en la compra de mas abarrotes, como: leche azúcar, arroz, fideo, aceite, atan, galletas, chocolates,  gaseosas, jugos, etc.
Cynthia sueña con hacer crecer su negocio para generar dinero y poder apoyarse económicamente para culminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Cynthia Paola Q. M., 21, lives in the Moche district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is currently studying nursing in the eighth cycle at the Universidad Nacional de Trujillo. Cynthia sells groceries like sugar, oil, rice, and noodles in the store in her house. With her first loan for 300 PEN, she bought more groceries to stock her store. With this loan for 600 PEN, she will invest in her business and buy more groceries like sugar, rice, noodles, oil, tuna, crackers, chocolates, soft drinks, and juices, etc. Cynthia dreams of expanding her business to generate money and be able to economically support finishing her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more food products to sell in her store

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled, a 28-year-old married father of three children, operates a blacksmith's shop with his father (shown in the picture) where they make wrought-iron gates, railings, gates and iron chairs. 

Khaled would like to use this loan to buy pipes in bulk,  from which he will make fences and gates. By buying in bulk, he will get a better price on the materials he needs to do his work, and thus earn more for each piece that he sells.

loans.use: To buy pipes in bulk.

loans.name: Sonia Belinda

texts.es:
la señora Sonia Belinda G. E. tien 28 años de edad, vive en la colonia Villanueva de la ciudad Capital, ella tiene una pulperia queopera bajo el nombre de Pulperia E., la cual tiene mas de 15 años de darles servicios a la comunidad donde ella reside. 
ella tambien da clases en una escuela de 7am a 11am y despues se dedica a su negocio todo el dia y lo cierra hasta las 10pm todos los dias. ella es casada, tiene dos hijos los cuales estan pequeños y depende de ella al 100%.
el dinero que solicita es para invertirlo en su negocio ya que las ganancias del mismo son fuente de apoyo para su esposo y su mama que viven con ella.
texts.en:
Sonia Belinda G. E., aged 28, is married and the mother of two small children who fully depend on her. She lives in the neighborhood of Villanueva in the capital city.

Sonia operates a convenience store under the name "Pulpería E.". This store has served her local community for over 15 years. Sonia starts her day as a teacher; she gives classes in a school from 7 a.m. to 11 a.m. After that she is in her store for the rest of the day. She closes every evening at 10 p.m.

The loan requested by Sonia will be invested in her store, as its profit is a source of support for her husband and her mother who live with her.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy donuts, batteries, soft drinks, juice, butter, rice, beans, oil, bread, coffee, cookies, candy, soups, pasta, sauce, toilet paper, sanitary towels, confectionary, dairy products, milk, chocolate

loans.name: Suzy

texts.en: Suzy is thirty – eight years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all daughters who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Suzy is a trader. She trades in second hand textiles – clothes for unisex, bed sheets, etc. She hawks and treks to sell in other communities. She procures bales of second hand textiles from Accra. Suzy has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy second hand textiles

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is 35 years old and married with three children. She sells shoes to take care of her family's needs. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 nairas to purchase more shoes to sell, to make more profit for her family's upkeep. Faith says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Luamoana

texts.en: Luamoana A. is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Maagao. She is married and has four adult children. Luamoana owns and operates a business providing general services to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 600 WST a month. In 2005, Luamoana joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1000 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase equipment to improve her business. Luamoana is now requesting a new loan of 1750 WST which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. The loan will be her 4th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Lê Thị Hồng

texts.en:
P. Lê Thị Hồng is starting a business venture providing recycling services. The main source of income comes from hauling scrap metal for local businesses and community members. P. is a 20-year-old woman living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà nội. She is married and does not have any children. P. has been in this business for over one year and earns approximately 2.500.000 đồng a month from these activities.

In 2007, P. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. P. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.142.000 đồng from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase additional scrap metal to sell. P. is now requesting a new loan of 5.014.000 đồng which will be used to purchase additional scrap metal to sell. This will be her fourth loan from SEDA. P. plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. No. 10102140026.

About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

P. Lê Thị Hồng (10102140026) là 20 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà nội. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và không có con. Để kiếm sống, P. Đang bắt đầu công việc kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các P. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chuyên chở phế liệu cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa P.. P. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 1 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, P. kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND một tháng.

Vào 2007, P. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. P. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua phế liệu bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.014.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua phế liệu bổ sung để bán. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. P. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện điều kiện sống chung của gia đình người vay.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase additional scrap metal to sell

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en: Carlito Laurito, Jr. is from the village of Mailag, Valencia City. He is 39 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Carlito owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Carlito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji L. is currently in the business of selling bread and tea and is requesting a loan to buy crates of soda and water to sell. Keji is 28 years old and is married with a husband who is a soldier. She has one child who does not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a retail shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Buy crates of soda and water to sell

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio D. L. C. es un negociante que tiene el anhelo D. prosperar cada día para darle una mejor calidad D. vida a su esposa; sus hijos ya son personas grandes que dependen D. si mismos, pero aun así quiere dejar un buen patrimonio para su familia. El desD. hace 18 años en su casa instalo un negocio D. abarrotes en el que fue creciendo poco a poco ahora su negocio es prospero, en este momento necesita capital para comprar mas mercancía por L. época naviD.ña donD. mucha gente D. fuera viene a su negocio para comprar cosas para su cena D. navidad. El quiere estar preparado ya que es el mes que obtiene más ganancias.
texts.en:
Antonio D. L. C. is a businessman who yearns to prosper every day so that he can give a better life to his wife. His sons are already grown and support themselves, but even so he wants to leave a good inheritance for his family. For the past 18 years, he has had a grocery store in his home. Bit by bit, the business grew, and it is now prosperous. Right now he needs capital to buy more merchandise for the Christmas season. At this time of year a lot of people come to his business to buy things for their Christmas dinners. Antonio wants to be prepared because December is the month he makes the most profit.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock merchandise in store

loans.name: Egladis

texts.es: Egladis R. G. de 54 años de edad, reside en Armenia en el departamento de Sonsonate. Vive junto a su esposo y su único hijo de 11 años de edad. Ella posee una pupusería la cual esta ubicada frente a la Unidad de Salud del lugar. Egladis ha colocado su negocio en ese lugar ya que es un lugar muy rentable el cual le deja  muy buenas ganancias debido a todo los pacientes que llegan a la Unidad de Salud. Egladis solicita un préstamo ya que desea poder comprar más maíz, frijoles, aceite y gas propano para la preparación y cocimiento de las pupusas. Ella es una señora muy visionaria que ha sabido aprovechar muy bien las oportunidades que la vida le ha brindado, y es por esto que desea seguir creciendo en su negocio y de esta manera ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos diarios y sobre todo para poder suplir las necesidades de su hijo.
texts.en:
Egladis R. G. is 54 years old and lives in the Sonsonate District in Armenia, El Salvador. She lives with her son who's 11. She owns a small restaurant where she sells pupusas (tortilla filled with cheese and pork rind) and it's located in front of the town's Health Clinic, a location she chose because of the high traffic of people. Egladis is asking for a $700 loan that she'll use to buy more corn, beans, oil and gas to prepare her pupusas. She is a woman of vision and has been taken advantage of the opportunities that life has brought her, and that's why her business has been expanding and she's able to help her husband with household expenses and support her son.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Rocio Jaqueline

texts.es:
Rocío es una madre de familia de 35 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el sector Ucupe, distrito de Lagunas, ubicado a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza desde que tenía 20 años de edad, empezó ofreciendo estos productos por catálogo. Actualmente esta actividad le ayuda a solventar los gastos de su hogar ya que los ingresos que su esposo percibe como obrero agrícola no le son suficientes para mantener a la familia. 

El tiempo que lleva ofreciendo sus productos a sus habituales clientes ha hecho que se haga conocida por la zona y, poco a poco, ha instalado un pequeño establecimiento donde ofrece exclusivamente cosméticos. Rocío se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la ampliación de su negocio.

Rocío es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, sus vecinos la consideran una madre de familia ejemplar. Su más grande anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rocío, 35, lives with her husband and their two children in the Ucupe sector of the Lagunas district. It is located a half hour from the city of Chiclayo. She has been selling beauty products since she was 20. She started offering her products by catalog. Currently, this activity helps pay the household expenses. Her husband’s income as an agricultural work is not sufficient to support the family. The time that she has spent offering her products to her regular customers has made her well known in the area. Little by little, she has set up a small establishment where she sells cosmetics exclusively. For the first time, Rocío is asking Edpyme Alternativea for a loan for 1,000 PEN to use to expand her business. Rocío is a hard-working and enterprising woman. Her neighbors consider her to be an exemplary mother. Her greatest goal is to keep growing as a businesswoman and to get her children ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics to expand her business

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs. Chan L. is 46 years old and lives in Angk village, Kandal province. To earn a living, she and her husband (pictured on the left) are farmers. More specifically, they own 1.3 hectares, on which they cultivate rice. They have five children, two of whom are laborers in the local village, while the others are students at the local school. To improve and expand their farming operations, Mrs. Chan L. is seeking a loan in the amount of $500 to buy fertilizers, gasoline, and rice seeds.

loans.use: To improve and expand her business by purchasing additional fertilizers, gasoline, and rice seeds

loans.name: Peace And Unity Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the Peace and Unity group. They are small scale business people based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Cecilia S. Kpukumu. Cecilia is age 45 and she was born in Makeni. She is married with 4 children. Her husband is a professional worker and her children attend school. For 15 years now, Cecillia has sold market food, such as groundnuts/peanuts, maggie (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, tomatoes, vegetable oil, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), sugar, etc. With this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy ground-nuts, maggie, salt, tomatoes, vegetable oil, palm-oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Olufunke

texts.en: The plank business is very lucrative in Nigeria. Olufunke is very happy in this plank business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to expand the business. She has a good relationship with LAPO. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She hopes for a loan of NGN 60,000 to purchase more planks to sell. She is 60 years old and she is a widow with four children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Mr. Sophat H. has been a wooden house builder for almost three years. He operates the business in other provinces far away from his house. Sophat is requesting his first loan of $600 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting. 

Sophat, age 38, and his wife, Mrs. Savun Yeun, 38, have been married since 1995 and have five children: four sons and one daughter. One of the children is in high school, two others are in primary school and another one stays at home. Mrs. Savun Yeun has been selling groceries for almost ten years. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Sophat is not in the photo; his wife was available instead.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for commuting

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.ru: Якубов Рахматулло проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 54 года. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Образование средне- специальное "Фермер". Кроме того занимается животноводством. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. В этой области более 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа скота, чтобы увеличить их количества.
texts.en:
Rahmatullo Y. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 54 years old, married and has 2 children. He has a secondary-specialized education as a farmer. Besides this, he is involved in animal husbandry. Rahmatullo primarily fattens and sells livestock. He has been in this field for over 10 years. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of livestock in order to increase its quantity.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Dieu Vivant Plus Group

texts.en:
Jules P. is the manager of the group “Dieu Vivant Plus,” which means “Living God” in French. The group is made up of 28 members, firmly united to receive loans through the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

Jules is 47 years old and a father of seven children whose ages vary between 3 and 15. He also cares for a brother-in-law. Jules sells beverages to the west of Kinshasa. He has been in business since 2005. Jules joined one of HOPE’s groups (a DRCongo microfinance program) in 2009 and received 5 loans, all of which he has paid back regularly. He has worked hard to develop his business. With the high demand of his clients, Jules intends to use this next loan to buy 10 crates of drinks for resale at a profit, as well as some goods in bulk for his general store to increase his income. He hopes to generate more profit to support his family. Currently, his business generates $90 in profit per week. Jules’s ambition is to open a beverage facility and deliver beverages in his area.

loans.use: purchasing 10 crates of drinks and goods in bulk

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 37 years old and married with two children who are in school. He runs a cereals store where he sells different kinds of cereals to earn a living. He has been in the business for six years and has one employee. David also rents his residential houses so as to earn enough money to support his family and pay school fees for his children.

David has been saving his money with his group in Faulu Kenya which enables him to access loans because the group guarantees them. He had previously taken out a loan of Kes 40,000 from Faulu Kenya which he used to expand his business and which he successfully repaid.

David hopes to grow his business into a wholesale operation and improve his living standards in the future. He has requested a loan of Kes 80,000 from Faulu Kenya to add to his stock of cereals, to buy a sieving machine and to pay for a license for his business.

loans.use: To add to his stock of cereals, to buy a sieving machine, and pay for a license for his business

loans.name: Moises Elias

texts.es: El Sr. Moises, tiene la actividad económica de atencion de cabinas telefonicas ofreciendo el servicio de llamadas locales e internacionales, tambien vende refrescos y dulces en  la tienda que tienen, este actividad la realiza juntamente con su esposa, ellos son una pareja joven tienen un hijo de un año, ahora  se les presento la oportunidad de adquirir un puesto de venta de dulces y refrescos (kiosko) en una avenida cercana de nuestra ciudad, son una pareja que tiene muchas ganas de triunfar y muy emprendedora  este es su primer credito bajo este programa, con el dinero del credito compraran el puesto de venta y asi poder mejorar sus ingresos economicos, estan muy agradecidos con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Moises' work is attending to telephone booths offering the services of local and international calls. He also sells refreshments and sweets in the store that they have. He performs this work alongside his wife. They are a couple and have a one-year old son. Now they have been presented with the opportunity to acquire a refreshment and sweet stand (kiosk) on a main road near our city. They are a couple who have a great desire to get ahead and are very entrepreneurial. This is their first loan under this program. With the money from the loan, they will buy the stand and in this way be able to improve their income. They are very thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust provided through the granting of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a stand/kiosk.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Hakimjon

texts.en:
Hakimjon is a responsible father and a loving son. Since he was very young, he has made a living doing the honorable work of raising livestock, work which he learned from his parents and which gives him great satisfaction. Thanks to his skill and hard work, his business is doing well and he would like to expand it by buying more cattle to raise, and more feed for them to eat. Hakimjon believes this will allow him to expand his business and earn a higher price for his livestock.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To expand his cattle-raising business

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman has been working as a farmer for the past 20 years. He's a 40 year old married man from Lebanon. He cultivates his land growing cherries, apples, prunes and peaches.

Today Ayman is requesting to borrow US $2,000 to purchase a beehive to raise bees. He hopes that his loan will allow him to improve and enlarge his work.

loans.use: To purchase beehive to raise bees.

loans.name: Mujeres De Esperanza 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Julia plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying secondhand clothing bags and selling them by the piece. She has had her business for around three years. She makes her home in a simple structure with her three children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to provide her family support and unity after getting divorced. At present, she enjoys being with her children and cook.

Julia is the coordinator of her group Mujeres de Esperanza 1 & 2 ("Women of Hope"). She is excited to be taking out her first loan. She will use her profits to buy things they need as a family and she dreams of having a beauty salon and a good house.

This associate began with Esperanza because she likes the program: it is the first time loans like those offered by Esperanza have reached her community, and her friends are also involved in her loan group, which helps people with their business initiatives. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominates the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy secondhand clothing bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy three heifers.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala West region of Uganda.  She is single and has one child, who is not yet in school.  Prossy runs a hotel, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more stocks of food, such as rice and beans, for the hotel's use.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Prossy hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food.  In the future, Prossy hopes to go back to school. Prossy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by learning how to play new games and sharing experience. 


Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more food for her hotel

loans.name: Mirgasim

texts.en: Mirgasim A. is 59 years old. He is married and has five children. After getting married, he arduously dedicated himself to farming. When he recognized the need to invest in his work, Mirgasim decided to raise seasonal fruits and vegetables. He sells his products in the local bazaar, earning an income of about $375 to $500 a month. He started his business in 1985 but he applied for his first loan in 2008. He repaid his first loan from KIVA successfully. He also keeps a shop of spare parts for cars, but his main business is farming because his products are in very high demand. He has applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN. With the loan, Mirgasim will purchase seeds and fertilizer for improving his land and his crops.

loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Chann Oun

texts.en: Mrs. Chann Oun K. is a 26-year-old villager in Mea Neak village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Rom Meas, are farmers who own a 2.80 hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Mr. Rom Meas is also a fisherman and a farming laborer. Mrs. Chann Oun K.'s problem is that it is time to grow rice but she does not have enough rice seed. To improve production, she is seeking a loan to buy rice seed. With the rest of the loan, she will buy fertilizer, pesticide and rent a plow for her field. She is the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Mrs. Chann Oun K. is shown in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: To buy rice seed

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
Evelina D., 57, is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Elpidio D., a taxi driver, and is the mother of a school-aged child. By the grace of God, Evelina has managed to support her child's schooling. Now, she is working hard to be able to send her child all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Evelina as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave their children.

Evelina oversees their tricycle operation and maintains a frozen food business. Customers order frozen cuts of meat like pork, poultry and beef. She also offers spiced native delicacies like sweetened pork, native sausages and other similar products. She pays cash to buy these items and adds a few pesos to the selling price to earn a profit, then sells them with payment due after one week's credit.
 
To help her continue operating her business, Evelina is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders of frozen cuts of meat for her customers and to buy materials to improve their tricycle unit. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Evelina dreams of being able to give her child a good high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy frozen meat for her customers' orders and other materials to improve her tricycle unit

loans.name: Nazario

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Izcuchaca, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.


El socio es el Sr. Nazario; el tiene 57 años de edad y es casado y tiene 7 hijos; el socio trabaja manejando una combi haciendo servicio público hacia la ciudad de cusco y también se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de madera, el tiene un pequeño puesto para que venda la madera, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de compra y venta de madera. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar madera al por mayor.


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nazario, 57, is a member of the “SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONE” communal bank located in Izcuchaca district, Anta province, Cusco department.

He is married and has 7 children.  He drives a “combi” (minivan used in public transportation) providing public transportation in Cusco and is also a lumber retailer; he has a small stand where he sells lumber.  He wants to expand his business buying more lumber and needs the loan to buy it at wholesale.

He uses this forum to thank all those who share his dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy lumber at wholesale.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina C. is from the village of Villa M Tejero, Liloy, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 37 years old. Regina is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $190 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Regina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Regina is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Liloy-Villa M Tejero, Liloy Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married and has a 10-year-old son. She runs a retail business selling cosmetics and perfumes. Her business is located in a department store where she rents space. She has been in this business for ten years. 

She is an honest, disciplined and entrepreneurial person. Her good location and many repeat customers help her to succeed in this business. 

Irina would like to borrow 8,000 UAH to increase the assortment of her inventory. She hopes to receive additional income and develop her business further.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventories

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a widowed woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that  has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a vegetable stall, selling bananas, tomatoes, maize and green vegetables. In addition she sells paraffin and also buys and sells goats which contribute to her other source of income. Eunice faces a major challenge of transportation and seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business. With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of bananas, tomatoes and green vegetables.

loans.use: To  purchase bundles of bananas, tomatoes and green vegetables.

loans.name: Monico

texts.en:
Monico C., from the village of Cabusera 27, Ilagan, Isabela, is 52 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Monico has been planting and harvesting corn for sale for over 30 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Monico joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting his first loan of 27000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to grow, he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his enterprise.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to grow

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Hem S., 41, is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike with a trailer attached, which his wife will use for selling meatballs. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. S. is a police officer, earning an income of USD 5 per day. S. is married and resides with his wife and a child in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, the most populated city in the country. The family has to spend USD 70 on food, USD 10 on electricity, and USD 20 on other necessary expenses every month. This is S.'s first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike with a trailer attached.

location.town: Mean Chey District, Phnom Penh City

loans.name: Faysal

texts.ar:
