فيصل في عمر 50 سنة يعمل في محل لبيع المواد الغذائية له في عمله 18 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يحب عائلته وهي كل اهتمامه
له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة يريد ان يحسن وضع عائلته وتعليم اولاده يجد صعوبة في راس المال فقط لتطوير مصلحته يحلم في 
امتلاك عمل خاص به وانشاء سوبر ماركت كبيرة حتى تصبح مقصدا لزبائنه الذين هم من جيرانه واقاربه يريد من خلال طلب
قرض من المجموعة الى شراء مواد غذائية واضافتها الى البضائع الموجودة حتى يزيد من رأس ماله وتكبير مصلحته
texts.en: FaysA., 50, is married with three children. He has been working in selling grocery items for 18 years. He loves his family who enjoy his full care and support. FaysA. has a good credit history with A. Majmoua. He wishes to improve his family conditions and educate his children well. FaysA. works at a grocery but lacks the capitA. necessary for developing his business. He looks forward to owning a bigger grocery store. His clients are his neighbors and relatives. He wants to get a loan from A. Majmoua to buy new inventory items to increase his stock and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more grocery inventory  to expand business

loans.name: Juvidita

texts.en:
Juvidita T. is 44 years old and lives in Nauring, Pandan, Antique, Philippines. She is married to Rey T. and they have four children. Their oldest child, John Rey, is 18 years old while their youngest, Karl Anthony, is four. They are all still in school. She makes a living by raising livestock, while her husband works as a fisherman. Since all of their children are still in school, they must work hard to meet their daily expenses. 

Juvidita has been an active member of ASHI Antique North West Branch since 2005. She is a model member, and is widely respected for her hard work and many dreams. She has recently finished paying back her last loan, and is applying for a new one for PHP 20,000 to expand her livestock business. 

She dreams that through hard work and her membership in ASHI, all of her children will complete their studies and get good jobs. She also hopes to earn enough money to renovate her house and make her family more financially stable.

loans.use: To expand a small livestock business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
50-year-old Susan is from the town of Banga. She is married and has 4 children. Susan owns & operates an agricultural business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. She also runs a sari-sari (variety) store.

Susan joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Susan is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to support her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers

loans.name: Tetevi Senouwogbe

texts.fr: Monsieur  Tetevi  est  marié   avec  2 enfants  à charge.   Il  habite quartier   Adakpamé.   Pour faire  face  aux  besoins de ses  enfants, il  fait  la vente  des pneus.  Il a débuté  en  1994   et  s’approvisionne  au  port  Autonome  de  Lomé.   Il demande  un prêt  pour acheter  de nouveaux lots de pneus.
texts.en:
Mr. Tetevi is married with 2 dependent children. He lives in the Adakpamé neighborhood. 
To meet his children's needs, he sells tires. He started in 1994 and obtains his supplies at the Lomé Autonomous Port. He is requesting this loan to buy more batches of tires.

loans.use: To buy tires

loans.name: Zynash

texts.en:
Zynash A. is 56, widowed and has seven grown children. She is also trustee of her niece who is disabled. Zynash has a higher technical education and worked for a long time as an accountant. In order to find an additional means of subsistence for her family, Zynash started her business in cattle breeding. With initial capital of 40,000 KGS, she managed to earn about 6,000 KGS a month. With the revenues, Zynash was able to give a good education to her children. 

Zynash has applied for a loan of 110,000 KGS to broaden her business by purchasing more cattle. It will allow her to raise her sales of milk and meat products. In the future,  Zynash plans to build a huge barn in order to provide a good conditions of cattle maintenance. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en: Manuel lives in the town of Banga, South Cotabato, where he makes a living as a rice farmer. He is married and has seven children, the oldest of which is 33. He has been a farmer for more than 30 years and works very hard because he is his family's sole source of income. He has applied for this loan to increase his farm's output by buying more fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Djromahuton12 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DJROMAHUTON12 est formé de sept personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier à Porto-Novo (capitale administrative du Bénin). La représentante de ce groupe, nommée josephine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. josephine est mariée à un pêcheur du nom de David. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à leur charge. josephine habite le quartier Houinta à Porto-Novo depuis sa naissance, où elle vit avec sa famille. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Il y a une dizaine d'année que josephine mène comme activité la vente d'"akassa" (aliment local fait à base d'amidon de maïs)à son domicile. De façon secondaire, josephine vend des crabes qu'elle achète au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo. josephine a déjà obtenu une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé et a bien effectué le remboursement. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, josephine désire obtenir un autre financement. Plus tard, josephine ambitionne acquérir une parcelle et y intégrer avec ses enfants.
texts.en:
The DJROMAHUTON12 group consists of seven people who all live in the same neighborhood in Porto-Novo (administrative capital of Benin). The group’s representative is Josephine, seen in the photo with her hand raised. Josephine is married to David, a fisherman. The couple has six children, three of them still in their care. All have attended school. Josephine has lived in the district of Houinta, in Porto-Novo, all of her life, and this is where the family now resides. The couple handle together the various family responsibilities. 

For the past 10 years or so, Josephine has been selling "akassa" (a local food made from corn starch) from her home. She also sells crabs that she buys at the Ouando market in Porto-Novo. 

Josephine has previously obtained one loan from ALIDé, and has repaid it in full. In order to strengthen her business and better meet customer demand, she is seeking another loan. She hopes someday to buy a plot of land to live there with her children.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn and baskets of crab

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie works as a farmer in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato, Philippines. She grows rice crops to sell. Merlie is a hard-working mother. She wants to help her husband provide for the family. She put up a sari-sari (variety) store to help with their daily needs.  She sells items like canned goods, shampoo and chips.

Merlie's loan will be used to purchase farm fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Merlie hopes for her children to be successful.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizers and other supplies.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita D. 58 años D. edad, tiene casa propia, en la cual vive con unos familiares, tiene servicios D. agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito D. Jayanca a unos 30 minutos del departamento D. Lambayeque.  Esta zona  se caracteriza por tener una mucha actividad agricola, ganadera, artesanía y turismo .

Felicita ha acondicionado en una parte D. su sala D. su casa un espacio para poner su negocio donD.  venD. toda clase D. productos para uso personal (ropa para todas las edades y calzado ), tiene su propia clientela que le hace pedidos.  La venta D. sus productos incermenta sus  ingresos lo que le permite solventar sus gastos y necesidades.

A solicitado Felicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2500 nuevos soles para surtir su negocio con mercadería novedosa tanto en ropa como en otros productos, ya que en esta zona son pocas las personas  que se dedican a este rubro, lo que le permite tener exito en su negocio y cada vez cresca más. Con los ingresos D. la venta D. todos sus productos cubriría las cuotas del crédito brindado y mejoraría su calidad D. vida.

Felicita es una persona muy conocida por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y siempre con ganas D. ayudar a las con las que vive.
texts.en:
Felicita is 58 years old and owns her own home where she lives with some family members.  Her home has piped water and electricity and is located in Jayanca district, some 30 minutes from Lambayeque department.  This area is noted for having its farming, livestock raising, handicrafts and tourism.  

Felicita has adapted a space in part of her living room in order to set up her business where she sells all kinds of personal use products (clothes for all ages and footwear).  She has customers who place orders with her.  The sale of her products increases her income which allows her to cover her expenses and needs.

Felicita has requested a loan for 2,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to stock her business with the latest merchandise (both clothes and other products).  There are few people in her area who work in this line of business which allows her to be successful and her business continues to grow.  With the profits that she makes from selling all her products, Felicita will cover her loan repayments and also improve her quality of life.

Felicita is very well known as a hard-working, responsible woman who always wants to help the people she lives with.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn  is from the village of Katipa, Lopez Jaena. She is 51 years old. Merilyn is married and has four adult children. 

To make a living, Merilyn owns and operates a general store. Merilyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Merilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Merilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. 

Merilyn is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more products such as canned and dry goods. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Merilyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as can goods, dry goods, and home chores need

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has been operating a taxi business in the town of Naivasha for the last three years. He is 33 years old and married to Irene. They have two children. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by his friend who is also a KADET client; this will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) well and in good time. He plans to use this loan for servicing his motorbike and also to start a poultry rearing project. 

In the future, James hopes to own a Nissan Matatu (a van).

loans.use: to service his motorbike and to start a poultry rearing project.

loans.name: Neneh

texts.en:
Neneh is 41 years old and married with five children between 6 months and 18 years old. She runs a provisions store in Goderich near Freetown.

Neneh has been in this business for 20 years and sells milk, soft drink, Ovaltine, toiletries and sugar at her store. Her business is the only source of income she has. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more provisions. Neneh says that the extra income from this loan will help her life improve with the profit she will make.  In the future, she would like to expand her business more.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks and toiletries

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional materials for her fishing/fish vending business.

Justina has been in this business for 20 years. She earns additional income from her sari-sari (variety) store.

Justina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to build and expand her business so she could secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Carmenza

texts.es:
Llegar a tener su propio almacén ubicado en un sector comercial de la ciudad de Medellín  es el sueño de Carmenza quien desde hace algún tiempo empezó a vender mercancía en su casa. Pulseras, aretes y diferentes accesorios así como artículos por catálogo forman parte de la oferta de productos que esta emprendedora le ofrece a sus familiares, vecinos, amigos y conocidos quienes se han convertido en sus clientes. 

Actualmente esta mujer emprendedora necesita de un préstamo para comprar perfumería y ropa lo que complementará su oferta de mercancía y así mejorará sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Owning her own warehouse in the commercial district of Medellín is Carmenza's dream. Some time ago she started selling goods from her home. Bracelets, earrings and various accessories, as well as catalog items, are part of the product offering that this entrepreneur sells to  family members, neighbors, friends and acquaintances who have become her clients. 

Currently, this enterprising woman needs a loan to buy perfume and clothing which will complement her range of merchandise and thus increase her income.

loans.use: to buy perfume and clothing.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot is from the village of Shaumiani, East Georgia. He is 41 years old and lives with his wife Tegmine and mother. The source of the income for the family is fruit growing. Ashot is leading this business. He works hard during the year in the garden. Ashot uses his old car for transportation of the harvested fruits. He takes them to nearby villages and towns and sells them from the car. 

The total average monthly income of the family is 690 Laris, including Ashot’s mother's pension. 

Ashot requested a loan to fix his car, which is out of order at the moment. He will repair it in a week and continue selling the fruits.

loans.use: to fix the car to transport harvested fruits

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna, aged 34, has been managing a business that provides motorcycle services for more than four years. She started earning her livelihood in this manner once her children were grown. Her children are now older and more responsible.

This loan will be used to buy tires, upholstery for the seats, as well as to pay for a few repairs. Myrna knows that there is plenty of competition, so she provides the best service to her customers so that they remain satisfied. Her dream is to obtain another vehicle for generating additional household income.

loans.use: to buy tires and upholstery for the seats of her tricycle

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 54 años de edad, es casada y es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, ella se dedica a vender ropa para dama y niños como pantalones de mezclilla, chamarras de imitación de piel, trajes de pants etc. doña Mari como de cariño le dicen sus conocidos tiene aproximadamente con su negocio 6 años y dice que emprendió ese negocio para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que no era suficiente con lo que el ganaba y es por eso que ella decidió vender ropa, ella surte en la ciudad de México y en la cuidad de Moroleón Guanajuato ya que en esas ciudades le dan buenos precios de la ropa con la cual le puede obtener ganancias a la hora de venderlas. María comprara ropa interior de niños ya que muy pronto entraran a la escuela y es cuando mas le compran playeras, camisas blancas, calcetas, calcetines las cuales las vende a sus vecinos y conocidos. La meta que tiene María es mas adelante poner un puesto de ropa en su casa ya que es muy pesado este trabajo por que tiene que traer en bolsas cargando toda la ropa que es muy pesada. Doña Mari esta muy contenta ya que tendra gran variedad de ropa gracias a l préstamo que le harán.
texts.en:
María is 54 years old.  She’s married and is a very responsible, hardworking woman.  She sells women’s and children’s clothing like denim pants, imitation leather jackets, sportswear, etc.  Mari, as she’s affectionately called by those who know her, has had the business for about six years and says she started it to help her husband meet household expenses because what he earned wasn’t enough.  That’s why she decided to go into clothing sales.  

She stocks up in Mexico City and in Moroleón, Guanajuato because she gets good prices in those cities that allow her to earn profits when she resells them.  María will buy children’s underwear because they are soon to return to school and that’s when they buy more t-shirts, white shirts, socks and stockings that she sells to her neighbors and acquaintances.  

María’s goal is to later on set up a clothing stand at home because what’s hard work in this business is having to lug the bags of clothes around because they are very heavy.  Mari is very happy because thanks to the loan she’ll get she will have a great variety of clothes available.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Lazara

texts.es:
La señora Lazara tiene la edad de 45 años , estudio la primaria y se encuentra soltera, tiene un hijo que asiste  a la preparatoria. Ella y su hijo viven en zona que se caracteriza por ser cañera ya que alli se encuentra un ingenio productor de azucar.

Ella nos dice que siempre ha trabajado ya para sacar adelante a su familia ella siempre ha trabajado como comerciente inicio vendiendo topper con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad pero hace un par de años vende ricos tacos de visted y longaniza, ella realiza sus ventas  los fines de semana (viernes, sabados y domingos)  en un pequeño corredor que tiene en su casa. Doña Lazara nos dice que Gracias a Dios se vende muy bien y que ademas la comida siempre se vende.

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de carne, tortillas, cebolla, servilletas, variendad de chiles y refrescos para la preparacion de sus alimentos.

Ella espera que con este creditos sus ganancias aumenten y asi ofrecerle una profesion a su hijo.
texts.en:
Lazara, age 45, has an elementary school education.  She is single, and she has a son who goes to high school.  She and her son live in an area that is known for its sugarcane.  That is where you can find the sugar mill. 

She tells us that she has always worked to get her family ahead, and she has always worked as a merchant.  She started selling Tupperware with her friends and neighbors in the community.  She has been selling delicious beef and pork tacos for a couple of years.  She sells on the week-ends (Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays) in a small hallway that she has in her house.

Lazara tells us that, thanks to God, her sales are going very well, and the food always sells.

She needs this loan to buy meat, tortillas, onions, napkins, a variety of chilies, and soft drinks in order to make her food.  She hopes that with this loan her income will increase.  That way she can offer her son a profession.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the typical Mexican snacks that she sells.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Heang resides in Kampongcham province with a grandson. She sells groceries and earns 11 USD per day. Every month, Heang has to spend 83 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity, and 15 USD on her grandson’s school fee. She would like to request a loan of 500 USD to buy grocery goods to sell in her small store. She doesn’t want to change her career at all because she can make a good profit from it. Heang plans to extend her shop when she has enough money.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a 54-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 19 to 26 years. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a cereals business in which she sells beans, millet, sorghum, maize and peas. She has been involved in this business for 20 years and employs one staff member. Her business is located in a shopping center in Kisumu. She describes her biggest business challenge to be fire outbreaks. She will use the 70,000 Kenyan shillings loan to add stock of cereals. Her business goal is to become a wholesaler within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a renowned supplier of cereals in Kisumu.

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
Marwa, who is in his late 30s, is married with four children two of whom are independent and two are still at school. He has been running a stationary business for two years now.  He works from 8 a.m to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to sell telephone housing equipment and then started the stationary business.  He also took care of his family.  He has paid back all his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to buy items to replenish his stationary stock.  His dream is to one day be able to buy his own land.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Mshikamano" which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy items to replenish his stock.

loans.name: Martín Horacio

texts.es:
Martín es un luchador que desde hace 6 años se dedica a la distribución de refrescos en el municipio de Angostura del departamento de Antioquia, su mayor propósito desde que sus 3 hijos nacieron ha sido ofrecerles un mejor futuro, trabaja con empeño para prestar un buen servicio, acortar los tiempos de entrega y que las gaseosas, cervezas y agua en botella que distribuye lleguen en el mejor estado, es un emprendedor que sueña con ser reconocido en el sector, que su negocio progrese y que le genere mas ingresos para mejorar la difícil situación económica que enfrenta su familia.

Con la ilusión de que su negocio progrese Martín quiere comprar mercancía al por mayor para obtener mas utilidades, pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para hacer dichas compras, por lo que solicita un préstamo que invertirá en gaseosas, cervezas y agua en grandes cantidades, así generará más ingresos, las ventas mejorarán, su negocio logrará posicionarse y proporcionalmente su calidad de vida se verá beneficiada.
texts.en:
Martín is a fighter who has worked distributing beverages for six years in the city of Angostura in the department of Antioquia.  His main goal since his three children were born has been to give them a better future.  He works with dedication to give good service, cut the delivery time, and deliver the soda, beer, and bottled water in the best condition.

He is an enterprising man who dreams about being recognized in his sector.  He wants his business to progress and generate more income for him to improve the difficult economic situation that his family faces.  With the hope that his business might progress, Martín wants to buy merchandise wholesale to earn more profit.

Martín doesn't have the capital necessary to make these purchases, so he is requesting a loan to invest in soda, beer, and water in large quantities.

In this way he will generate more income, his sales will improve, his business will be able to position itself, and he will see his quality of life benefit proportionately.

loans.use: to buy soda, beer, and water wholesale for distribution

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry, age 31, owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. He has been five years in this business. Each month, he earns PhP 8,000 from his work. He and his wife have three children.
 
He has requested a loan of PhP 10,000 in order to purchase additional products to sell in his shop. Henry is been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Henry wants to expand their business and to support the education of his children.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in his shop

loans.name: Saveoun

texts.en:
Saveoun, 38, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Saveoun is a farmer, and her husband sells rice. 

Saveoun is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a horse and rice to resell. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a horse and rice to resell

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Katupyry  se formó con la unión D. varias vecinas D. la ciudad D. Mariano Roque Alonso.  Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, pero también hacen actividades en grupo, con lo cual pueden fortalecer su compañerismo. 
La Señora Blanca es una D. las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica a las ventas D. Ropas varias, venD. por la calle, es decir en forma ambulante, es una señora muy trabajadora y con muchas ganas D. salir adelante.  Nos comenta que tiene  4  hijos, quienes son su razón D. lucha. Se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad y las capacitaciones que recibe el grupo. 
La señora Blanca solicita el crédito para la compra D. más variedad D. Ropas, con lo cual podrá cumplir con la demanda D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Katupyry” Committee was formed by residents of the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.  Today all of its members run different businesses, but also do things as a group that helps strengthen their camaraderie.

Blanc is one of the members.  She sells different types of clothing in the street, that is to say, on foot.  She is a very hardworking lady with a great desire to get ahead, and tells us that she has four children who are the reason for her efforts.  She is very satisfied with the training she gets from this group.

She is asking for this loan to buy a greater variety of clothing so that she can meet her customer’s demands.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Mutie

texts.en:
Mutie lives in Likoni, a town on Kenya's southern coast. He is a supplier of farm produce such as oranges. He has run this business for thirty years, starting out by planting orange trees and waiting for the produce, which he has sold ever since.

Mutie is applying for a loan of KES 20,000 to pay for labor for pruning, harvesting, and transporting the produce to the market. The main business challenges he faces are seasonality and inflation. He aspires to export his produce in the future and to purchase a van to transport his crops to the local market. Mutie will use any extra income to purchase more orange trees.

loans.use: to pay for labor to prune, harvest, and transport produce.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of clothes needed in her business

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es: La señora Luz María a sus 48 años se encuentra casada y es madre de 5 hijos. Se dedica a la confección, actividad que realiza desde hace ya varios años en un pequeño espacio de su casa donde confecciona uniformes, vestidos, costuras a sus clientes, entre otros. Debido a que tiene bastantes pedidos, requiere de la compra de insumos que le hacen falta para poder cumplir a sus clientes que siempre la buscan por realizar su trabajo con tan alta calidad. Sueña con poder expandir su área de trabajo y que su negocio incremente sus ventas, para poder brindar a sus hijos la educación y bienes básicos que necesitan.
texts.en:
Luz María, 48 years old, is married and the mother of 5 children. She makes a living sewing, which she has done for several years in a small space in her house. She sews uniforms, dresses, seams for her clients, among other things. 

Due to the fact that she has numerous orders, she needs to buy necessary supplies to be able to satisfy her clients, who always choose her for her high quality work. She dreams of being able to extend her work space and that her business sales increase, in order to give her children the education and basic welfare they need.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Andrés Avelino Cáceres” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.

Francisca tiene 59 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos, ella nació en el distrito de Sicuani  de la provincia de Canchis departamento del Cusco pero vive en la hermosa ciudad de Calca. Su actividad económica principal de Francisca es la venta de chicha de jora de lunes a viernes, ella tiene una pequeña picantería en su domicilio y está abierto a los clientes a partir de las 10 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Francisca requiere el préstamo para comprar maíz para elaborar más jora.
texts.en:
The Andrés Avelino Cáceres communal bank is comprised of responsible and hard-working people who get their families ahead.  Most of the members live in Cusco, where they conduct their business activities.  Cusco is known for being a very touristy and commercial area as well as for its traditional “Inti Raymi” festival and also because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

Francisca, age 59, is married and has three children.  She was born in the Sicuani district in the Canchis province of the Cusco department.  However, she lives in the beautiful city of Calca.

Francisca’s main business activity is selling “chicha de jora” (a traditional, corn-based drink) on Mondays through Fridays.  She has a small snack shop in her home.  It is open to customers from ten in the morning until three in the afternoon.  She has had this business for four years, and it is going very well for her.

Francisca now needs the loan to buy corn in order to make more jora.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Jeramie

texts.en:
Jeramie is a 25-year-old married woman with two young children. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Jeramie is also engaged in fishing. She sells her husband's catch at the market. She also buys from other fishermen to have more fish to sell. Jeramie also buys crabs to sell. She works hard to support her family and save for her children's education.

Jeramie has requested this loan to buy fishing nets and more crabs to sell. In the future, Jeramie hopes to have better living conditions. She also hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and more crabs to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has six children with four of them currently in school. For the past year, John has been working hard to manage his small shop, which does produce in food. 

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food for produce, and will help John to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. John hopes that in the future he will be able to build rental houses. 

John is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like John who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more food for produce

loans.name: Felix Guillermo

texts.es: El señor Félix tiene 36 años, habita junto a sus padres, labora desde hace tres años para el gobierno como analista de recaudación, pero su sueldo no es suficiente para cubrir los diferentes gastos que se presentan, el ayuda sus padres ya que son de edad avanzada, los fines de semana hace venta de patio en su casa de habitación para poder apoyarse. Este es su primer crédito solicitado con AFODENIC para poder realizar una división en la sala de su casa ya que es de plycem y está muy viejo a punto de desmoronarse, aparentemente por la pintura disimula un poco la fachada, con el préstamo va a comprar materiales como 500 bloques, 30 bolsa de cemento, arena, 2 quintales de hierro, estribo y pagara la mano de obra, agradece el apoyo que le brinda la financiera para poder mejorar poco a poco sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Félix, 36, lives with his parents.  He has worked for the government as a tax analyst for three years, but his salary isn't enough to cover his various expenses.  He helps his parents because they're of an advanced age.  On the weekend he has patio sales at his house to be able to support himself.

This is his first loan from AFODENIC and it's for dividing the living room in his parents' house.  It's made of Plycem sheets and is very old and about to collapse, apparently because the paint hides the facade somewhat.

With the loan he's going to buy materials such as 500 concrete blocks, 30 bags of cement, sand, 2 quintals of rebar, and a brace, and to pay for labor.

He's grateful for the support from the finance company to be able to improve his living conditions little by little.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and to pay for labor

loans.name: Farhan

texts.en:
Farhan is a good boy, and he is a student in Pasundan 1 vocational high school. actually in Cianjur.
Before get loan from komida he always sad because some of his friend always bullying him. but after get loan from komida now, no one else can bullying him with the reason before pay school costs. so thank you komida and KIVA.

loans.use: To Pay for monthly costs

loans.name: Rispher

texts.en:
Rispher is a hardworking, enterprising and charismatic woman who likes to work on her small farm. She is happily married and has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her 4 children, she has been selling eggs and a variety of food crops from her farmland.she also does a side hustle business(tailoring)
The Sengera, Kenyenya area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, Rispher finds poultry farming very enjoyable. She stated that what she like best is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 35,000 KES to buy poultry. Being a smallholder woman farmer, she finds that accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. As a result of the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry sales to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children. Rispher is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family, and she looks forward to using her additional earnings to provide employment to members of her community (Kisii community) through her poultry farm. 

Help this hardworking woman smallholder farmer realize her dream!

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 45, married, and has 5 children. He is financially responsible for his aging parents. Ahmad's wife helps him in collecting the harvest and he has a small fattening project. He is requesting 6000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to increase his sales milk, cheese and butter.

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Esther would like to buy  feeds for her dairy cows

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Sister Joyce displays her items on a wooden table in front of her house. She requires a loan of $650 to rent a shop in the local market and buy more inventory for her shop. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and is familiar with the TEACH Lending program. She also knows how to keep records of transactions.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Shah Gah

texts.en: Shah Gah lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is in university and working part time. He has a cotton cart and is helping his family. He wants to increase his business to help his family more. He wants to take a group loan to buy new kinds of cotton clothing to enlarge his cart and make a good monthly income for his family. He is very happy that he can help himself and also his family. He would like to say that "loans change lives".

loans.use: To buy new  kinds of cotton clothing

loans.name: Doniyor

texts.en: Doniyor is an energetic young man. He has recently moved to Kanibadam and started to work at the market. He is 19, and he is married. His wife helps him to run their business selling men's clothes. Besides buying and selling in the market, Doniyor works at a labour exchange. These two activities are the main source of income for his family. Recently Doniyor received a loan from Microinvest and significantly expanded his business. Now he is planning to get a new loan for further expansion of his activities.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Suavale

texts.en: Suavale is 43 years old, with a family of three, and they run their plantation business with her husband. She sells taro and bananas at the market in Fugalei once a week on Fridays, and she makes a profit of $80, which helpsto take care of their family's needs, her child in school, and also for her repayment to pay back what she borrows from SPBD.

loans.use: To buy supplies and equipment

loans.name: Fidencia

texts.es:
Several families live together in our house, and between all of us we share one outhouse. The hygienic conditions of the bathroom are not very appropriate, so I would like to install a new bathroom for my family and thereby avoid infections. I am asking for $600 dollars in order to build a new bathroom for my house.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Vivimos varias familias y entre todas tenemos que compartir un baño de pozo, pero las condiciones higiénicas del baño no son muy apropiadas así es que me gustaría instalar un baño nuevo solo para mi familia y así evitar infecciones. Solicito $ 600.00 dlls para la construcción de un baño nuevo para mi vivienda..

loans.use: Bathroom Construction

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena is a woman, who despite the hardships she’d had to face, showed herself to be strong in the face of adversity. Despite her fortitude, it took all her strength and one thought…to not let her self break under the circumstances. Thanks to that thought, she was able to recuperate after not only an operation she had two years ago, but also being abandoned by her husband. Today she shows all women that, yes, it’s possible thanks to the promise she made to herself to get better and leave behind the bad times. She now has a vulcanizer and a motorized car, which generate her principal income. But, even so, she needs your support to start a small restaurant of home-style cooking, in her home. Let’s collaborate with her so she can make her dreams a reality.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

Elena, es una mujer que a pesar de las duras pruebas que tuvo que enfrentar siempre se mostró resistente frente a las adversidades, a pesar de su inmensa entereza salió de ellas con mucho esfuerzo con un solo pensamiento de no dejarse doblegar por las circunstancias y gracias a este pensamiento, también se viene recuperando de la operación que tuvo que realizarse hace dos años y del abandono de su pareja.Hoy demostró a todas las mujeres que si se puede y gracias al empeño que puso para recuperarse y dejar atrás estos malos momentos tiene un vulcanizadota y un motocarro los cuales generan y son su principal fuente de ingreso económico, aún así requiere de tu apoyo y solicita, ya que tiene el propósito de de implementar en casa un pequeño restaurante de comida típica.Colaboremos con su petición para que pronto pueda convertir en realidad sus anhelos.

loans.use: To start a small restaurant business in her home.

loans.name: Kamuli C1 (E) Group

texts.en: Betty is 32 years old. She is a caterer and owns a small restaurant. With the extra profits, she intends to expand her business by building a bigger restaurant.

loans.use: To stock her restaurant and catering business

loans.name: Elivira

texts.en:
Elivira N., age 35, owns a carpentry business, which she started 2 years ago. Working from 6 AM to 7 PM daily, she earns about $90 a month from this business.

Elivira has successfully taken out a previous loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more wood for her business. She now hopes for a loan for the same purpose. Elivira belongs to a loan group called Bondeni, whose members make sure that everyone pays back her loans.

loans.use: To buy more timber

loans.name: Ya

texts.en:
Mr. Ya LOEUM and his wife married in 2005 and have one little son. Their home is about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Ya has been a full-time employee of a company for eight years. His wife, Duch Thon, has been selling boiled corn for one year. She buys corn from farmers to boil for re-selling in the village school. Mr. Ya is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $1000 to use for repairing their house.

loans.use: repairing their house

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy A. is a 39 year old mother of 3 that hails from Okoko Lagos State, Nigeria. Joy sells drinks and foodstuffs and she has been in her business for the past 10 years. Joy has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 3 years and she now requests  a loan of $875 to enable her to buy more foodstuffs and drinks for sale. She thanks you

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and drinks for sale.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita A. sells rice and other food items. She is married and has 4 children. Business is doing very well, and  she wishes to increase sales. She is running out of stock.

She is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: As an additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.name: Mouhamadou Aliou

texts.fr:
Mr. D. is a poultry farmer who lives in the Cite Lamy neighborhood in Thies. He is married and has two children. His business consists of buying chicks that he raises for two months before selling them at the local market. His customers are primarily local restaurants.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

mr D. est un aviculteur qui vit au quartier CITE LAMY à THIES .il est marié et père de deux enfants .son activité consiste à acheter des poussins qu'il élève pendant deux mois avant de les revendre sur le marché local .sa clientèle de base est constituée des restaurants de la place .

loans.use: Poultry farming

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing C. is 35 years old and she is single. She lives in Benin City. She has been in this business of selling second hand clothes since 2003. She enjoys doing this business.  She hopes to expand her business. She needs the loan amount of $1, 050 to buy more second hand clothes for sales. She is a LAPO client. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more second hand clothes for sale

loans.name: Malis

texts.en:
Mrs. Malis Nhoun, 38, and her husband, Mr. Tina Sum, 35, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers north of Phnom Penh, were married in 1994 and have four children: one son and three daughters.
 
Malis has been selling grocery items for ten years, buying them from Prek Anchan Market for resale at her shop in front of the house, while Tina has been raising pigs for five years. He buys the piglets in the village to raise for sale to the slaughter house. Now Malis is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase additional piglets for her husband to raise.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for raising.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Open small mobile restaurant for school children

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 40 años. Desde hace seis años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. Su esposo es obrero, por lo que esta fuera de casa todo el día, además Victoria tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. 
Victoria, para mantener su negocio necesariamente tiene que vender sus productos a crédito, y eso le genera un vació de capital.
El último crédito que recibió lo invirtió en la compra de productos de belleza. 
Sin embargo, ella cuenta que necesita un capital para amortiguar el dinero de los productos que vende a crédito.
texts.en:
Victoria is 40 years old. For the past 6 years she has worked selling beauty products. Her husband is a laborer, and because of this is out of the house all day. Also, Victoria has two school-aged children. In order to maintain her business, Victoria has to sell her products on credit, and this generates a cash flow gap. The last loan that she received was invested in the purchase of beauty products. She realizes that she needs capital to invest the money in the products that she sells on credit.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cash for the products Victoria sells on credit

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca tiene 47 años, es viuda, vive con su hija Lizbeth de 20 años. Es una señora muy jovial y emprendedora, se dedica a la venta de chicharrones (plato a base de carne de cerdo) en su triciclo, negocio que realiza desde hace 25 años para poder mantener a su hija, la cual aún depende de ella económicamente. Doña Francisca es parte fundamental de la zona en la que vende sus ricos chicharrones, ya que si falta por un día, todos en la zona notan su ausencia, por el gran cariño que le tienen. A ella le gusta mucho trabajar de esta manera, ya que le permite conocer a nuevas personas y hacer nuevos amigos. Lo más difícil es tener que adquirir la carne de cerdo, ya que por los constantes incrementos en el precio, no le alcanza para cubrir el costo. Doña Francisca quiere brindarle a su hija lo mejor, para que pueda formar una familia y no quedarse sola al final de su vida. Con el dinero del préstamo comprara más carne de cerdo para cocinar más platillos y por ende aumentar su venta. En el futuro, a Doña Francisca le gustaría que su negocio rinda mayores ingresos económicos para no pasar apuros económicos.
texts.en:
Francisca is a 47-year-old widow who lives with her 20-year-old daughter named Lizbeth. She is a very jovial and enterprising woman who sells pork rinds on her urban delivery trike, which she has been doing for 25 years in order to support her dependent daughter. Ms. Francisca is an integral part of the region in which she sells her delicious pork rinds because if she is gone for one day, all the residents notice her absence due to the great affection they show her. She really loves to work this way because it allows her to meet new people and make new friends. The most difficult thing for her is having to purchase pork because it is not easy for her to cover the costs due to constantly increasing prices. Ms. Francisca wants to offer her daughter the best so that she can form her own family and not be alone at the end of her life. With this loan, she will purchase pork in order to make more meals and in so doing increase her sales. In the future, Ms. Francisca would like for her business to yield greater profits so that she will not have to experience financial troubles.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase greater quantities of pork to increase pork rind sales

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: Guillermina tiene 40 años, es conviviente, vive con su esposo y sus entenados (hijos de su esposo). Se dedica a la agricultura desde niña, hace 3 años se inició en la compra y venta de frutas en la ciudad, pero solo los días de feria, que son los domingos y jueves;  a ella le agrada mucha estar en contacto con la gente, pero por falta de tiempo y dinero le es imposible, porque su chacra necesita mucha dedicación, comenta. Guillermina empieza a cosechar desde marzo, recupera su dinero cuando el producto tiene buen precio, por ello que nunca dejaría de sembrar, aunque se dedique a otro negocio, lo difícil es la compra de fertilizantes para sus sembríos. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado comprará guano de corral para que puedan reaccionar sus sembríos ya que sin ellos morirán sus plantas.
texts.en:
Guillermina is 40 years old and lives with her husband and step-children (children of her husband). She has worked in agriculture since she was a child. Four years ago she started the purchase and sale of fruits in the city, but only on market sales which are Sundays and Thursdays. She likes to be in contact with people very much, but because of a lack of time and money it is imposible for her because her land needs a lot of dedication, she comments. Guillermina starts to harvest from March on and recuperates her money when the product has a good price, which is why she would never stop growing although she works on another business. The difficult thing is the purchase of fertilizers for her crops. This is her second loan with MFP. With the money she is requesting she will buy farm manure so that her crops react as without them her plants will die.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria K. sells food items like raw rice, fresh tomatoes, Gari, and others at Iture near Elmina. Victoria has received no formal education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Victoria has been selling food like raw rice, fresh tomatoes, Gari and other items since 1998. She is responsible for the family's food and other expenses. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more food for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest and expand her trade in food sales.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more food for resale.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort O. is 37 years old. She is married and has four children. All her kids are still in school. She owns and operates a grocery store, selling items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk and biscuits in her neighborhood at Nkawkaw. 

Comfort belongs to a village bank called ‘Rejoice’. She hopes to receive $400 to increase her inventory by purchasing more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits and other foodstuffs to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her profits to support her children in school. She believes with her five years experience she would be able to make good use of the loan.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products like cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar etc.

loans.name: Mamadou Moustapha

texts.fr: Agée de 33 ans il est marié et pére de 2 enfants .Pour gagner sa vie et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille il fait du commerce de detail de depuis plus de cinq (05) ans.Pour renforcer son activité il sollicite un pret .
texts.en:
He is 33 years old, married, and the father of two. To earn his living and provide for his family, he has been doing commerce at the retail level for over five years. He is requesting a loan for enhancing his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa es socia del Banco Comunal Capuli.
Elsa es soltera y tiene 27 años, Elsa tiene un restaurante llamado Don Augusto en un local alquilado, su negocio esta ubicado en una avenida concurrida, cuenta con 4 personas que le ayudan en la atención, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Elsa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Elsa son tener un local propio.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the Banco Comunal Capuli. Elsa is 27 years old and single. She has a restaurant called Don Augusto in a rented space. Her business is located on a busy street, and she has four employees to assist her in the restaurant, which is open every day. Elsa needs a loan of 1000 soles, which will be invested in purchasing rice and sugar. Elsa dreams of owning her own space for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Madali

texts.es: Madali tiene 22 años, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo en casa de sus padres. Desde hace 2 años tiene un restaurante, el cual está ubicado cerca de uno de los paraderos de 2 líneas de transporte, por lo que tiene mayor demanda de sus comidas durante el almuerzo, y es así que llega a cocinas hasta 50 menús por día. Esto es un gran aliciente, porque recibe las ganancias de su ardua y agotadora labor que consiste en ir todas las mañanas a comprar los ingredientes en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad, luego pelar, picar y cocinar, abrir su local y atender sirviendo los almuerzos, que afortunadamente su madre y su padre la ayudan, luego  viene la limpieza, tanto de los cubiertos como del local; de esa manera Madali garantiza el retorno de sus clientes, porque siempre está al pendiente de la higiene y buena sazón de sus comidas. Madali está pensando conseguir una ubicación más comercial para su restaurante como en el centro de la ciudad y ofrecer mayor variedad y cantidad de sus platos. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, su compromiso es tal, que asume la presidencia dentro de la organización interna de su banco comunal. El dinero que requiere es para adquirir unas vitrinas de exhibición porque va a implementar la venta de bebidas en su restaurante, además comprará cajas de gaseosas.
texts.en:
Madali is 22 years old and lives with her husband and small son in her parents' home. For the past 2 years, she has run a restaurant located close to the bus stop of 2 bus lines; this provides her with greater demand for her food during lunch where she generally serves about 50 people per day. This is a great incentive because she receives the earnings of her arduous, tiring work which consists of going to the city wholesale market every morning to purchase ingredients, then prepare, season, and cook, open the restaurant, and tend to the customers during lunch. Fortunately, her parents help her during the busy lunch hours. Afterwards, she has to do the cleaning. In this way, Madali guarantees that her customers return because she is always aware of the need to serve hygienic, flavorful food. Madali is thinking of getting a more commercial location for her restaurant nearer the city center and hopes to offer a greater variety and quantity of dishes. This is the first loan she has requested from Prisma Microfinance and her commitment is such that she has assumed the presidency of the internal organization of her village bank. The money she will receive will be used to purchase glass shelves so she can begin selling drinks in the restaurant; it will also be used to buy boxes of soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of glass shelves and soft drinks

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is requesting a loan of 14,500 PHP for the purchase of fertilizers for her corn production project. She believes that if this project does not fall victim to bad weather conditions, she will bring in a bountiful harvest as in the past.

Rosalie is a native of Tolon, Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte and married with 2 children. Her husband works as a bus driver and farmer. Aside from corn planting, she also sells fresh fruit and vegetables as a way of earning other income in case her husband can't work. She is on her 6th loan cycle and has maintained her MIGS (Member in Good Standing) status at the Coop by her repayment record and attendance.

She is planning to plant cassava and sweet potato after her corn crop in the near future. She works hard with her husband in hopes that she can send all her children to college and they can have decent homes.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her corn production project

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie A. has spent her whole life mostly on the farm. Her parents are farmers, and they taught her the whole process of how to farm. She is 53 years old, married and has six children. She doesn't want to just stay in the house. She wanted to contribute something for the family income.

She is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds. The loan will go a long way toward sustaining her farm business. She thinks that the loan will bring her good returns for her business.

CEVI is reaching out to more farmers to start and have their own livelihoods. It offers not just loans but also training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and rice seeds

loans.name: Mirdamat

texts.en:
Mirdamat Z. is 58 years old. He is married with four children. He owns a grocery store where he sells a variety of products like macaroni, cookies, soft drinks, juices, tea, and detergents. He started this business 12 years ago with a small inventory. Over time, he expanded his business and it has become very successful.

Today, Mirdamat is requesting a loan of $1200 US to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal of becoming a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children progress by means of their studies, which he does his best to provide for. We believe his perseverance and clear vision are key factors to the success of his small business.

loans.use: purchase more goods for his grocery store

loans.name: Omowumi

texts.en: Omowumi S. is 50 years old and married with two children. She sells second-hand rugs and foam. She is requesting the loan amount of 60,000 NGN to purchase more second-hand rugs to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand rugs to sell

loans.name: Ren

texts.en:
Ren C., 33, is married and lives with her four children in Batambong province. She sells vegetables and raises pigs and typically makes $3 each day but would like to increase her profits. Her husband is a farmer who also raises pigs.

The weather conditions have been difficult in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Ren C. included. She is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase fertilizer for the farm and to raise the pigs, increasing her current profits and prospects for the future.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Placida

texts.es:
Placida, se dedica a la elaboración de mantas polleras y centros para cholita. 
Es una mujer luchadora ya que con su actividad económica apoya en los gastos de alimentación de sus familia.
Vive en la Zona de Irpavi II de la Ciudad de La Paz en casa propia
Requiere el crédito para el capital de trabajo (compra de de tela Hilo y forro).
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la tercera vez que requiere el apoyo de kiva, su responsabilidad le dan la oportunidad de acceder a este crédito ya que es un cliente con calificación 1 es decir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas
texts.en:
Placida earns her living making traditional clothing such as shawls and skirts. She is very hardworking as she helps pay for her family’s food out of her earnings. She lives in her own home in the neighbourhood of Irpavi II in La Paz. She needs this loan to buy material, thread, and lining. This is her third loan with Kiva partner, Impro, and the responsibility she has shown in the past means that she has qualified to take on another loan. She always makes repayments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material, thread and lining to make traditional clothing

loans.name: Hikoyat

texts.ru: Хикоят Юнусова проживает в районе Гиссара. Возраст 45 лет. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Муж также помогает своей жене. Сама Хикоят по специальности "педагог" работала более 18 лет. Но вот как более 10 лет начала свой бизнеса. Она имеет торговую точку, на котором торгует коврами. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Hikoyat U. lives is the Gissar district. She is 45 years old, married and has 2 children. Her husband helps his wife as well. Hikoyat spent 18 years working as a teacher. However, she started her own business over 10 years ago. She has a retail store, where she sells rugs. She is requesting a loan to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Doña Francisca es cliente antigua, es su primer credito en forma individual, con respecto a su actitud de pago la señora hasta el momento no ha tenido problemas. La señora se dedica a la venta de frazadas, edredones y artiulos electricos a credito. La señora vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijo pequeño, la cliente invertira en la compra de frazadas, edredones y articulos varios por mayor.
texts.en:
Doña Francisca is a long-time client, but this is her first individual loan. So far, she has not had any problems making her payments.

Doña Francisca sells electric blankets, quilts, and electrical appliances on credit. She lives in her own home with her husband and young son. She will use her loan to buy electric blankets, quilts, and other items wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase electric blankets & quilts

loans.name: Mawuéna

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé où elle s’est spécialisée dans la restauration de fufu et de sauces de viandes de mouton. Elle vend également une pâte alimentaire dénommée « mankumé » très appréciée de la population. C’est pour avoir un nouveau stock pour continuer sa restauration qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES  pour acheter 08 sacs de maïs pour préparer « mankumé », 12 tas d’ignames pour préparer le fufu et 50kg de viande de mouton. Le reste du prêt servira à payer les frais de location du bar et couvrir certains de ses frais de transport.
texts.en:
This lady lives in the Adidogomé district in Lomé, where she became specialized in food service offering fufu and mutton sauces. She also sells a mash called mankumé which people appreciate very much. To obtain new supplies to continue her food service, she’s requesting a WAGES loan to buy 8 sacks of corn to make mankumé, 12 loads of yams to make fufu, and 50 kg of mutton. The rest of the loan will be used for covering the cost of leasing the bar and certain transport costs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, yams, and meat

loans.name: Darine

texts.en: Darine is a 27-year-old single woman living with her mother and sister. She has been working as a hairdresser since 2007 and has 6 years of experience in this field. Today, Darine is requesting to borrow US$ 1,000 to purchase tools in order to develop her work and augment her income.

loans.use: purchase tools

loans.name: Zussette

texts.en:
Zusette is 29 years old, single and has an auditory defect. but despite of this, she is still very diligent in managing her village store for almost ten years.  She plans to expand her business in order to earn more income and assist the daily needs of their family.  Aside from her store, she is also engaged in farming and hog raising business.  She is living a peaceful life together with her parents at Salay,Angadanan, Isabela, a rural and plain area.

Her weekly net income is PHP 800.00.  She wanted to make her business grow and she is now requesting to avail a loan of PHP9,000.00 to be used in her business expansion. Zusette said that there's a gradual improvement in her business, because she spent her money wisely.

loans.use: Additional Capital for her retailing business

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita E. is from the village of Purok 21, Valencia City. She is 45 years old. Lolita is married and has 11 adult children. To make a living, Lolita owns & operates a retail store selling vegetables and spices in the local market. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lolita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lolita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim H., age 40, is married and has three children. Two of her children are enrolled in the local high school. She resides in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, H. and her husband sell fried noodles. Together, they can earn an income of approximately US $24 per day . Mrs. Chheng and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, Chheng is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase supplies to expand her fried noodle business.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for their fried noodle business

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 30 years old. He sells drinks and fried meat. Patrick is hard-working and is seeking a loan to help him meet increased customer demand during the holidays.  One of his greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction he is able to have with her customers.

He is seeking a loan of N150,000 to purchase larger quantities of drinks at a discount.  Patrick plans to use the increased profit generated by the loan to support his family.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Carmen Ricarda

texts.es: La señora tiene una tienda de barrio en su domicilio, desde hace cinco años, sus clientes son generalmente de la zona, ella es muy trabajadora y la gente que la conoce le tienen mucha estima. La señora es viuda, tiene un hijo que depende directamente de ella, sus otros hijos ya son mayores y tienen sus propias familias. vive en casa propia. Es por segunda vez que tiene el credito con nuestra Institucion ha sido muy cumplida en sus pagos y por tal motivo se la volvio a dar el credito.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen has a grocery store in her home that she has been managing for the past five years. Her customers are generally from the area. She is a hard worker who is well-respected by the people who know her. Carmen is a widow with one child who is still dependent on her. Her other children are grown and have families and homes of their own. This is the second time she has requested a loan from our Institution. Since she has satisfied the repayments of the previous loan, she will be provided with another one.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of merchandise for her store

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora Alicia M. de 42 años, reside en  Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo, el cual se dedica a trabajar como comerciante. Ella posee una tienda de producto perecederos y de primera necesidad, la cual esta ubicada en una zona muy comercial, ya que esta cerda de una escuela en la cual hay una gran cantidad de estudiantes. Dora solicita un préstamo para poder comprar productos como golosinas, bebidas enlatadas, frijoles, azúcar y otros productos más. Esto debido a que en muchas ocasiones por no contar con ellos no logra aumenta sus ventas, y es así como a través de dicho préstamo ella espera contar con el capital necesario para obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Dora Alicia M. is 42 years old and lives in Ciudad Arce, in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband, who is dedicated to working as a salesman. She has a perishable and first needs products store that is located in a very commercial area, since it is close to a school with many students. Dora is requesting a loan to be able to purchase products such as snacks, canned drinks, beans, sugar, and many other products. This is because on most occasions, when she doesn't have these things, she can't increase her sales. This is why through this loan she expects to have the necessary capital to obtain larger revenues.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains and snacks.

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sin T. is 52 years old and she lives in Trapeang Tonle village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice for a living. She faces an obstacle with her business, so she is seeking a loan from AMK to buy fertilizer. Her husband, Mr. Phy Hoy (at right) helps her with the farming. 

Mrs. Sin T. has four children. One is employed by a small company and the others are students.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the rice field.

loans.name: Timap Bifo Group

texts.en:
These entrepreneurs have formed themselves into a group of 5, made Kadiatu S. (in the middle of the photo) their leader, and named their group 'Timap Bifo'. Now, they have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 each from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they can expand their businesses both in size and quality. Consequently, sales and profit-to-sales margin will also improve. In this way, their living standards will improve.

Their leader, Kadiatu, is now 29 years old. She was born in Kono, eastern Sierra Leone. She is married to a professional worker and they have 2 children, both of whom are in primary school. Kadiatu has been selling perfume and charcoal for 5 years now. With her share of the loan, she will buy more perfume and charcoal to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy more perfume and charcoal to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase goods in bulk.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: The plank business is very lucrative in Nigeria. Esther is very happy in this plank business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. Her greatest challenge in her business is funds and she hopes to overcome this challenge. She hopes to expand her business. She has a good relationship with LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization), which is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She hopes for a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more planks to sell. She is 52 years old and married with four children. Her husband also sells planks to support their home. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites S. is from the village of Magsaysay, Gingoog City. She is 30 years old. Marites is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Marites owns & operates a business making & selling specialty food products like tocino, longganiza and more in the local community. Marites has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marites joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marites from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Diarra

texts.fr: Diarra est une femme de 61 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants en charge. Depuis 2ans et demi elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DIANNAH-MALARY où elle a 5 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Elle est vendeuse d'huile de palme et de pain de singe. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de prendre en charge sa progéniture et d'assurer le payement de leur scolarité.
texts.en:
Diarra is a 61 year old wife and mother of 4 children for whom she is responsible. For two and a half years, she has been a member of Banc Villageois de DIANNAH-MALARY, where she has successfully borrowed and repaid 5 previous loans. She sells palm oil and monkey fruit from Baobab trees. Diarra's income enables her to support her children and pay their school fees.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen and promote her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Sadana

texts.en:
Sadana J. is currently in the business of selling beer and local brew from her home and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Sadana is 20 years old and is married to a policeman. She has one child and her child does not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Nimia Eliceth

texts.es:
la sra. Nimia Eliceth D. tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos que viven con ella en su casa,  uno de ellos ya trabaja y dos estudian. Nimia se dedica a la venta de abarroteria y venta de cosmeticos, tiene 10 años de realizar este tipo de actividad, a tenido que esforzarse mucho para sacar adelante su familia,  desde su infancia vive en la aldea el Caimito y ahí a logrado estableserse con su familia, 
Nimia se dedica a su trabajo con mucho esmero para poder salir adelante.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Nimia Eliceth Domínguez is 42 years old. She is a single mother and has three children who live with her in her house. One of them works and two study. Nimia sells groceries and cosmetics. She has been in this business for 10 years. She has had to work hard to help her family get ahead. She has lived her whole life in the small town of Caimito and she has been able to raise her family there. Nimia works with dedication in her job so that she can get ahead. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise to stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy batteries, corn flour and wheat flour, sugar, rice, coffee, cookies, bread, soups, tooth paste, cereal, pastas, sauces, toilet paper, soap, cooking oil, shortening, margarine, chilies, salt, condiments, oatmeal, threads, candles, matches

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Rukhsana Begum's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana begum lives in Multan, the city of tombs and saints’ places in Pakistan.

Rukhsana sells clothes which helps her to fulfill the basic needs of her family. Her husband sells vegetables on a four-wheeled cart. He puts the vegetables on his cart in the morning and goes to different areas of the community to sell and make an income.
