They both are very hardworking persons and do their work with effort and dedication. They have good working experience in their businesses.

Rukhsana begum has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband who wants to buy seasonal vegetables to sell. He will buy a greater variety of vegetables to put on his cart. Rukhsana is hopeful that this will increase her husband’s chances to make more income.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal vegetables for her husband's business

loans.name: Obenikina  2 Group

texts.fr:
OBENIKINA 2 est un regroupement de 10 femmes mariées du village de SAGINEKAN de l’ex Cercle de San, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali) qui  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 49 ans, 4 enfants et cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
MARIE D. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants, au grand marché de Kimparana. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Obenikina 2 is a group of ten married women from the village of Saginekan in the former San circle of Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families. On average, they are 49 and have four children, and they grow peanuts. Looking to make their farming more profitable, the members of the group decided to join the loan institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. After paying off previous loans, they are now asking for their third seasonal loan, Marie D. plans to use her loan to buy as many peanut seeds as she needs, plus small tools and fertilizer. at the big market in Kimparana. . After the rainy season, she warehouses her harvest long enough for its value to increase, before selling it at the big market in Kimparana. and other nearby markets, retail (or often wholesale) for cash to customers who mostly come from big towns. After their produce is sold, the members of the group hope to make a profit of 35,000 FCFA each to pay the interest on the loan and ongoing family expenses.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: By fertilizer, seeds and tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To carry out work and buy fertlizers

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita B. is from the village of Balanlinao. She is 41 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Anita owns and operates a fishing business harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Anita has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2005, Anita joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Anita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her eleventh from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn B. is from the village of San Jose, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 37 years old. Marlyn is married and has 3 very young children. To make a living, Marlyn owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling AVON products in the local community. Marlyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Marlyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Marlyn is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Marlyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Shirri

texts.en:
Shirri M. was born in 1970. She is single and God has blessed her with children. She shares three rooms with her children and other external family members. She lives in Musang mankon, a quarter in Bamenda in the Northwest Region of Cameroon.

She has encountered difficulties in life ranging from the inability to provide for her daily needs to the failure to attain quality education. She also reiterates how happy she was when she gave birth to a set of twins. 

With this loan, Shirri plans to invest in the business of buying and selling of foodstuffs like cocoa yams, yams, corn, potatoes and beans. She is convinced that the business will succeed because this is not her first time receiving a loan from GHAPE and investing in the same business, and also that the previous investment was successful. The loan will help her community because she will be able to provide general provisions in the form of food items. Her neighbors will not need to incur transportation costs to buy them elsewhere in distant places. 

With her income from the business she will be able to take care of her children’s education. She will plow back her profits into her business and use part to care for her family. She will use a fraction of the profit to upgrade her standard of living. She also wants to open a workshop for her son. 

She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives, the follow up, and also that GHAPE does not ask for collateral securities, and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan, and that payment is gradual.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: purchase general provisions to sell

loans.name: Larraine

texts.en:
Larraine B. is from the village of Brgy. Payawan, Lamut, Ifugao. She is 46 years old. Larraine is married and has three school-aged children. Larraine owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Larraine has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Larraine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Larraine is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Larraine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros M. is from the village of Marapong, Sibutad. She is 55 years old, married, and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, she produces rice to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-four years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Milagros joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Milagros is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for rice production. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for rice production

loans.name: Ana Judith

texts.es: Ana Judith tiene 29 años, pues su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general.  Ella es bien emprendedora y disfruta de tener este medio de vida para mantener a su hijo menor de edad. La mayoría de sus clientes siempre le están solicitando diferentes productos que son necesarios para su negocio, ella es una mujer muy responsable y disfruta mucho de interactuar con sus clientes. En la actualidad continua con este negocio. Este crédito es para la compra de productos como calzado, cosméticos, ropa, sabanas entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Ana Judith is 29 years old and has a general store.  She is very enterprising and enjoys having this means of supporting her young child.  Most of her customers always ask for different products that are necessary for her business.  She is a very responsible woman and enjoys interacting with her customers.  She is currently continuing this business.  This loan is for the purchase of products like shoes, cosmetics, clothing, sheets, and other things.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina G. is from the village of Kinangay Norte, in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Gina is widowed and has four school-age children. To make a living, Gina raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting bananas to sell. Gina has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Gina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Gina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Gina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more peppers, groundnuts and beans

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and two siblings. He has been working in butchery since 2007 and in a local restaurant starting in 2010 to earn an income. With his occupational income, he is able to help his father with the heavy life expenses. 

He works hard to earn a good income and to manage his time between his two jobs and his education.  Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay his university education fees. He is studying computer programming and accounting and his is preparing his Master's degree.

In the future, he is planning to start his career in a computer company to gain experience and be able to help his parents with his income. In the long term, he is planning to open a computer shop in his town.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Khon

texts.en:
The woman shown in the picture, Mrs. Khon K., is a 29-year-old farmer residing in the rural area of Kompong Tom Province. 

She feeds some pigs in a pigpen behind her house. Eventually, she will sell her pigs to a slaughterer in four-month cycles. 

Besides this work, she also has been planting a rice crop, which is her annual business. Her husband assists her in the farming business. 

Mrs. Khon K. is looking for a loan as capital to support her farming business. She will use the loan to buy a cow to plow the farmland for planting a dry-season rice field. Mrs. Khon K. has three children and all of them are young.

loans.use: To buy a cow to plow the farmland for doing a dry-season rice field.

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en: Dalia is a 32-year-old single woman from Bint Jbeil. She has been the owner of a religious dress shop since 2008 with 15 years of experience in this field. Dalia is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time in order to expand her business with new dress collections. Dalia’s quality of products is highly recommended by her clients, as she claims she sells the most requested type of cloth. She hopes to expand more and more until she opens her own factory and produces her own designs.

loans.use: To buy new collections

loans.name: Zokirjon

texts.en:
Zokirjon is a young married man. He lives in Isfara, Northern Tajikistan. Zokirjon sells car spare parts is his home. He runs this business together with his father. Zokirjon has been in this business for 10 years. Zokirjon is requesting a loan of 7500 Somoni to increase his working capital. Main characteristics of his business are consistency and stability. Zokirjon is hoping to keep his business running and efficient in the future. One of his short-term plans is to open vending location in his home town.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the spare parts for car in order to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Buhumuliro Bahereza Group

texts.en:
T. Monday is the leader of the Buhumuriro Bahereza group in Kyenjojo. He is 45 years old, married, and has 5 children, aged 20 to 10. 

Monday has a business selling produce such as maize, grains, beans, millet and matooke to transporters from Kampala and Mbarara. He is able to make 40,000 UGX in weekly profits.  He is happy that he can get some of his supplies from his own garden since he is also a farmer. 

Monday has been in this business for 8 years, after moving from a fish selling business in Matsyoro. His dream is to be able to have multiple businesses – one for each season, since most of the businesses are seasonal.

loans.use: To purchase grains

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma C. is from the town of Banga. She is 37 years old and married, with 3 children aged 9, 6 and 1. To make a living, Wilma plants and harvests rice for sale. One of Wilma's dreams is to be a successful entrepreneur.

Wilma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, to be used to purchase fertilizer and pay for services. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, the organization has numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pay for services

loans.name: Friends United Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Friends United” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 400,000 for each from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group is Kadiatu K.. Kadiatu is age 35; she was born in Magburaka town where she is currently residing, together with her husband and 3 children. Her husband is a carpenter and her children are attending primary school. Kadiatu sells biscuits, sardines, sugar, milk, toothpaste, soap, etc. She has been running this business for many years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy biscuits, sardines, sugar, milk, toothpaste, soap, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.en:
Bahrom is married and lives in Shahrituz, where he operates his own store, selling car spare parts. He has been in this business for 10 years now and because of his determination and customer-friendly attitude, his venture has been very successful. 

Bahrom currently needs a loan of 7000 Somoni to increase his turnover capital. He believes that this loan will help him re-supply his inventory and encourage more customers to come and shop in his store. Increased sales, in turn, will generate the necessary funds to sustain the business as well as help him meet his family’s needs.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for cars.

loans.name: Lumière Plus Group

texts.en:
Makita chairs a loan group called Lumière Plus, which is made up of 14 entrepreneurs who have joined hands to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC. Each member of this group is committed to develop and expand a small business. 

Makita has been in business for many years and today owns and runs a drugstore. She is 40 years old, married and has three children who range in age from 3 to 13. Her two older children are enrolled in school. Makita earns a profit of about $70 a week, and has done a very good job of using loans from IMF HOPE RDC to expand her business and increase her income. She plans to use her portion of this group loan to buy more medicine to sell to her customers. Makita’s dream is to someday open a clinic in the same area as her store, northeastern Kinshasa.

loans.use: to expand 14 small businesses

loans.name: Nabet Eufemio

texts.es: Nabet Eufemio tiene su actividad que es la venta de ropa y refrescos. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio, el es un hombre muy trabajador tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Inicio este medio de vida, con la ayuda de su esposa  quien le ayudo a establecer este medio de vida en su vivienda. Su sueño es construir dos cuarto, para lograr dejárselos a sus hijos. Este crédito que solicita es para la compra de pantalones, faldas, vestidos, trajes, shorts y algunas frutas para la elaboración de sus refrescos naturales. Mientras tanto Nabet continúa esforzándose todos los días por conseguir aumentar sus ingresos y trabajando con una buena rentabilidad.
texts.en: Nabet Eufemio has a business selling clothing and soft drinks. He has operated this business for more than 4 years. He is a very hard-working man, and he has 2 minor children in his care. He started this work with the help of his wife, who helped him establish the business in their home. His dream is to build two rooms so that he can give them to his children. The loan he is requesting is to buy pants, skirts, dresses, suits, and shorts, as well as some fruits to prepare his natural soft drinks. In the meantime, Nabet is continuing to work hard every day so that he can increase his income, and he is achieving good profitability.

loans.use: to buy pants, skirts, dresses, suits, and shorts to sell, as well as some fruits to prepare natural soft drinks

loans.name: Dashdorj

texts.en:
Mr.Dashdorj is 41 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  The two children both attend a local secondary school.  They live in house which they bought four years ago.  

Dashdorj used to be bus driver.  Then he left the job and started running a taxi business and done it for 5 years.  Last year he bought an excavator on a leasing contract from the bank and does different digging jobs on a call basis.  He receives plenty of calls from clients such as digging trenches for cables, pipes, house basements and so on.  The loan he is taking will be used to buy necessary spare parts for his excavator and to carry out some proper maintenance service.

loans.use: To buy necessary spare parts for his excavator and to carry out some proper maintenance service.

loans.name: Gerardo Manuel

texts.es:
Gerardo es un joven de 21 años de edad, trabajador y con muchos deseos de superación. Vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz en Chiclayo. Este distrito es una comunidad principalmente de comerciantes. José Leonardo Ortiz es una zona que está en constante desarrollo económico y social.

Gerardo se dedica, desde hace 3 años a brindar el servicio de mototaxi. La mototaxi es un servicio de transporte público muy común en el Perú, sobretodo en las pequeñas comunidades; consta de una moto con una cabina en la parte trasera  donde se pueden transportar pasajeros.

Gerardo cuenta con su propia moto para brindar este servicio. Él ya conoce a su clientela y los recorridos de estas. Es por eso que cuenta con una buena demanda lo que le permite tener ingresos para lograr independizarse de sus padres.

Gerardo solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que destinará en la reparación de rodajes de su moto y en darle un mantenimiento total a esta.  

Gerardo estará muy agradecido con este crédito pues le permitirá trabajar sin problemas y lograr su meta. Cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Gerardo is a young man of 21.  He is hard working and has a great desire to improve himself.  He lives together with his parents in José Leonardo Ortiz district, in Chiclayo.  This district is mainly a community of traders.  José Leonardo Ortiz is an area that is constantly developing both economically and socially.

Gerardo has been providing a motorcycle taxi service for three years.  Motorcycle taxis are a very common mode of public transport in Peru, especially in small communities.  They consist of a motorcycle with a cabin in back for transporting passengers.

Gerardo owns his own motorcycle, with which he provides this service.  He already knows his customers and their routes.  He has good demand for his services which allows him to make the income he needs to be independent from his parents.

Gerardo is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  He will use this money to repair the wheels of his motorcycle and to have general overall maintenance work carried out on it.

Gerardo is very grateful for this loan as it will allow him to continue working without problems and to achieve his goal.  He has good personal and work references.

loans.use: to repair his wheels and have maintenance work done on his motorcycle

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en: Davaasuren, 32, is married and lives with her husband and two sons, aged 6 and 9. The family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Both of her sons attend a local primary school. Davaasuren is a professional tailor. Davaasuren supports her family by operating her handmade kid’s shoes business with help from her husband. She sews kid’s shoes to sell them at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. When she first began her business in 2004, she sold her handmade shoes at a cheap price. Now her skill is high and her handmade shoes are quality and daedal (finely and skillfully made), so demand for her handmade shoes is high in Narantuul. She purchases her materials from Narantuul. Davaasuren is requesting a loan of 700,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase more shoe materials to make shoes before the Mongolian national celebration, called “Naadam,” because demand for this shoe rises during this celebration. Davaasuren wants to improve her business with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase more shoe materials to make kid's shoes.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
For the last 12 years David has been practicing farming in the Ngondi area, Naivasha town. He is 36 years old, married to Mary, and they have five school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his third loan. He repaid his previous loan of KES 45,000 in full and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizers, pesticides and cater for farm labour.

In the future, David aspires to buy a pick-up vehicle for transporting farm produce to the market.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and cater for farm labour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a generator and projector

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 30 years old.  She is married and has three children who are in school.

Ruth is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets and feeds.

Ruth has been raising pigs for 14 years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ruth would like to save enough money so that she could send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and feeds

loans.name: Yamileth

texts.es: Yamileth, tiene la edad de 32 años, está casada  y vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposo. Ella pretende con el crédito comprar terneros de cría. Ella  cuenta con el terreno apto para la explotación de ganado y lo que pretende es engordarlos para luego comerciarlos en el mercado local de la zona. Ella quiere las mejores ganancias con estos animales para así poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos y tener una mejor calidad de vida cada día más. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Yamileth is 32 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and two children.

Yamileth plans to use this loan to buy calves to raise.  She has a plot of land which is suitable for raising livestock and she plans to fatten the calves and then sell them in her local market.  She would like to make good profits from these animals so that she can help her husband with their expenses and keep improving their quality of life.

This is Yamileth's first loan from FUDECOSUR.  She hasn't received previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR offered her this loan with better repayment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy calves to raise

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maritza, está acompañada y tiene dos hijos de 6 años de edad y el otro de siete meses, ella tiene 5 años de dedicarse a la venta de tortillas, surgió por herencia de su madre, inicia el proceso desde las 4:00am a 11:00md.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de maíz y gas propano, esta compra es muy importante porque el maíz lo comprara por mayor, al igual que el gas, esto le permitirá tener suficiente material para la producción.
Su propósito con el préstamo es fortalecer el negocio  tratando de ofrecer un mejor servicio a los clientes, para generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Maritza has a partner and two children, 6 years old and seven months old.  She has been selling tortillas for 5 years.  She learned the business from her mother and she works from 4 am to 11 am.

She is requesting a loan to buy corn and propane gas.  This purchase is very important because she will buy the corn and the gas wholesale and this will allow her to have enough of the supplies for her production.

Her aim for the loan is to strengthen her business, trying to offer her customers the best service so she can have more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy corn and propane gas to make tortillas

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 61 years old and married with six children. 

Alicia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Alicia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for seven years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Alicia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Biviana

texts.es:
Biviana nació en la comunidad de Amaru de la ciudad de Pisaq (Cusco, Perú) y tiene 40 años de edad, ella es viuda y tiene tres hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la misma ciudad donde  nació y donde realiza sus actividades, ella tiene una pequeña tienda escolar en el colegio José Carlos Mariátegui, ella también se dedica  a la proveer materiales para la elaboración de artesanía como por ejemplo ocarinas y pitos de agua, ella despacha 2000 unidades a la ciudad de Lima y cada unidad lo vende a S/. 1. 20 nuevos soles. Ya son siete años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Biviana requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo arcilla. 

Banco Comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Pisaq de la provincia de Calca (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Biviana was born in the Amaru community in the city of Pisaq (Cusco, Perú).  She is 40, a widow and has three children.  She lives in the same city where she was born and runs her business, a small school supplies store, in the José Carlos Mariátequi School.  She also supplies materials for crafts such as ocarinas and pitos de agua (wind and water instruments).  She sends some 2,000 units to the city of Lima and sells them for 1.20 PEN each.  She has been in business for seven years and thanks to her hard work it is going very well.

Biviana is requesting a loan to buy materials such as clay.

The communal bank "Mosoq Ñusta" meets every month in the district of Pisaq in the Calca Province (Cusco, Perú).  Cusco is well known for its tourism, trade and traditional Inti Raymi festivities.  It is also features one of the Seven Wonders of the World: "Machupicchu".

loans.use: To buy materials such as clay.

loans.name: Adolfo Candido

texts.es:
Don Adolfo de oficio agricultor, casado, desde hace años trabaja en la siembra, ya que tiene su propia tierra, en donde ha trabajado con fondos propios, y para aumentar la siembra y poder obtener una buena producción. Comienza ah obtener sus financiamientos en Afodenic en donde tiene sembrado cultivo de maíz, cultivo de Guayaba y el cultivo de papaya, en donde ha sido apoyado por los japonés mediante el asesoramiento.

Adolfo se ha beneficiado gracias a estos préstamos, ya que son a plazos y ha logrado vender buenas producciones, logrando cubrir sus compromisos de pagos, como sus gastos personales.
Hoy con este préstamo comprara productos de semilla de trigo de millón, arará las tierras, así como abono, urea, para lograr un cultivo de calidad.
texts.en:
Don Adolfo, a farmer, has worked in agriculture for years. He has his own land where he has worked with his own funds to increase his planting and obtain a good harvest. He started getting loans from Afodenic and now cultivates corn, guava and papaya. He has been assisted by advisers from Japan.

Adolfo has benefited from the loans, since they are in installments. He has been able to sell good produce, covering his repayments and his personal costs.
Now with this loan, he will purchase wheat seed, aerate his lands, and purchase fertilizer and urea in order to achieve a quality crop.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer, and urea for producing wheat.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 46 years old, separated, and has four children.  She lives in the Philippines. Gina has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and  beverages . She has had this business for 26 years. She is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Gina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Gina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and  beverages.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is married to a soldier and has 3 children aged 6 to 10. She sells second hand women’s clothes which she buys in Uganda and sells in Rwanda. She has run this business for the last 2 years. She also has a car that she rents out for wedding ceremonies and other events. These two businesses have enabled her to care for her family and expand her business. 

She needs a loan to reinvest in her clothing business.  With the profits she will continue to expand her business and create a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Gloria Vilma

texts.es:
Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial, tiene 43 años y 2 hijos, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 15 años. 
Gloria tiene 5 hectáreas de tierra en Lagunilla, donde siembra verduras, en todo este tiempo pudo aprender muchas cosas que le ayudaron a mejorar su calidad de vida, tanto personal como en su negocio y en su familia, agradece por la confianza que le brindaron, la facilidad de los préstamos, el ahorro le ayuda a poder concluir la meta que se pone en cada cierre. Con el préstamo que va a recibir comprará abono y semillas, su deseo es poder tener un carro.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Manantial community bank.  She is 43 years old and has two children.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 15 years.

Gloria has 5 hectares of land in Lagunilla where she grows vegetables.  Over the years she has learned a lot which has helped her to improve her quality of life both from a personal point of view as well as from a business and family point of view.  She is grateful for the trust that has been placed in her, the ease of obtaining loans and the savings which help her to achieve the goal that she sets herself with each closing.  Gloria will use the loan that she receives to buy manure and seeds.  Her wish is to be able to own a car.

loans.use: to buy manure and seeds

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
El socio Emilio tiene 49 años de edad, el socio es conviviente, El socio tiene 2 hijos; el socio se sigue dedicando al trabajo como maestro de construccion,el construye casas,pinta casas entre otras obras,el socio trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar en su trabajo como maestro de construccion . El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales y herramientas para su trabajo.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Emilio is 49 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. He continues at his job as a master builder. Emilio builds and paints houses, and also does other jobs. He works from 5am to 6pm. Through this job, he is able to move his children forward. Emilio wants to expand and improve his construction business, so he is requesting a loan to buy materials and tools for his work.

He is grateful for the support that has been provided and promises to complete his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy materials and tools for his work.

loans.name: 020901-Hoằng Đông -Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Tuyết has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry food to sell.

Tuyết is 54 years old and she is married with five children.

She is the leader of a three-member group, the 01 Hoằng Đông solidarity group.
 
She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with five dependents.

In 2005, Tuyết joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tuyết has successfully repaid eight loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Tuyết has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tuyết hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more dry food to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman and lives in San Miguel Ramon with her spouse and four children. Of her four children, one of them has settled into marriage and lives separately from them.

Emma has been operating her small store for three years. She has been doing this to earn an income to provide her family's needs. Aside from her retailing business, she is also engaged in a hog raising business to earn additional income. 

One of Emma's marketing strategies nowadays is to offer the merchandise needed within their village to encourage more costumers to buy her products. So, Emma is asking for a loan amount of 15,000 PHP to stock more grocery items in her variety store. In this way, her sales and profit will also increase.

Emma is hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life and earn greater profits. Emma believes that through her determination and patience she could be a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: to buy stock grocery items for her variety store

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. Carmen, está casada con el Sr. Juan, son padres de un niño de seis años, viven en Ciudad del Este. 
Carmen es peluquera, tiene un salón de belleza a metros de su domicilio sobre la una avenida estratégica, está dedicada a esto hace siete años, cuenta con una clientela formada debido a que no posee competencia es esa zona, su marido, el señor Juan es empleado de una empresa de transporte como chófer. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, tijeras, y demás insumos para abastecer a su negocio y cumplir con sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, pues el crédito le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Carmen is married to Juan and they are the parents of a 6-year-old boy. They live in Ciudad del Este.

Carmen is a hairstylist and has a beauty salon just meters from her home on a strategic avenue. She has been doing this for seven years and has a regular clientele since she does not have any competition in the area. Her husband Juan is employed by a transportation business as a driver.

She is requesting the loan to buy dye, shampoo, conditioner, scissors, and other supplies with which to supply her business and satisfy her customers. She thanks the foundation for the opportunity they have given her as the loan will be of great assistance to her.

loans.use: to buy dye, shampoo, conditioner, scissors, and other supplies.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a married father of four children aged between 14 and 2 years. He has been actively farming for 16 years with his farm currently producing tea and milk for the local market. His first loan with Juhudi Kilimo was 50,000 KES.

Charles has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. He says he will use the income to educate his children as well as provide their daily upkeep requirements. He says he sees a brighter future with dairy farming with the provision of a loan from Juhudi Kilimo and hopes to make his dairy farm a big business.

Charles appreciates Juhudi Kilimo loan services but laments on the rampant fluctuation in milk prices in the market.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en: Crispina is a 58-year-old married woman with 3 children. Her youngest child still goes to school. Crispina has been in the business of raising hogs for 30 years. She plans to use her loan to purchase piglets and materials to improve her pig pen. She earns about 10,000 PHP per month with her business. She works hard to improve her business and to support her family. She hopes for her children to have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and materials to improve her pig pen.

loans.name: Luz Adilia

texts.es: Luz Adilia tiene 58 años de edad, su actividad económica a la que se dedica es a la venta de tajadas, enchiladas y tortillas, este negocio lo inicio con capital propio en el cual ha salido adelante con mucho esfuerzos y para generar ingresos a la familia. Luz Adilia su actividad económica la realiza de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación, ella tiene sus clientes fijos y eventuales. Luz Adilia está solicitando crédito para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de las tajadas, enchiladas, y tortillas.
texts.en: Luz Adilia is 58 years old. She sells tajadas, enchiladas and tortillas. She started her business with her own capital and has had to make a great effort to get ahead and generate an income for her family. Luz Adilia sells her food as a street vendor but also from home. She has steady as well as one-off customers. Luz Adilia is requesting the loan to buy the ingredients to make tajadas, enchiladas and tortillas.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients to make tajadas, tortillas and enchiladas.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Andrés Avelino Cáceres” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.

Alejandrina tiene 53 años de edad y es viuda pero tiene siete hijos, él nació en el distrito de Cusco de la provincia de Cusco departamento del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Su actividad económica principal de Alejandrina es la venta de golosinas en la puerta de un colegio de la ciudad del Cusco ósea de forma ambulatoria. También, Alejandrina se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su propia tienda de abarrotes. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Alejandrina requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro.
texts.en:
The “Andres Avelino Caceres” communal bank is composed of responsible, hard-working people who are advancing their families. The majority of its members live in the city of Cusco where they also conduct their economic activities. Cusco is known for being a popular tourist and commercial zone, famous for its traditional  “Inti Raymi” festival, and because nearby you'll find one of the 7 marvels of the world, “Machupicchu.”

Alejandrina is 53 years old and a widow, but she has 7 children. She was born in the district, province, and department of Cusco where she still lives. Alejandrina's principal economic activity is selling sweets at the door of a school in the city of Cusco, or on foot in the streets. In addition, Alejandrina sells products of primary necessity in her own little grocery store. She has been in this business for 4 years and it is going well for her. 

On this occasion, Alejandrina needs a loan to pay for maintenance of her car.

loans.use: to repair her car.

loans.name: Agahozo Cb Group

texts.en:
Charlotte is 33 years old. She is the mother of five children aged between five months and 11 years.

She is a group leader of Agahozo, which in English means "coolness". The group members do different types of businesses such as retail, manufacturing, and general stores, but they all have a common understanding of helping each other as a ladder to achieving a big dream for each of the staff members.

With the loan, Charlotte wants to buy more fruits such as tree tomatoes, passion fruit and apples to sell. She plans to use the profits for reinvesting in the business.

loans.use: to buy more tree tomatoes, passion fruit and apples to sell

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
A loan of $ 500 will see Rita enrolled in Kenyatta University come January 2016 taking Bachelor Degree in Security Management and Police Studies.
Borrower and Loan Descriptions.
Rita is a 21-year old girl from Kenya-Nairobi who comes from a single parented family of five. Her mother not being able to support her further her studies, Rita’s determination and thirst for education and a successful future led her to Digital Divide Data (DDD). DDD operates on a work study program where the beneficiaries are provided partial scholarship but she needs to cover the remaining cost of tuition fee.
Rita’s main goal is to be a security professional with a degree in the same field working either in governmental agencies, corporate security or with private security firms that deals with security operations. Rita plans to provide a secure environment favorable to everyone by fighting crime and corruption in her society after graduating successfully.

loans.use: TO PAY FOR UNIVERSITY TUITION FEES

loans.name: Doko

texts.en:
Born in Agbodrafo in 1956, Ms Doko M. A. is married and the mother of four (4) children. Her husband, a longshoreman at the port of Lomé, does not have a stable income. Her father is constantly ill and she still has to look after him. Consequently, nearly all of the family’s responsibilities are on her shoulders. A very dynamic and enterprising person, she went into business in order to meet the basic needs of her increased family. Her well-managed store could be more profitable if she had the working capital she needs. Despite being extremely poor, she is widely respected. This assessment was confirmed by the successful repayment of her two previous loans of $300 and $550 respectively, which were regularly paid off without difficulty.

Ms Doko M. A. is now asking for a loan of $850 to develop her grocery store and thereby increase her income, enabling her to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel KUEY/J.V. Guy-Bray:

Née à Agbodrafo en 1956, Madame M. A. Doko est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Son mari, docker au port de Lomé, n’a pas de revenus fixes. Son père est constamment malade est encore à sa charge. Ainsi, presque toutes les charges de la famille repose sur elle. Très dynamique et entreprenante, elle s’est lancée dans les activités commerciales à travers lesquelles, elle subvient aux besoins élémentaires de sa famille élargie. Son commerce qu’elle maîtrise bien pourrait lui plus rentable si elle disposait d’un fonds de roulement consistant. Malgré son état d’extrême pauvreté, elle a le respect du bien d’autrui. Cela s’est confirmé à travers ses deux crédits respectifs de $300 et $550 obtenus et régulièrement remboursé sans incident. Aujourd’hui, Madame M. A. Doko sollicite un crédit de $850 pour accroître son commerce d’alimentation générale et de facto, augmenter ses revenus lui permettant d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will invest the capital in the purchase of materials (cement, sand, etc.) in order to increase her production and cover her  clients' orders.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Hannah would like to buy six bags of maize and six bags of other cereal foods

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: Aminata K. is forty-five years of age and married with six children. Aminata runs a dried fish business in the market in Magburaka town in Sierra Leone.  Her previous loan from SMT helped her buy fish wholesale and now she sells both wholesale and retail.  She would like an additional loan to enable her buy more fish and sell even more wholesale.  Her goal is to continue to provide her children with education and other basic needs.  Eventually, she also would like to build a mud brick house for herself and her children.

loans.use: Purchase stock of fish to sell wholesale

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Description of Business

Antonio has 15 years of experience in his business. He has always worked selling grocery items. With his efforts, he has been able to secure a shop. He works every day of the week from 6am until 9pm. His children help him in the business. They also sell cooking gas from their home.

Use of Loan

With the loan, he will buy groceries, colas, juices, yogurts and beans, to be able to meet the demands of the people in his area.

Personal Information

Antonio is 51 years old, and married with four children. His wife has been working for three years packing boxes every day of the week. Their older children work and help with the household costs. Their small house is made of cement. They hope to improve their income with the investment they make.

Descripción del Negocio

Antonio tiene una experiencia de 15 años con su actividad. Siempre ha sido comerciante de víveres. Con su esfuerzo logro poner el local de venta de víveres. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 6 a.m. hasta las 9 p.m. Sus hijos le ayudan en la atención del negocio. Además en su domicilio también vende gas de uso domestico.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de víveres, colas, jugos, yogurt, legumbres. Poder satisfacer la demanda que tiene de gente de su sector.

Información Personal

Antonio es casado. Tiene 51 años y 4 hijos. Su esposa trabaja hace tres años en una empacadora todos los días de la semana. Sus hijos mayores trabajan y le ayudan con los gastos del hogar. Su casita es de cemento. Espera poder mejorar sus ingresos con la inversión que realizara.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Buy merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
Herminia is a single mother of 3 children to whom she has tried to give them the best. Sometimes she has been successful and sometimes she has made mistakes that have marked her life forever. Herminia has been working for a long time doing maintenance job at the city council. In this job she has the afternoons off and she uses this time to work on her own business. The first opportunity that she had was with a bar that was given to her. She left one of her children in charge of dispatching drinks, nevertheless after a time, due to lack of administration she had to close the business. After this terrible defeat, she continued looking for a business opportunity until in 2005 she was convinced by a neighbor to start selling clothes since her sister use to send packs of used clothes and Herminia liked the idea. She began selling on the sidewalk of her house, since there is a market in front of her house, and since then she has been trying to improve her business.

However, today she is requesting help to be able to stock her clothing business and have a more structured business with more merchandise available to her customers. The loan she is requesting is for the amount of $475.00 and she will repay the loan in four months. With your help Herminia will be able to increase her business opportunity to better support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Yvette Díaz, Kiva Volunteer.

Herminia, es Madre soltera de 3 hijos, a quienes ella con mucho esfuerzo a tratado de sacarlos adelante. En ocasiones con aciertos y en otras con errores que marcan para siempre su vida. Herminia trabaja desde hace mucho tiempo como personal de limpieza en el ayuntamiento, y su horario le deja las tardes libres, por lo que ella a buscado la manera de salir adelante haciendo su propio negocio. La primer oportunidad que se le presentó, fue que le traspasaron un bar, y ella accedió, dejando a uno de sus hijos a cargo de despachar las bebidas, sin embargo al cabo de un tiempo, por falta de administración tuvo que cerrar el negocio. Después de esta terrible derrota, siguió buscando hasta que en el 2005 una vecina la animó para que vendiera ropa usada ya que una hermana de su vecina le mandaba pacas de ropa usada y a Herminia le gustó la idea. Comenzó vendiendo en la banqueta de su casa, ya que enfrente de su casa se instala un mercado rodante, y desde entonces a tratado de sacar su negocio a flote.

Sin embargo hoy está solicitando ayuda para poder surtir su negocio de ropa y así poner un establecimiento un poco más estructurado y con más mercancía para que su clientela vea más surdido. El crédito que está solicitando es de US $475 para pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses. Y así poder surtir su negocio. Con tu ayuda Herminia podrá crecer su negocio para sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for the winter season

loans.name: Seema

texts.en: I am Seema B.. I am married have seven children: three boys and four girls. I live with my family in a small brick house in Raiwind, a town known in Pakistan for its dairy production.   My husband deals in livestock to make a living. He buys and sells cows, goats, and sheep. We would like to expand our business and request a loan of $200. With this loan my husband plans to buy few sheep and goats.

loans.use: To buy sheep and goats

loans.name: Alexan

texts.en: Alexan is a 52 year old father of twins. He lives in the region of Beirut with his family. He owns a mini market and provides for his family with the revenue generated by the mini mart. This is  Alexan's 12th loan from Al Majmoua, as he is always planning to develop his grocery store. He needs to buy enough merchandise to continue expanding his store.

loans.use: To buy enough merchandise

loans.name: Kavule A Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Josephine M.. She is currently in the business of livestock farming and is requesting a loan to add a piggery and poultry business. Josephine is 48 years old and married. Her husband is a businessman. She has 5 children ranging in age from 24 to 30, and her children go to school.

Josephine has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before, in the amount of UGX 500000 (~ $290 USD), to invest in her business, and she paid the loan back on time.

Josephine is joined in her small group by Eliyosi Batogole, Harriet Naluwebe, Nowe K., and Jamira N.. Eliyosi Batogole has a hardware business and wants to increase her stock. Harriet Naluwebe has a business selling firewood and wants a loan to add to her business. Nowe K. operates a poultry business and wants to buy more chicks. Jamira N. sells matooke (plantain bananas) and is requesting a loan to purchase more matooke from the village to sell.

loans.use: To expand livestock business

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Mrs. Lang M., age 36, sells fish and variety of vegetables in a busy market, normally earning approximately $8 a day. Her husband fishes for a living. After catching fish, he sells his catch in the market to earn about $8 a day. They have 6 children, one of whom works as a garment worker with a salary $80 a month.

He aims to purchase a new motor for his boat to replace his old, unreliable motor and fishing equipment, such as nets. This will help him to catch more fish to sell in the market and increase the family’s income.

loans.use: Purchasing new motor for a boat and fishing nets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more wine, juice and drinks for sale

loans.name: Suzan Namulindwa's Gakuweebwa Munno Group

texts.en: Suzan N. and Joyce M. are members of Gakuweebwa Munno women’s group in Lugazi. For 10 years, Suzan has been selling new clothes at daily markets called "mubuulo." She buys the clothes from Kampala. She is married with four children plus three relatives in her care, and she would like a loan to help with buying more clothes for her stock. Joyce has a retail shop in Kakonko, Lugazi, that sells sugar, soap, salt, beans and biscuits, and she would like a loan to help with restocking her shop so as to attract more customers. Joyce is married with five kids and cares for two of her in-laws.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, sugar, soap, salt, biscuits and beans to sell

loans.name: Argentina

texts.en: Argentina is the mother of 3 children and several grandchildren.  She owns and operates a beauty salon in her community.  She is diabetic and struggles with getting the medical attention she needs.  She dreams of one day adding a second story to her house.  With the loan money, Argentina plans to grow her business so that she can better take care of herself and pursue her dreams.

loans.use: To grow her beauty salon business and support her family

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Awa B., 46, is married and has been a member of the Peyrissac village bank for five years. She would like to develop her business of selling fresh fish. Awa buys barrels of large and small fish and sells them wholesale and retail wholesale at the market in Ziguinchor. With her income, she helps pay for her family’s expenses and health care. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid in six months in one single installment.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Awa B., 46 ans, mariée est membre du banc villageois de Peyrissac depuis 5 ans. Elle veut renforcer son commerce de poissons frais. Awa achète des bassines de gros poissons et des poissons de friture et vend en gros et demi gros sur le marché de Ziguinchor. Avec ses revenus elle participe à la dépense familiale et aux soins médicaux. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of fish

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru:
Gulchehra K. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 43 years old, married, and has three children. She has a high school education. Her husband is a construction worker, but does not earn enough money to support the family. To bring in more income for her family, Gulchehra decided to buy a Tiko brand car and rent it out. A loan will help her purchase the car. She will pay back the loan over 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Кодирова Гульчехра проживает в городе Турсун-Заде. Возраст 43 года. Замужем и имеет троих детей. Образование среднее. Муж работает на стройке, но его заработка не хватает для того , чтобы прокормить семью. Поэтому Гульчехра решила купить автомашину марки « Тико» и отдать в аренду. Это принесет ее семье дополнительный доход. Купить машину ей поможет получение кредита. Погасить кредит она сможет в течение 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Vehicle purchase

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
Martha is a member of the Ayllu communal bank, which means “Family” in Quechua. She is 32 years old and separated, and has 3 children. Martha lives in the Carmen Alto district and is the only person who takes care of her children. Martha travels to the Sachabamba market once a week and stays for two days, where she sells various articles of clothing. At the market she buys cheese and young animals, which she sells in the city of Ayacucho. She sells the animals live and sells the cheese door to door.

Martha needs a loan of 1,050 soles ($375), which will be used to buy track suits, sweaters and aprons. Martha’s dreams are to get ahead with her children, have a secure job, and that her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Martha es socia del Banco Comunal Ayllu que significa Familia en quechua. Martha es separada, tiene 32 años y 3 hijos, Martha vive en el distrito de Carmen Alto, siendo ella la única persona que mantiene a sus hijos, Martha viaja a la feria de Sachabamba 1 vez por semana y se queda 2 días, Martha vende ropa variada y de la feria compra quesos, animales menores, que vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho, los animales lo vende vivo mientras que los quesos vende de casa en casa.

Martha necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de buzos, chompas y mandiles. Los sueños de Martha son salir adelante con sus hijos, tener un trabajo seguro y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.

loans.use: Buy track suits, sweaters and aprons

loans.name: Mine

texts.en: Mine A. is 29 years old and married with one child.  She has worked for two years in the barbecue business, where she cooks and sells food with her husband to people in her village. Mine earns about $165 per week, and has successfully repaid two loans.  Because microfinance is her only access to capital, Mine is now requesting a loan of $475 to purchase equipment that will her improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase barbecue equipment.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando tiene 19 años, es soltero vive solo. Se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, el cual distribuye en las diversas ferias de la ciudad, criando a los animales en su casa, alimentándolos debidamente para hacerlos más atractivos a los compradores. Usualmente el trabajo de Rolando comienza muy temprano por las mañanas, cuando debe alimentar a los cerdos y demás animales que tiene, para luego viajar a las provincias y distritos de la zona a ofrecerlos a la venta, regresando muy  tarde de su jornada laboral, haciendo que el viajar sea lo más cansado de su trabajo. El motivo del esfuerzo de este joven, es ser un hombre de provecho a la sociedad, con un futuro prometedor. Con el dinero que obtenga del préstamo comprará más ganado, alimento balanceado, y algunas medicinas para mantener saludables a sus animales, y así lograr mejores ingresos. En el futuro, le gustaría tener otro negocio, paralelo a este, pero aun está definiendo el rubro de este.
texts.en:
Rolando is 19 years old, he is single and lives alone. He buys and sells livestock which he distributes in the different markets of the city, raising the animals in his home, feeding them properly so that they will be more attractive to buyers. Rolando's work usually starts very early in the morning, when he must feed his pigs and other animals before traveling to the provinces and districts of the zone to sell them, getting back from his working day very late as traveling is the most tiring part of his work. This young man works to be a worthwhile member of society, with a promising future. With the money that he gets from the loan he will buy more livestock, balanced feed and some medicines to keep his animals healthy and thereby earn better. In the future he would like to have another business running parallel to this one, but he is still defining where this one is going.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the amount of livestock that he has, and also to buy feed and medicines for the animals/Incrementar la cantidad de ganado que tiene, además de comprar alimento y medicinas para los animales.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
En el municipio de Nagarote de la ciudad de León la señora Martha Lorena C. se dedica con gran esfuerzo a su negocio de venta de comida específicamente se destaca en la venta de carne de cerdo el cual comercializa en su casa de habitación en su municipio.

La labor de esta dama es muy fuerte por la razón de que tiene el deber de comprar los cerdos luego los destaza, prepara la carne y una vez que todo está listo comercializa la carne y a la vez prepara alimentos para su venta. Todo esto lo hace con el propósito de mantener su núcleo familiar compuesto por sus dos hijos en edades escolares. Por este motivo espera que su crédito sea otorgado para continuar con sus esfuerzos en la actividad económica que se dedica en su municipio.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Nagarote in the city of León, Mrs. Martha Lorena C. sells food, especially pork, which she sells out of her home. Martha runs a very good business, as she first purchases the meat, later cleans and prepares it, and once it is ready, sells the meat as well as uses it in other dishes. Martha does all of this so that she can support her family, which is comprised of her two school-aged children. Because of this, she hopes to receive the loan and to continue her efforts in her food sales business.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs

loans.name: Rahimdjon

texts.en:
Rahimdjon R. is a hard-working man. Over the years, he has been focused on strengthening the family business - cattle sales - so he can provide for his children. With the experience he has gained over the last 15 years in business, he has been able to grow his business and bring stability to his family.

Rahimdjon has a friendly family who always try to help each other. In the photo, you can see his wife who helps him with the business. Now Rahimdjon has decided to build his own business raising animals. He will care for the animals for a short period of time and then sell them at his city's large stock shows. Therefore, he has requested 4,000 Somoni ($1,200 USD) for the term of 5 months.

Rahimdjon has already received one loan from Kiva. Thanks to his previous loan, he was able to increase the number of cows he cared for and improve his business. Rahimdjon is counting on your help once again and thanks you very much for your love and support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. History of note includes: it was once a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki; and the birthplace of the most famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina (Avicenna). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have a viable business proposition when they request a loan. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and IMON will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Quê năm nay 45 tuổi , gia đình chị có 3 con trong đó có hai con đang tuổi đến trường. Năm 1999 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn . Đến nay sau 10 năm tham gia Quỹ tình thương gia đình chị đã có thêm nguồn vốn để đầu tư mở rộng chăn nuôi thêm vịt, gà. Hiện tại chăn nuôi cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ thnág
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay  10.000.000đ để mua thêm 300 con gà giống về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen thi Q. is 45 years old. She has three children, two of them are in school age. In 1999 she joined the TYM Fund and borrowed money to invest in raising pigs. After 10 years participation with TYM Fund, her family has additional cash to invest in raising ducks and chickens. Currently, raising ducks and chickens is the main source of income for her family with an average monthly income of VND2,000,000.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND10,000,000 to buy additional 300 chickens to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy additional 300 chickens to raise

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan, 41, lives in Bekaa with his wife and their four children. He has been breeding livestock for six years. Hasan is requesting a loan of $1000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase feed for the livestock and to repay his debts. This is the first time that Hasan has requested a loan. His clients are the markets of his region. Hasan decided on doing this business because he had experience breeding livestock. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase animal feed and repay debts

loans.name: Haydee Maritza

texts.es:
Haydee se dedica a la venta de mazamorras como ambulante desde  hace tres años, siempre vendía en la puerta de un colegio cercano a su casa. Anteriormente a este trabajo  vendía comida a pensión eventualmente durante cuatro años, según las temporadas de trabajo de los obreros (sus clientes). Cambió de negocio ya que la venta de mazamorras le era mucho más rentable. 
Empezó vendiendo frutas, cuando era más joven, en un mercado grande de otra localidad, Sin embargo cuando se mudo de vivienda se dedico por un tiempo al cuidado de sus hijos, uno de trece años y el segundo de siete.
Más adelante quisiera tener una tienda en su casa. Por otro lado, su pareja es chofer de una empresa de transportes, con este trabajo él se encarga de mantener el hogar. Por el momento Haydee ahorra sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Haydee sells mazamorras (a puréed corn dish) door-to-door for the past three years, whereas before she sold from the door of the school near her home. Before that she sold food to boarders for four years, with business dependent upon the seasonal workers (her clients). She changed businesses since selling mazamorras is more profitable. She started by selling fruits, when she was younger, at a large market in another neighborhood - when she moved, however, she spent time taking care of her children who are aged 13 and 7. In the future she would like to have her own shop from her home. At the same time, her partner, a driver with a transport company, maintains the family household. For now, Haydee is saving her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies for their children.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida C. owns a small rice field in her village. She is 46 years old and has three children attending school. School is quite expensive nowadays and she is worried about where to get the money since they only have a little income. Her husband is a farmer. They both work on the farm to grow rice. Their harvest is intended for family use and the remainder goes to rice traders for additional income.

She is asking a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI, Kiva's partner. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm. The loan will truly help her increase her yield. In that way, she could better support her family.

CEVI is helping people start and have their own businesses. They help provide credit for entrepreneurs, as well as training and insurance coverage to help their businesses to grow.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en:
Nhem S. is 44 years old and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She earns a daily income of $8 selling fresh fish and pork in the city’s garment district. She started her business in early 2000. She is a good mother who cares for four children, two of whom are employed as a security guard and a garment worker.

To help support the family, S.'s husband (also pictured) drives a motorbike taxi. The family has faced difficult living conditions for a long time because their house is old and frequently needs repairs. S. is requesting a loan of $800. She will use half of the money to repair her house and the rest to expand her business.

loans.use: To repair her house and expand her business.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia A. manages a piggery business. She raises six pigs and two sows in the back of her house. At first she faced a lot of challenges to sustain her business. Thanks to CEVI, who partnered with her in managing the finances of her piggery, she has.

She is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy feed for her pigs. The loan will help Ofelia grow her business.

CEVI is reaching out to more people to start and have their own businesses. It provides not just loans but also training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase feeds

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy C., 33-year old mother of three children, shared her life story to CEVI. She says she has been a tenant farmer for a long time already. Some of their harvest goes to the owner of the farm that they are working. They want to buy their own farm. She needs to expand her harvest to realize that dream.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 14,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase 8 sacks of fertilizers, herbicides and 40 liters of gasoline. She hopes that by availing a loan to finance her farm, she will be able to improve their harvest.

CEVI aims to help small business grow. They provide credit assistance, training and insurance to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase 8 sacks of fertilizers, herbicides and 40 liters of gasoline.

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni A. makes a living selling tomatoes and green vegetables and is applying for this loan to buy more green vegetables to sell. Poni is 29 years old and single. With the income made possible by this loan, she hopes to be able to buy a taxi and open up a new business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy more green vegetables to sell
